title: Distributed Adaptive Neural Network Output Tracking of Leader-Following High-Order Stochastic Nonlinear Multiagent Systems With Unknown Dead-Zone Input
abstract: This paper studies the problem of distributed output tracking consensus control for a class high-order stochastic nonlinear multiagent systems with unknown dead-zone under directed graph topology. The adaptive neural networks are used to approximate functions and new inequality is deal completely input. Then, we design controllers based on backstepping method dynamic surface technique. It strictly proved that resulting closed-loop system stable in probability sense semiglobally uniform ultimate boundedness errors between leader followers approach small residual set Lyapunov stability theory. Finally, two simulation examples presented show effectiveness advantages proposed techniques.

Autonomous Gas Detection and Mapping With Unmanned Aerial Vehicles
abstract: Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) are nowadays largely employed in civil applications. One of the most promising applications is environmental monitoring (or risk assessment). We propose a battery-powered eNose board that can be embedded with any type drone. evaluated effectiveness sensing method by means field experiments using prototype as payload hexacopter. The results show analysis target parameters not perturbed air flow generated propellers. system suitable for mobile carrier (UAVs or wheeled robots), thanks to its lightweight and compact form factor. To further extend limited flight autonomy carrier, we developed an optimal algorithm gas leakage localization, simulating framework evaluate performance, provide design space exploration solar-powered drones.

title: Five‐descriptor model to predict the chromatographic sequence of natural compounds
abstract: Despite the recent introduction of mass detection techniques, ultraviolet is still widely applied in field chromatographic analysis natural medicines. Here, a neural network cascade model consisting nine small artificial units was innovatively developed to predict sequence compounds by integrating five molecular descriptors as input. A total 117 known structure were collected for building. The order appearance each compound determined gradient chromatography. Strong linear correlation found between predicted and actual position orders (Spearman's rho = 0.883, p < 0.0001). Application external validation set shown dramatically increase prediction accuracy real multiple compounds. case study shows that based on facilitated identification fingerprint Radix Salvia miltiorrhiza . For medicines composition, our method provides feasible means identifying constituents interest when only available.

Strong linear correlation found between predicted and actual position orders (Spearman's rho = 0.883, p < 0.0001). Application external validation set shown dramatically increase prediction accuracy real multiple compounds. case study shows that based on facilitated identification fingerprint Radix Salvia miltiorrhiza . For medicines composition, our method provides feasible means identifying constituents interest when only available. title: Development of Educational Model for ICT-based Convergence Expert
abstract: ICT 기반의 융합전문가를 양성하기 위해서는 사물인터넷 활용 능력을 학습하여야 한다. 본 논문에서는 컴퓨터학을 전공한 교육생을 대상으로 5개월의 관련 교육을 실시하여 융합전문가로 위한 교육과정과 교육운영 전반을 다루는 교육모형 설계에 대한 내용을 기술한다. 교육과정은 기본역량과정, 핵심역량과정, 실전역량과정 그리고 현장연수과정으로 구분하여 총 10단계의 세부과정으로 구성하였다. 교과과정은 센싱기술, 네트워크기술, 보안 및 콘테츠 제작기술을 학습하도록 설계하였다. 교육모형은 2015년 고용노동부의 일자리창출 인력양성사업에 활용되어 높은 수료율과 취업률을 달성하는데 기여하여 효용성을 입증하였으며, 추후 대학교육에 적용할 수 있도록 Java 과정을 보완하는 등 교과과정을 확장할 계획이다. To train convergence experts infrastructure must be learned IoT use capabilities of things. In this paper, targeted to students that are majoring in computer science, and for the design curriculum educational model handles education operation general training IoT-related five months describe contents. Course is basic ability process, core competence course, divided into real-life capability process on-site was constructed a total 10 stages details. Curriculum, it designed learn sensing technology, network security, content production technology. This utilized job creation human resource project 2015 Ministry Employment Labor, demonstrated utility contribute order achieve high completion employment rate. Applicable future university plans expand curriculum, including courses complement Java.

title: Combination of Cloud Computing and Internet of Things (IOT) in Medical Monitoring Systems
abstract: With the fast development of cloud computing and computer science technology, combination IOT clod in medical-assisted environment is urgently needed. The prior research focus more on individual single technique, quite a less field medical monitoring managing service application have been conducted. Therefore, this paper, we study analyze Internet Things environment. We are trying to make two kinds technology management information system hospital. Remote platform architecture model (RMCPHI) set up first place. Then RMCPHI was analyzed. Eventually, last effective PSOSAA algorithm proposed hospital application. Experimental simulation illustrates that outperforms other state-of-the-art algorithms. Further potential areas discussed.

title: Using Co-authorship Networks to Map and Analyse Global Neglected Tropical Disease Research with an Affiliation to Germany
abstract: The share of NTD publications with German affiliations is approximately half its in other fields medical research. This finding underlines the need to identify barriers and expand Germany's otherwise strong research activities towards NTDs. A geospatial analysis collaborations partners abroad can support decisions strengthen capacity, particularly low- middle-income countries, which were less involved than high-income countries. Identifying knowledge hubs within individual researcher networks complements traditional scientometric indicators that are used opportunities for collaboration. title: Comprehensive Evaluation of High-Resolution Satellite-Based Precipitation Products over China
abstract: Characterizing the errors in satellite-based precipitation estimation products is crucial for understanding their effects hydrological applications. Six derived from three algorithms are comprehensively evaluated against gauge data over mainland China December 2006 to November 2010. These include satellite-only estimates: Global Satellite Mapping of Precipitation Microwave-IR Combined Product (GSMaP_MVK), Climate Prediction Center (CPC) MORPHing (CMORPH), and Estimation Remotely Sensed Information using Artificial Neural Networks (PERSIANN), as well gauge-corrected counterparts: GSMaP Gauge-calibrated (GSMaP_Gauge), bias-corrected CMORPH (CMORPH_CRT), PERSIANN Data Record (PERSIANN-CDR). Overall, bias-correction procedures largely reduce various groups products. GSMaP_Gauge produces better fractional coverage with highest correlation (0.95) lowest RMSE (0.53 mm/day) but also high RB (15.77%). In general, CMORPH_CRT amounts closer reference. shows performance than GSMaP_MVK CC (0.82) (0.93 mm/day), presents a relatively (−19.60%). winter, all six satellite estimates have comparatively poor capability, IR-based PERSIANN_CDR exhibiting closest Both show capability detecting occurrence low POD (<50%) CSI (<35%) FAR (>40%).

title: The Design Evolution of a Sensing and Force-Feedback Exoskeleton Robotic Glove for Hand Rehabilitation Application
abstract: This paper presents the design evolution of sensing and force-feedback exoskeleton robotic (SAFER) glove with application to hand rehabilitation. title: Optimization of a Single-Channel Pump Impeller for Wastewater Treatment
abstract: As a single-channel pump is used for wastewater treatment, this particular type can prevent performance reduction or damage caused by foreign substances. However, the design methods pumps are different and more difficult than those general pumps. In study, optimization method to improve hydrodynamic of impeller implemented. Numerical analysis was carried out solving three-dimensional steady-state incompressible Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations using shear stress transport turbulence model. state-of-the-art method, two variables related controlling internal cross-sectional flow area were selected optimization. Efficiency as objective function numerically assessed at twelve points Latin hypercube sampling in space. An process based on radial basis neural network model conducted systematically, optimum finally evaluated through an experimental test. Consequently, showed improved compared with base model, unstable components previously observed suppressed remarkably well.
detailed_text: As a single-channel pump is used for wastewater treatment, this particular type can prevent performance reduction or damage caused by foreign substances. However, the design methods pumps are different and more difficult than those general pumps. In study, optimization method to improve hydrodynamic of impeller implemented. Numerical analysis was carried out solving three-dimensional steady-state incompressible Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations using shear stress transport turbulence model. state-of-the-art method, two variables related controlling internal cross-sectional flow area were selected optimization. Efficiency as objective function numerically assessed at twelve points Latin hypercube sampling in space. An process based on radial basis neural network model conducted systematically, optimum finally evaluated through an experimental test. Consequently, showed improved compared with base model, unstable components previously observed suppressed remarkably well. Optimization of a Single-Channel Pump Impeller for Wastewater Treatment

title: Evaluating the More Suitable ISM Frequency Band for IoT-Based Smart Grids: A Quantitative Study of 915 MHz vs. 2400 MHz
abstract: IoT has begun to be employed pervasively in industrial environments and critical infrastructures thanks its positive impact on performance efficiency. Among these environments, the Smart Grid (SG) excels as perfect host for this technology, mainly due potential become motor of rest electrically-dependent infrastructures. To make SG-oriented cost-effective, most deployments employ unlicensed ISM bands, specifically 2400 MHz one, extended communication bandwidth comparison with lower bands. This band been extensively used years by Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) Mobile Ad-hoc (MANET), from which technologically inherits. However, work questions evaluates suitability such a “default” SG compared 915 band. A comprehensive quantitative bands accomplished terms of: power consumption, average network delay, packet reception rate. allow study, dual-band propagation model designed derived, tested, incorporated into well-known TOSSIM simulator. Simulation results reveal that only absence other interfering devices (such WiFi or Bluetooth) small networks, is best option. In any case, quantitatively perform better if operating

title: Nine States HCI using Electrooculogram and Neural Networks
abstract: Human Computer Interface (HCI) translate biosignals to control external devices like computers wheelchairs, mouse and keyboard.This paper presents the feasibility of creating one such HCI using Electroooculography.Electrooculography is a technique measuring potential difference between cornea retina eye.Most EOG based have focused on two four six states, this study focuses increasing possible states nine states.Two new eye movements were proposed.The proposed reference power was applied extract features from twenty subjects.Layered recurrent neural networks used classify different movement task signals.Experimental results validate eleven signals for designing HCI.From result it proved that with Layered Recurrent Neural Network.

title: Tuning the Parameters of a Convolutional Artificial Neural Network by Using Covering Arrays
abstract: Artificial Neural Networks have proven to be a very powerful machine learning algorithm which can adequate learn successfully variety of tasks.Currently, complex classification problems on different kind data (images, video, sound, text, DNA) been solved using neural networks.This algorithms usually has many parameters that need fine-tuned in order good results.Usually, this tuning is made by trial and error.However, procedure does not guarantee the optimal performance training process.In work, we study use mixed-level covering arrays design experiments help us find best combinations parameters.We tested approach convolutional network for an audio task.For implementation, took advantage flexibility open source software library TensorFlow.

title: Hybrid Neural Network Model for Metocean Data Analysis
abstract: Metocean time-series data is generally classified as highly chaotic thus making the analysis process tedious. The main aim of forecasting to obtain an effective solution for offshore engineering projects, such environmental conditions vital choices made during planning and operational stage which must be efficient robust. This paper presents empirical using a hybrid neural network model by performing multi-step-ahead forecasts. proposed trained gauss approximated Bayesian regulation algorithm. Performance based on error metrics shows that provides better forecasts in comparison previously used models.

title: Hypolipidemic and Hypocholesterolemic Effect of Roselle (<i>Hibiscus sabdariffa</i> L.) Seeds Oil in Experimental Male Rats
abstract: The current investigation aimed to evaluate the influence of roselle seeds oil (RSO), coconut (CNO) and binary mixture them on serum lipids experimental rats. title: PREDICTING THE PROPERTIES OF CORRUGATED BASE PAPERS USING MULTIPLE LINEAR REGRESSION AND ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORKS
abstract: The difficulty in predicting the properties and behaviour of paper products produced using heterogeneous raw materials with high percentages recovered fibres poses restrictions on their efficient effective use as corrugated packaging materials. This work presents predictive models for mechanical base papers (liner fluting-medium) from fibre physical property data multiple linear regression artificial neural networks. most significant results were obtained prediction tensile strength liners cross direction origin (wood type, pulp method) regression, compressive fluting-medium longitudinal (machine) direction, according to short-span test, a network one hidden layer 6 neurons, coefficients determination at 95.14% 99.28%, respectively

title: PRIOR: Prioritized Forwarding for Opportunistic Routing
abstract: In ad hoc networks, broadcast forwarding protocols called OR (opportunistic routing) have been proposed to gain path diversity for higher packet delivery rates and shorter end-to-end delays. general backoff-based protocols, each receiver autonomously makes a decision by using certain metrics determine if random backoff time is be applied. However, forwarder candidate must wait the expiration of timer before packet. Moreover, they cannot includes local sparse areas, this degrades performance as it strongly depends on terminal density. paper, we propose novel protocol PRIOR (prioritized opportunistic routing). PRIOR, terminal, prioritized which forwards packets without time, selected from among neighbours. addition, uses lightweight hop-by-hop retransmission control mitigate effect introduce an enhancement reduce unnecessary explicit acknowledgement. We evaluate in comparison with conventional computer simulations.
detailed_text: In ad hoc networks, broadcast forwarding protocols called OR (opportunistic routing) have been proposed to gain path diversity for higher packet delivery rates and shorter end-to-end delays. general backoff-based protocols, each receiver autonomously makes a decision by using certain metrics determine if random backoff time is be applied. However, forwarder candidate must wait the expiration of timer before packet. Moreover, they cannot includes local sparse areas, this degrades performance as it strongly depends on terminal density. paper, we propose novel protocol PRIOR (prioritized opportunistic routing). PRIOR, terminal, prioritized which forwards packets without time, selected from among neighbours. addition, uses lightweight hop-by-hop retransmission control mitigate effect introduce an enhancement reduce unnecessary explicit acknowledgement. We evaluate in comparison with conventional computer simulations. PRIOR: Prioritized Forwarding for Opportunistic Routing

title: Downscaling daily precipitation and temperatures over the Langat River Basin in Malaysia: A comparison of two statistical downscaling approaches
abstract:

title: The Development of Reusable Luggage Tag with the Internet of Things for Mobile Tracking and Environmental Sustainability
abstract: With more than two billion passengers worldwide travelling by air each year, vast amounts of lost luggage and disposable paper adhesive tags are pushing the aviation industry to improve tracking reduce one-off tags. title: Kimchi Packaging Technology : An Overview
abstract: This paper provides an overview of kimchi packaging technology, focusing on materials, package design, and active/intelligent technology for kimchi. From a packaging-material standpoint, although various materials have been used to ensure customer satisfaction convenience, plastic is the most widely material, in form bags, trays, pouches, rigid containers. Additionally, recent efforts industry allowed companies differentiate their products by using different technologies, while simultaneously improving product safety quality. On other hand, biggest problem excess CO2 production, leading expansion leakage. To alleviate this problem, use absorbers, high CO2-permeable films, degassing valves, addition systems, has investigated. Active and/or intelligent systems developed, include active functions beyond simply inert, passive containment protection product. However, such approaches are not yet adequately effective be useful commercial scale. Therefore, further studies needed resolve limitations each technology.

abstract: This paper proposes a new lightweight cipher VAYU.VAYU has balanced Feistel structure.VAYU supports 64 bit plaintext and 128/80 key length it total of 31 rounds.It needs only 1290 GEs for 128 length.It also results in minimal memory size as compared to all other existing ciphers.This discusses the security analysis VAYU design which is adequate against linear differential cryptanalysis, Biclique attack, zero correlation algebraic attack.VAYU will be best suitable applications like IoT, smart Wireless Sensor networks.VAYU uses two F-functions with substitution box, high diffusion mechanism.

title: Efficient Operation of Wind Turbine with Doubly Fed Induction Generator Using TLBO Algorithm and Artificial Neural Networks
abstract: This paper investigates efficient operation of the doubly-fed induction generator (DFIG) considering iron losses with active power control capability for typical wind turbine (WT) system. The objective is to determine optimal rotor voltage extract maximum from DFIG over wide ranges speed two strategies: efficiency strategy and stator UPF strategy. Teaching Learning Based Optimization (TLBO) algorithm used achieve above objective. ideal curve a 2 MW has been estimated design controller. Artificial neural network (ANN) controller as an adaptive dynamic predict value all operating points case strategies. With proposed strategy, DFIG-based WT provides point tracking (MPPT), fully overall system consideration developed using Matlab/Simulink environment.

title: Cyber-Physical Systems: A Literature Review
abstract: Cyber-physical systems (CPSs) are smart that depend on the synergy of cyber and physical components. They link world (e.g. through sensors, actuators, robotics, embedded systems) with virtual information processing. Applications CPS have tremendous potential improving convenience, comfort, safety in our daily life. This paper provides a brief introduction to CPSs their applications.

abstract: Political campaigns increasingly use data to (micro)target voters with tailored messages. In doing so, raise concerns about privacy and the quality of public discourse. Extending existing research a European context, we propose test model for understanding how different contextual factors hinder or facilitate data-driven capabilities campaigns. We applied during 2017 national election campaign in Netherlands. The results show targeting techniques are not only useful first-past-the-post system, but also proportional representation which at first sight seems be less suitable such techniques.

title: DeepGS: Predicting phenotypes from genotypes using Deep Learning
abstract: Abstract Motivation Genomic selection (GS) is a new breeding strategy by which the phenotypes of quantitative traits are usually predicted based on genome-wide markers genotypes using conventional statistical models. However, GS prediction models typically make strong assumptions and perform linear regression analysis, limiting their accuracies since they do not capture complex, non-linear relationships within genotypes, between phenotypes. Results We present deep learning method, named DeepGS, to predict from genotypes. Using convolutional neural network, DeepGS uses hidden variables that jointly represent features in genotypic when making predictions; it also employs convolution, sampling dropout strategies reduce complexity high-dimensional marker data. used large dataset train compare its performance with other methods. In terms mean normalized discounted cumulative gain value, achieves an increase 27.70%~246.34% over network selecting top-ranked 1% individuals high phenotypic values for eight tested traits. Additionally, compared widely method RR-BLUP, still yields relative improvement ranging 1.44% 65.24%. Through extensive simulation experiments, we demonstrated effectiveness robustness absent outlier subsets markers. Finally, illustrated complementarity RR-BLUP ensemble approach further improving performance. Availability provided as open source R package available at https://github.com/cma2015/DeepGS .

Results We present deep learning method, named DeepGS, to predict from genotypes. Using convolutional neural network, DeepGS uses hidden variables that jointly represent features in genotypic when making predictions; it also employs convolution, sampling dropout strategies reduce complexity high-dimensional marker data. used large dataset train compare its performance with other methods. In terms mean normalized discounted cumulative gain value, achieves an increase 27.70%~246.34% over network selecting top-ranked 1% individuals high phenotypic values for eight tested traits. Additionally, compared widely method RR-BLUP, still yields relative improvement ranging 1.44% 65.24%. Through extensive simulation experiments, we demonstrated effectiveness robustness absent outlier subsets markers. Finally, illustrated complementarity RR-BLUP ensemble approach further improving performance. Availability provided as open source R package available at https://github.com/cma2015/DeepGS . title: Design, Implementation, and Flight Tests of a Feedback Linearization Controller for Multirotor UAVs
abstract: This paper proposes a feedback-linearization-based control algorithm for multirotor unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). The feedback linearization scheme is highly efficient considering nonlinearity between the rotational and translational motion of UAVs. We also propose dynamic equation that reflects aerodynamic effects vehicles; equation’s parameters can be determined through curve fitting using actual flight data. derive controller from proposed equation, Luenberger observer to attenuate measurement noises. implemented our in-house computer, we describe its implementation in detail. To investigate performance algorithm, carry out two scenarios: first scenario, an autonomous landing on moving platform, test maneuverability; second, picking up replacing object, algorithm’s accuracy. In these scenarios, precisely controls UAVs, confirm it successfully applied real environments.

Reduction resulted 88.2, 68.5, 85.5% mealy, 82.8, 50.7, 46.8%, These results indicated that descriptors had at shorter times comparison which are commonly used evaluation images, even though more improvements still required.

title: (Neuro-)Cognitive poetics and computational stylistics
abstract: Abstract This perspective paper discusses four general desiderata of current computational stylistics and (neuro-)cognitive poetics concerning the development (a) appropriate databases/training corpora, (b) advanced qualitative-quantitative narrative analysis (Q2NA) machine learning tools for feature extraction, (c) ecologically valid literary test materials, (d) open-access reader-response data banks. In six explorative studies, it introduces a number that provide QNA indices foregrounding potential at sublexical, lexical, inter- supralexical levels poems by Shakespeare, Blake, or Dickens. These concern lexical diversity aesthetic potential, sentiment analysis, sublexical sonority scores phrase structure, topics analysis. The results illustrate complex interplay stylistic features necessity theoretical guidance interdisciplinary cooperation in selecting adequate training tools, texts, response measures.
detailed_text: Abstract This perspective paper discusses four general desiderata of current computational stylistics and (neuro-)cognitive poetics concerning the development (a) appropriate databases/training corpora, (b) advanced qualitative-quantitative narrative analysis (Q2NA) machine learning tools for feature extraction, (c) ecologically valid literary test materials, (d) open-access reader-response data banks. In six explorative studies, it introduces a number that provide QNA indices foregrounding potential at sublexical, lexical, inter- supralexical levels poems by Shakespeare, Blake, or Dickens. These concern lexical diversity aesthetic potential, sentiment analysis, sublexical sonority scores phrase structure, topics analysis. The results illustrate complex interplay stylistic features necessity theoretical guidance interdisciplinary cooperation in selecting adequate training tools, texts, response measures. (Neuro-)Cognitive poetics and computational stylistics

abstract: Discharge or water level predictions at tidally affected river reaches are currently still a great challenge in hydrological practices. Physics-based hydrodynamic approaches sometimes not applicable for prediction such tidal due uncertainty sources like rainfall forecasting data. However, became longer, increased 0.08 m (1 time) 0.28 (24 hrs decreased 0.99 0.74 time), respectively.

title: Exploiting the Potential of Artificial Intelligence in Decision Support Systems
abstract: For several years now, the concept of AI being able to quickly and extensively replace expert workers at massive scales has been on cusp becoming a reality. Although shown be an effective tool for many activities, humans still have significant advantage in other areas. Companies are more conscious this fact. As result, they restructuring their business processes provide experts customers with support targeted manner. This study aims present high-quality review that covers unique, cutting-edge technologies methodologies connected scientific design, development, implementation AI-DSS employing most recent developments multi-criteria decision-making. The will presented form report. article examines whether or not growth so-called artificial intelligence-driven decision systems, also known as AI-DSS, threatens decision-making and, if so, how threat manifests itself.

abstract: Edge computing provides a promising paradigm to support the implementation of Industrial Internet Things (IIoT) by offloading computational-intensive tasks from resource-limited machine-type devices (MTDs) powerful edge servers. However, performance gain may be severely compromised due limited spectrum resources, capacity-constrained batteries, and context unawareness. Finally, simulations are conducted under both single-MTD multi-MTD scenarios verify effectiveness framework.

Deep Learning-Based System for Automatic Melanoma Detection
abstract: Melanoma is the deadliest form of skin cancer. Distinguishing melanoma lesions from non-melanoma has however been a challenging task. Many Computer Aided Diagnosis and Detection Systems have developed in past for this They limited performance due to complex visual characteristics lesion images which consists inhomogeneous features fuzzy boundaries. In paper, we propose deep learning-based method that overcomes these limitations automatic detection segmentation. An enhanced encoder-decoder network with encoder decoder sub-networks connected through series skip pathways brings semantic level feature maps closer proposed efficient learning extraction. The system employs multi-stage multi-scale approach utilizes softmax classifier pixel-wise classification lesions. We devise new called Lesion-classifier performs into based on results derived classification. Our experiments two well-established public benchmark datasets, International Symposium Biomedical Imaging(ISBI)2017 Hospital Pedro Hispano (PH2), demonstrate our more effective than some state-of-the-art methods. achieved accuracy dice coefficient 95% 92% ISIC 2017 dataset 93% PH2 datasets.

title: A Reinforcement Learning Approach to Robust Scheduling of Semiconductor Manufacturing Facilities
abstract: As semiconductor manufacturers, recently, have focused on producing multichip products (MCPs), scheduling manufacturing operations become complicated due to the constraints related reentrant production flows, sequence-dependent setups, and alternative machines. At same time, problems need be solved frequently effectively manage variabilities in requirements, available machines, initial setup status. To minimize makespan for an MCP problem, we propose a change method using reinforcement learning (RL) which each agent determines decisions decentralized manner learns centralized policy by sharing neural network among agents deal with changes number of Furthermore, novel definitions state, action, reward are proposed address requirements Numerical experiments demonstrate that approach outperforms rule-based, metaheuristic, other RL methods terms while incurring shorter computation time than metaheuristics considered.

title: Robotics and automation in the city: a research agenda
abstract: Globally cities are becoming experimental sites for new forms of robotic and automation technologies applied across a wide variety sectors in multiple areas economic social life. title: HMS-Net: Hierarchical Multi-Scale Sparsity-Invariant Network for Sparse Depth Completion
abstract: Dense depth cues are important and have wide applications in various computer vision tasks. In autonomous driving, LIDAR sensors adopted to acquire measurements around the vehicle perceive surrounding environments. However, maps obtained by generally sparse because of its hardware limitation. The task completion attracts increasing attention, which aims at generating a dense map from an input map. To effectively utilize multi-scale features, we propose three novel sparsity-invariant operations, based on which, encoder-decoder network (HMS-Net) for handling inputs feature is also proposed. Additional RGB features could be incorporated further improve performance. Our extensive experiments component analysis two public benchmarks, KITTI benchmark NYU-depth-v2 dataset, demonstrate effectiveness proposed approach. As Aug. 12th, 2018, leaderboard, our model without guidance ranks 1st among all peer-reviewed methods using information, with 2nd RGB-guided methods.

title: Electroadhesion Technologies for Robotics: A Comprehensive Review
abstract: Electroadhesion (EA) is an electrically controllable adhesion mechanism that has been studied and used in fields including active attachment, robotic gripping, crawling climbing, haptics, for over a century. This because EA technologies, compared to other existing solutions, facilitate systems with enhanced adaptability (EA effective on wide of range materials surfaces), reduced system complexity are both mechanically simpler), low energy consumption, less-damaging (EA, combined soft materials, can be lift delicate objects). title: DeepSUM: Deep Neural Network for Super-Resolution of Unregistered Multitemporal Images
abstract:
Recently, convolutional neural networks (CNN) have been successfully applied
to many remote sensing problems. However, deep learning techniques for
multi-image super-resolution from multitemporal unregistered imagery have
received little attention so far. This work proposes a novel CNN-based
technique that exploits both spatial and temporal correlations to combine
multiple images. framework integrates the registration task
directly inside CNN, allows exploit representation learning
capabilities of network enhance accuracy. The entire
super-resolution process relies on single CNN with three main stages: shared
2D convolutions extract high-dimensional features input images; a
subnetwork proposing filters derived high-dimensional
feature representations; 3D for slow fusion from
multiple whole can be trained end-to-end recover a
single high resolution image multiple low images.
The method presented in this paper is winner PROBA-V
super-resolution challenge issued by European Space Agency.

title: Knowledge Graph Embedding via Graph Attenuated Attention Networks
abstract: Knowledge graphs contain a wealth of real-world knowledge that can provide strong support for artificial intelligence applications. Much progress has been made in graph completion, state-of-the-art models are based on convolutional neural networks. These automatically extract features, combination with the features model, to generate feature embeddings expressive ability. However, these methods assign same weights relation path and ignore rich information presented neighbor nodes, which result incomplete mining triple features. To this end, we propose Graph Attenuated Attention networks(GAATs), novel representation method, integrates an attenuated attention mechanism different weight acquire from neighborhoods. As result, entities relations be learned any neighbors. Our empirical research provides insight into effectiveness attention-based models, show significant improvement compared two benchmark datasets WN18RR FB15k-237.

abstract: Application of solar energy into ship power systems has been increasingly drawing attention. Accordingly, an accurate prediction plays a significant role in the shipboard system operation. A set machine learning techniques are combined together with particle swarm optimization (PSO) constitute forecasting model, including back propagation neural network (BPNN), radial basis function (RBFNN), extreme (ELM) Elman network. Furthermore, algorithms, strategy is employed reduce error various environmental variables along moving rolling impacts taken account. The developed model practically tested large oil tanker penetrated data typical navigation route Dalian China Aden Yemen selected prediction. simulation results demonstrate its high accuracy, provides reliable reference operators achieve better management.

abstract: Uplift modeling has received increasing interest in both the business analytics research community and industry as an improved paradigm for predictive data-driven operational decision-making. title: A Deep Model for Lung Cancer Type Identification by Densely Connected Convolutional Networks and Adaptive Boosting
abstract: Timely diagnosis and determination to the type of lung cancer has important clinical significance. Generally, it requires multiple imaging methods complement each other obtain a comprehensive diagnosis. In this work, we propose deep learning model identify from CT images for patients in Shandong Provincial Hospital. It two-fold challenge: artificial intelligent models trained by public datasets cannot meet such practical requires, amount collected patients' data is quite few. To solve problem, use image rotation, translation transformation expand balance our training data, then densely connected convolutional networks (DenseNet) used classify malignant tumor from, finally adaptive boosting (adaboost) algorithm aggregate classification results improve performance. Experimental show that method can achieve identifying accuracy 89.85%, which performs better than DenseNet without adaboost, ResNet, VGG16 AlexNet. This provides an efficient, non-invasive detection tool pathological type.

title: Faster Authenticated Key Agreement With Perfect Forward Secrecy for Industrial Internet-of-Things
abstract: Industrial Internet-of-Things (IIoT) is the basis of Industry 4.0, which extends Internet connectivity beyond traditional computing devices like computers and smartphones to physical world for improving efficiency accuracy while reducing production cost. However, there are tremendous security threats IIoT, such as IIoT device hijacking data leaks. Therefore, a lightweight authenticated key agreement (AKA) protocol commonly applied establish session securing communication between devices. To protect previous keys from being compromised, perfect forward secrecy (PFS) has been one most important properties AKA. In this article, we present an efficient PFS-enabled AKA systems, developed based on new dynamic authentication credential (DAC) framework, without using any public-key cryptographic primitives. It worth noting that our also faster than state-of-the-art DAC-based protocols with PFS. Moreover, give formal result proposed in random oracle model.

Therefore, a lightweight authenticated key agreement (AKA) protocol commonly applied establish session securing communication between devices. To protect previous keys from being compromised, perfect forward secrecy (PFS) has been one most important properties AKA. In this article, we present an efficient PFS-enabled AKA systems, developed based on new dynamic authentication credential (DAC) framework, without using any public-key cryptographic primitives. It worth noting that our also faster than state-of-the-art DAC-based protocols with PFS. Moreover, give formal result proposed in random oracle model. title: Anatomical Attention Guided Deep Networks for ROI Segmentation of Brain MR Images
abstract: Brain region-of-interest (ROI) segmentation based on structural magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans is an essential step for many computer-aid medical image analysis applications. Due to low intensity contrast around ROI boundary and large inter-subject variance, it has been remaining a challenging task effectively segment brain ROIs from MR images. Even though several deep learning methods have developed, most of them do not incorporate shape priors take advantage the regularity structures, thus leading sub-optimal performance. To address this issue, we propose anatomical attention guided framework images, containing two subnetworks. The first one subnetwork, used simultaneously extract discriminative representation each input image. second designed capture structure information set labeled atlases. utilize knowledge learned atlases, develop gate architecture fuse feature maps derived atlas label those to-be-segmented segmentation. In way, prior atlases can be explicitly employed guide process performance improvement. Within framework, models, denoted as gated fully convolutional network (AG-FCN) U-Net (AG-UNet), respectively. Experimental results both ADNI LONI-LPBA40 datasets suggest that proposed AG-FCN AG-UNet achieve superior in compared with state-of-the-art methods.

title: Accelerating Minibatch Stochastic Gradient Descent Using Typicality Sampling
abstract: Machine learning, especially deep neural networks, has developed rapidly in fields, including computer vision, speech recognition, and reinforcement learning. Although minibatch stochastic gradient descent (SGD) is one of the most popular optimization methods for training it shows a slow convergence rate due to large noise approximation. In this article, we attempt remedy problem by building more efficient batch selection method based on typicality sampling, which reduces error estimation conventional SGD. We analyze resulting typical SGD algorithm compare properties between algorithm. Experimental results demonstrate that our scheme works well complex variants can benefit from proposed strategy.

title: Integrate Point-Cloud Segmentation with 3D LiDAR Scan-Matching for Mobile Robot Localization and Mapping
abstract: Localization and mapping are key requirements for autonomous mobile systems to perform navigation interaction tasks. Iterative Closest Point (ICP) is widely applied LiDAR scan-matching in the robotic community. In addition, standard ICP algorithm only considers geometric information when iteratively searching nearest point. However, individually cannot achieve accurate point-cloud registration performance challenging environments such as dynamic highways. Moreover, computation of closest points an expensive step algorithm, which limited meet real-time requirements, especially dealing with large-scale data. this paper, we propose a segment-based framework six degree-of-freedom pose estimation mapping. The generates large number ground scanning, but many these useless increase burden subsequent processing. To address problem, first apply image-based ground-point extraction method filter out noise points. point cloud after removing then segmented into disjoint sets. After step, point-to-point calculate transformation between consecutive scans. Furthermore, once closed loops detected environment, 6D graph-optimization global relaxation (6D simultaneous localization (SLAM)) employed. Experiments based on publicly available KITTI datasets show that our requires less runtime while at same time achieves higher accuracy compared its variants.

title: Ensemble adversarial black-box attacks against deep learning systems
Data campaigning: between empirics and assumptions
abstract: The use of big data in political campaigns extends far beyond micro-targeting, and has been singled out by journalists campaign staffers alike as a powerful force that is integral to electoral victory. Current scholarship on the subject remains more mixed, however. This article provides an overview what we know (and don't yet know) about effects data-campaigning across various goals campaigns, alongside public facing narratives present campaigning all-powerful tactic, highlighting gap between these two views.

title: Blind Leading the Sighted
abstract: Voice-activated personal assistants (VAPAs) are becoming smaller, cheaper, and more accurate, such that they now prevalent in homes (e.g., Amazon Echo, Sonos One) on mobile devices Google Assistant, Apple Siri) around the world. VAPAs offer considerable potential to individuals who blind, offering efficiencies over gesture-based input touchscreen devices. However, research is just beginning reveal ways which these technologies used by people blind. In first of two studies, we interviewed 14 blind adults with experience home and/or mobile-based VAPAs, surfacing myriad accessibility, usability, privacy issues for this community. A second study analyzing podcast content from 28 episodes relating interactions was then undertaken validate extend findings study. addition verifying prior findings, learned users wanted leverage productivity-oriented tasks increased efficiency other interaction modalities. We conclude (1) need support a greater variety AI personas, each specializing specific type task; (2) maintain continuity voice both usability accessibility; (3) VAPA users, especially technology podcasters, expert interface should be incorporated into design processes beginning. argue when lead sighted through design, can benefit.

title: Automated Extraction of Human Settlement Patterns From Historical Topographic Map Series Using Weakly Supervised Convolutional Neural Networks
abstract: <div>Information extraction from historical maps represents a persistent challenge due to inferior graphical quality and the large data volume of digital map archives, which can hold thousands digitized sheets. Traditional processing techniques typically rely on manually collected templates symbol interest, thus are not suitable for large-scale information extraction. In order digitally preserve such amounts valuable retrospective geographic information, high levels automation required. Herein, we propose an automated machine-learning based framework extract human settlement symbols, as buildings urban areas topographic in absence training data, employing contemporary geospatial ancillary guide collection samples. These samples then used train convolutional neural network semantic image segmentation, allowing patterns analysis-ready vector format. We test our method United States Geological Survey published between 1893 1954. The results promising, indicating degrees completeness extracted features (i.e., recall up 0.96, F-measure 0.79) will next steps provide fully operational approach feature variety series. Moreover, proposed provides robust recognition objects small size, generalizable many kinds visual documents.</div>

title: Risks of Stroke and Mortality in Atrial Fibrillation Patients Treated With Rivaroxaban and Warfarin
abstract: Background and Purpose— Oral anticoagulation therapy is standard of care for patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation to prevent stroke. This study compared rivaroxaban warfarin stroke all-cause mortality risk reduction in a real-world setting. Methods— retrospective cohort (2011–2017) included de-identified from the Optum Clinformatics Database who started treatment or within 30 days following initial diagnosis fibrillation. Before diagnosis, had 6 months continuous health plan enrollment CHA 2 DS -VASc score ≥2. Stroke severity was determined by National Institutes Health Scale, imputed based on machine learning algorithms. risks were using Cox proportional hazard regression, inverse probability weighting balance cohorts baseline factors. title: How Artificial Intelligence Improves Agricultural Productivity and Sustainability: A Global Thematic Analysis
abstract: In the face of agricultural sector's challenges, food security with an increasing human population and high demand for is a significant problem. Traditional methods used by farmers have not been sufficient to meet requirements growing population. As result, sector has begun deploy artificial intelligence sustainability. This study was conducted examine how AI improves farmers' productivity Data were analyzed using centering resonance analysis, t-test, ANOVA, text mining news articles from 2014-2019 in Africa, Asia, Europe, North America. Results show that primarily increase efficiency secondarily address labor shortages environmental sustainability concerns. The results at regional level reflect active adoption America efforts Asia Africa.

title: A Multichannel 2D Convolutional Neural Network Model for Task-Evoked fMRI Data Classification
abstract: Deep learning models have been successfully applied to the analysis of various functional MRI data. Convolutional neural networks (CNN), a class deep networks, found excel at extracting local meaningful features based on their shared-weights architecture and space invariance characteristics. In this study, we propose M2D CNN, novel multichannel 2D CNN model, classify 3D fMRI The model uses sliced data as input integrates information learned from networks. We experimentally compared proposed against several widely used including SVM, 1D separable with respect performance in classifying task-based tested six benchmarks large number time-series whole-brain imaging motor task Human Connectome Project (HCP). results our experiments demonstrate following: (i) convolution operations are advantageous for high-dimensional classification, all outperform SVM; (ii) achieve higher accuracy than but computationally costly any extra dimension is added input; (iii) study achieves highest alleviates overfitting given its smaller parameters CNN.

title: Internet of Things Mobility Over Information-Centric/Named-Data Networking
abstract: Information-centric networking (ICN) is a content-oriented network that uses content instead of traditional IP addresses, it facilitates the retrieval and calculates downstream paths without need an optimal topology. ICN inherits mobility support features in its baseline design. Since Internet Things (IoT) faces major problems supporting management over IP, we believe would represent element scalable IoT networks. This article discusses use as communication model environments, focusing on solving issue. Thus, survey relevant work studies merger between IoT, describe emergence, evolution, state-of-the-art approach. also presents discussions scalability challenges when using enabler for mobile highlights key designs guidelines.

title: A New Algorithm Optimized for Initial Dose Settings of Vancomycin Using Machine Learning
abstract: This study aimed to construct an optimal algorithm for initial dose settings of vancomycin (VCM) using machine learning (ML) with decision tree (DT) analysis. Patients who were administered intravenous VCM and underwent therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM) at the Hokkaido University Hospital enrolled. The period was November 2011 March 2019. In total, 654 patients included in study. divided into two groups, training (patients received from December 2017; n = 496) testing January 2018 2019; 158) groups. For group, DT analysis classification regression performed (called algorithm) VCM. rates attaining range (trough value 10-15 10-20 mg/L) three conventional dose-setting methods compared model evaluation. constructed be used estimated glomerular filtration rate ≥50 mL/min body weight ≥40 kg. As a result, recommended daily doses ranged 20.0 58.1 mg/kg. evaluation, obtained highest methods. Therefore, our can applied clinical practice. addition, ML is useful setting doses.

title: Comparison of Internal Validity Indices for Fuzzy Clustering
abstract: Partitioning clustering has been one of the key components data analytics to discover meaningful patterns in agricultural big data, driven by increasing use IoT-based technologies smart farming. In partitioning clustering, quality or performances algorithms are mostly evaluated using internal validity indices. this study, effectiveness some widely used fuzzy indices compared basic Fuzzy C-Means algorithm. It is especially aimed investigate changes when points at different distances from cluster centers. According results obtained on simulated two-dimensional datasets, Silhouette, Hypervolume and Kwon most successful validation results.

title: Applications of machine learning in decision analysis for dose management for dofetilide
abstract: Dose adjustments are a strong determinant of whether patients able to successfully initiate dofetilide. A reinforcement learning algorithm informed by unsupervised was predict dosing decisions with 96.1% accuracy. Future studies will apply this prospectively as data-driven decision aid.
detailed_text: Dose adjustments are a strong determinant of whether patients able to successfully initiate dofetilide. A reinforcement learning algorithm informed by unsupervised was predict dosing decisions with 96.1% accuracy. Future studies will apply this prospectively as data-driven decision aid. Applications of machine learning in decision analysis for dose management for dofetilide

title: Design and application of adaptive PID controller based on asynchronous advantage actor–critic learning method
abstract: Abstract To address the problems of slow convergence and inefficiency in existing adaptive PID controllers, we propose a new controller using asynchronous advantage actor–critic (A3C) algorithm. Firstly, can train multiple agents structures parallel exploiting multi-thread learning characteristics A3C structure. Secondly, order to achieve best control effect, each agent uses multilayer neural network approach strategy function value search parameter-tuning continuous action space. The simulation results indicate that our proposed fast strong adaptability compared with conventional controllers.
detailed_text: Abstract To address the problems of slow convergence and inefficiency in existing adaptive PID controllers, we propose a new controller using asynchronous advantage actor–critic (A3C) algorithm. Firstly, can train multiple agents structures parallel exploiting multi-thread learning characteristics A3C structure. Secondly, order to achieve best control effect, each agent uses multilayer neural network approach strategy function value search parameter-tuning continuous action space. The simulation results indicate that our proposed fast strong adaptability compared with conventional controllers. Design and application of adaptive PID controller based on asynchronous advantage actor–critic learning method

title: A Review on Fall Detection Systems Using Data from Smartphone Sensors
abstract: Accidental falls have become one of the most frequent general health issues in recent years due to rate occurrence.Individuals aged above 65 are more prone accidental falls.Accidental result severe injuries such as concussion, head trauma, physical disabilities even deaths serious cases if patients not rescued time.Thus, researchers focusing on developing fall detection systems that facilitate and quick rescue victims.The smartphone-based use various built-in sensors smartphones mostly Tri-axial accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, camera.The majority employ threshold based algorithms (TBA).Some machine learning (ML) or a combination ML TBA detect falls.Each these types has its trade-offs.The goal this paper is review data from smartphone either TBA, both.We also present taxonomy systematic comparisons existing studies for solutions.

title: A Data-Driven Pattern Extraction Method for Analyzing Bidding Behaviors in Power Markets
abstract: Myriad studies have been conducted on bidding behaviors following a worldwide restructuring of the electric power market. The common theme in such involves idealized and theoretical economic assumptions. However, practical behavior could deviate from that based assumptions, which would undoubtedly limit effectiveness practicality prevalent market-based studies. To analyze actual markets, this paper proposes data-driven analysis framework for data standardization processing method is proposed addresses particularities provides fundamental dataset further market analyses. Then, an adaptive clustering developed applies K-medoids Wasserstein distance measurement to extract generators' patterns massive dataset. An empirical Australian energy typical are extracted, analyzed.

title: IoVCom: Reliable Comprehensive Communication System for Internet of Vehicles
abstract: By 2020, around 25 billion “things” will be connected to the Internet for a better society using different technological systems. Vehicle users have experience by collaborating of Things (IoT) and vehicular ad-hoc network (VANET) architectures, this emerging field is called vehicles (IoV). Therefore, IoV architecture play an important role in industry, research organization, academics various public commercial applications. However, structure should ensure secure efficient performance communications, else attacker may interfere system. In article, we propose protected comprehensive data dissemination protocols (say IoVCom) based on one-way hash function elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) structure. Next, analyze security strengths IoVCom against attacks discuss results terms communication overhead, computation time, storage cost, energy consumption.

In article, we propose protected comprehensive data dissemination protocols (say IoVCom) based on one-way hash function elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) structure. Next, analyze security strengths IoVCom against attacks discuss results terms communication overhead, computation time, storage cost, energy consumption. IoVCom: Reliable Comprehensive Communication System for Internet of Vehicles

title: Intrusion Detection System for the MIL-STD-1553 Communication Bus
abstract: MIL-STD-1553 is a military standard that defines the specification of serial communication bus has been implemented in and aerospace avionic platforms for over 40 years. was designed high level fault tolerance while less attention paid to cyber security issues. Thus, as indicated recent studies, it exposed various threats. In this article, we suggest enhancing buses by integrating machine learning-based intrusion detection system (IDS); such anIDS will be capable detecting attacks real time. The IDS consists two modules: 1) remote terminal (RT) authentication module detects illegitimately connected components data transfers 2) sequence-based anomaly anomalies operation system. showed rates both normal abnormal behavior when evaluated testbed using 1553 hardware, well very fast accurate training process logs from RT managed authenticate RTs with +0.99 precision +0.98 recall; detect illegitimate component (or legitimate impersonates other components) recall. perfectly behavior. Moreover, sequencebased accurately (i.e., zero false positives) model short period time (~22 s).

title: A new higher-order viscous continuum traffic flow model considering driver memory in the era of autonomous and connected vehicles
A high-resolution flexible sensor array based on PZT nanofibers
abstract: Flexible tactile sensor array has drawn great attention due to its ability mimic human skin for sensing weak pressure and distinguishing distribution, but the deficiency of sensitivity, low resolution, complex costly fabrication process seriously limit development. Hence, it is urgent explore a fully flexible with high sensitivity resolution as an electronic-skin. Here, piezoelectric based on composite film PZT nanowires polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) was fabricated by simple (electrospinning mixture process). The electrospun nanofibers have aspect ratio could enhance generation accumulation charges in two electrodes film. By virtue inherently coefficient material nanofibers, (75 wt% nanofibers) presents force-electric conversion capability sensitivity. Owing bottom electrode sheet shared all units supporting layer relatively elastic modulus, shows qualitatively sense distribution size impact real time. Moreover, also durability, repeatability, large working range. Based these excellent characteristics, wide potential applications field bionics science, robotics science human-machine interaction.

title: Rigorous Connectionist Models to Predict Carbon Dioxide Solubility in Various Ionic Liquids
abstract: Estimating the solubility of carbon dioxide in ionic liquids, using reliable models, is paramount importance from both environmental and economic points view. In this regard, current research aims at evaluating performance two data-driven techniques, namely multilayer perceptron (MLP) gene expression programming (GEP), for predicting (CO2) liquids (ILs) as function pressure, temperature, four thermodynamical parameters liquid. To develop above 744 experimental data derived literature including 13 ILs were used (80% training 20% validation). Two backpropagation-based methods, Levenberg–Marquardt (LM) Bayesian Regularization (BR), applied to optimize MLP algorithm. Various statistical graphical assessments check credibility developed techniques. The results then compared with those calculated Peng–Robinson (PR) or Soave–Redlich–Kwong (SRK) equations state (EoS). highest coefficient determination (R2 = 0.9965) lowest root mean square error (RMSE 0.0116) recorded MLP-LMA model on full dataset (with a negligible difference MLP-BR model). comparison vastly thermodynamic equation models revealed slightly better performance, but EoS approaches also performed well R2 0.984 up 0.996. Lastly, newly established correlation based GEP exhibited very satisfactory overall values 0.9896 RMSE 0.0201.

To develop above 744 experimental data derived literature including 13 ILs were used (80% training 20% validation). Two backpropagation-based methods, Levenberg–Marquardt (LM) Bayesian Regularization (BR), applied to optimize MLP algorithm. Various statistical graphical assessments check credibility developed techniques. The results then compared with those calculated Peng–Robinson (PR) or Soave–Redlich–Kwong (SRK) equations state (EoS). highest coefficient determination (R2 = 0.9965) lowest root mean square error (RMSE 0.0116) recorded MLP-LMA model on full dataset (with a negligible difference MLP-BR model). comparison vastly thermodynamic equation models revealed slightly better performance, but EoS approaches also performed well R2 0.984 up 0.996. Lastly, newly established correlation based GEP exhibited very satisfactory overall values 0.9896 RMSE 0.0201. Rigorous Connectionist Models to Predict Carbon Dioxide Solubility in Various Ionic Liquids

title: Automatic Waypoint Generation to Improve Robot Navigation Through Narrow Spaces
abstract: In domestic robotics, passing through narrow areas becomes critical for safe and effective robot navigation. Due to factors like sensor noise or miscalibration, even if the free space is sufficient pass through, it may not see enough clearance navigate, hence limiting its operational space. An approach facing this insert waypoints strategically placed within problematic in map, which are considered by planner when generating a trajectory help successfully traverse them. This typically carried out human operator either relying on their experience trial-and-error. paper, we present an automatic procedure perform task that: (i) detects map (ii) generates set of auxiliary navigation from more suitable trajectories can be generated planner. Our proposal, fully compatible with robotic operating system (ROS), has been applied robots deployed different houses H2020 MoveCare project. Moreover, have performed extensive simulations four state-of-the-art real maps. The results reveal significant improvements number successful navigations evaluated scenarios, demonstrating efficacy realistic situations.

title: CDPM: Convolutional Deformable Part Models for Semantically Aligned Person Re-Identification
abstract: Part-level representations are essential for robust person re-identification. However, common errors that arise during pedestrian detection frequently result in severe misalignment problems body parts, which degrade the quality of part representations. Accordingly, to deal with this problem, we propose a novel model named Convolutional Deformable Part Models (CDPM). CDPM works by decoupling complex alignment procedure into two easier steps: first, vertical step detects each direction, help multi-task learning model; second, horizontal refinement based on attention suppresses background information around detected part. Since these steps performed orthogonally and sequentially, difficulty is significantly reduced. In testing stage, able accurately align flexible parts without any need outside information. Extensive experimental results demonstrate effectiveness proposed alignment. Most impressively, achieves state-of-the-art performance three large-scale datasets: Market-1501, DukeMTMC-ReID, CUHK03.
detailed_text: Part-level representations are essential for robust person re-identification. However, common errors that arise during pedestrian detection frequently result in severe misalignment problems body parts, which degrade the quality of part representations. CDPM works by decoupling complex alignment procedure into two easier steps: first, vertical step detects each direction, help multi-task learning model; second, horizontal refinement based on attention suppresses background information around detected part. Since these steps performed orthogonally and sequentially, difficulty is significantly reduced. In testing stage, able accurately align flexible parts without any need outside information. Extensive experimental results demonstrate effectiveness proposed alignment. Most impressively, achieves state-of-the-art performance three large-scale datasets: Market-1501, DukeMTMC-ReID, CUHK03. CDPM: Convolutional Deformable Part Models for Semantically Aligned Person Re-Identification

title: Research on Inception Module Incorporated Siamese Convolutional Neural Networks to Realize Face Recognition
abstract: Face recognition is an active research subject of biometrics due to its significant and application prospects. The performance face can be affected by a series uncontrollable factors, such as illumination, expression, posture occlusion, which restricts real-world applications. Therefore, improving the robustness environmental changes became urgent problem. In this paper, simplified deep convolutional neural network structure having high under unlimited conditions designed for recognition. This improve training speed accuracy, suitable small-scale data sets. Inception Module Incorporated Siamese Convolutional Neural Networks (IMISCNN) developed based on effective reduction external interference better features extraction adopting structure. A cyclical learning rate strategy also introduced in IMISCNN model convergence. Compared classical algorithms, PCA, PCA SVM, CNN, PCANet, original SNN et al. accuracy CASIA-webface Extended Yale B standard database 99.36% 99.21%, respectively. Its feasibility effectiveness have been verified our experiments.

title: In-Hardware Training Chip Based on CMOS Invertible Logic for Machine Learning
abstract: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) have recently shown state-of-the-art results on various applications, such as computer vision and recognition tasks. DNN inference engines can be implemented in hardware with high energy efficiency the computation realized using a low-precision fixed point or even binary precision sufficient cognition accuracies. On other hand, training DNNs well-known back-propagation algorithm requires high-precision floating-point computations CPU and/or GPU causing significant power dissipation (more than hundreds of kW) long time (several days more). In this paper, we demonstrate chip fabricated commercial 65-nm CMOS technology for machine learning. The performs without back propagation by invertible logic stochastic computing that directly obtain weight values input/output data low suitable inference. When neurons compute weighted sum all inputs then apply non-linear activation function, our demonstrates reduction latency 99.98% 99.95%, respectively, comparison software implementation.

title: Ultrasound Nerve Segmentation Using Deep Probabilistic Programming
abstract: Deep probabilistic programming concatenates the strengths of deep learning to context modeling for efficient and flexible computation in practice. abstract: Autonomous vehicles need to solve the road keeping problem and existing solutions based on reinforcement learning are mainly implemented in simulators. In this paper, we propose a method called ReinforcementDriving which explores navigation skills trajectories from for full-sized keeping. title: Attention-Based Video Hashing for Large-Scale Video Retrieval
abstract: Large-scale video retrieval is a challenging problem because of the exponential growth collections on Internet. To address this challenge, we propose an attention-based hashing (AVH) method for large-scale retrieval. Unlike most existing methods, which consider different frames within separately hash learning, use convolutional neural network and long short-term memory (LSTM) as backbone to learn compact discriminative codes by exploiting structural information among frames. better capture informative clues in video, attention mechanism added into backbone, can assign weights LSTM time steps. Experiments were conducted evaluate proposed AVH comparison with methods. The experimental results two widely used data sets show that our outperforms state-of-the-art
detailed_text: Large-scale video retrieval is a challenging problem because of the exponential growth collections on Internet. To address this challenge, we propose an attention-based hashing (AVH) method for large-scale retrieval. Unlike most existing methods, which consider different frames within separately hash learning, use convolutional neural network and long short-term memory (LSTM) as backbone to learn compact discriminative codes by exploiting structural information among frames. better capture informative clues in video, attention mechanism added into backbone, can assign weights LSTM time steps. Experiments were conducted evaluate proposed AVH comparison with methods. The experimental results two widely used data sets show that our outperforms state-of-the-art Attention-Based Video Hashing for Large-Scale Video Retrieval

abstract: Coordinated planning is an effective method to balance investment costs and benefits in achieving high renewable target under the renewable-driven power system expansion wave. It capable provide flexible tool driven reasonable computational burden.

title: Building Change Detection for Remote Sensing Images Using a Dual-Task Constrained Deep Siamese Convolutional Network Model
abstract: In recent years, building change detection methods have made great progress by introducing deep learning, but they still suffer from the problem of extracted features not being discriminative enough, resulting in incomplete regions and irregular boundaries. To tackle this problem, we propose a dual-task constrained Siamese convolutional network (DTCDSCN) model, which contains three subnetworks: two semantic segmentation networks. DTCDSCN can accomplish both at same time, help to learn more object-level obtain complete map. Furthermore, introduce dual attention module (DAM) exploit interdependencies between channels spatial positions, improves feature representation. We also improve focal loss function suppress sample imbalance problem. The experimental results obtained with WHU data set show that proposed method is effective for achieves state-of-the-art performance terms four metrics on set: precision, recall, F1-score, intersection over union.
detailed_text: In recent years, building change detection methods have made great progress by introducing deep learning, but they still suffer from the problem of extracted features not being discriminative enough, resulting in incomplete regions and irregular boundaries. To tackle this problem, we propose a dual-task constrained Siamese convolutional network (DTCDSCN) model, which contains three subnetworks: two semantic segmentation networks. DTCDSCN can accomplish both at same time, help to learn more object-level obtain complete map. Furthermore, introduce dual attention module (DAM) exploit interdependencies between channels spatial positions, improves feature representation. We also improve focal loss function suppress sample imbalance problem. abstract: Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) are promising technologies for exploiting in harsh environments such as can be found the nuclear industry. Nuclear storage facilities considered that, amongst other variables, they dark, congested, and have high gamma radiation levels, which preclude operator access. These conditions represent significant challenges to sensor reliability, data acquisition communications, power supplies, longevity. Installed monitoring of parameters temperature, pressure, radiation, humidity, hydrogen content within a facility may offer advantages over current baseline measurement options. This paper explores Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) components comprise an installed Internet Things (IoT)-based multipurpose system specific situation measuring concentration temperature. work addresses two major developing remote sensing monitor typical scenario detect both concentrations temperature: (1) development compact, cost-effective, robust multisensor from COTS components, (2) validation detecting temperature gas release. The proof concept developed this study not only demonstrates cost reduction regular but also enables intelligent management through IoT by using ThingSpeak environment.

title: Algorithm-Based Fault Tolerance for Convolutional Neural Networks
abstract:
Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are becoming more and important for
solving challenging critical problems in many fields. CNN inference
applications have been deployed safety-critical systems, which may suffer
from soft errors caused by high-energy particles, high temperature, or abnormal
voltage. Of importance is ensuring the stability of inference
process against errors. Traditional fault tolerance methods not
suitable for inference because error-correcting code unable to protect
computational components, instruction duplication techniques incur high
overhead, existing algorithm-based (ABFT) cannot
protect all convolution implementations. In this paper, we focus on how to
protect process as efficiently as
possible, with following three contributions. (1) We propose several
systematic ABFT schemes based checksum analyze their fault
protection ability runtime thoroughly.Unlike traditional on
matrix-matrix multiplication, our support any convolution
implementations. (2) design a novel workflow integrating proposed
schemes obtain detection/correction limited total
runtime overhead. (3) perform evaluation using ImageNet well-known
CNN models including AlexNet, VGG-19, ResNet-18, YOLOv2. Experimental
results demonstrate that implementation can handle very
limited overhead (4%~8% both error-free error-injected
situations).
detailed_text:
Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are becoming more and important for
solving challenging critical problems in many fields. CNN inference
applications have been deployed safety-critical systems, which may suffer
from soft errors caused by high-energy particles, high temperature, or abnormal
voltage. Of importance is ensuring the stability of inference
process against errors. Traditional fault tolerance methods not
suitable for inference because error-correcting code unable to protect
computational components, instruction duplication techniques incur high
overhead, existing algorithm-based (ABFT) cannot
protect all convolution implementations. In this paper, we focus on how to
protect process as efficiently as
possible, with following three contributions. (1) We propose several
systematic ABFT schemes based checksum analyze their fault
protection ability runtime thoroughly.Unlike traditional on
matrix-matrix multiplication, our support any convolution
implementations. (2) design a novel workflow integrating proposed
schemes obtain detection/correction limited total
runtime overhead. (3) perform evaluation using ImageNet well-known
CNN models including AlexNet, VGG-19, ResNet-18, YOLOv2. Experimental
results demonstrate that implementation can handle very
limited overhead (4%~8% both error-free error-injected
situations).
 Algorithm-Based Fault Tolerance for Convolutional Neural Networks

title: Online State-of-Health Estimation for Second-Use Lithium-Ion Batteries Based on Weighted Least Squares Support Vector Machine
abstract: Online state-of-health (SOH) estimation is critical for second-use retired lithium-ion batteries. However, the SOH of batteries highly nonlinear, and existing degradation trend data are limited. Consequently, achieving accurate effective remains a challenge. To address above problem, an online based on weighted least squares support vector machine (WLS-SVM) proposed in this paper. In work, health features (HFs) first extracted from partial charging curves batteries, Pearson correlation coefficient applied to select important HFs that strongly correlated SOH. These selected used as model inputs characterizing aging procedure battery effectively. Then, enhance accuracy robustness estimation, standard (SVM) improved by weighting function linear equations. Last, conducted using test sets with different materials under conditions. The results show compared most popular methods, such back-propagation neural network (BPNN)-based method, Gaussian process regression (GPR)-based SVM-based performance WLS-SVM-based method superior. root mean square error (RMSE) all cells less than 1.85% at paths levels, whereas RMSEs BPNN-based GPR-based within 3.6%, 5.7%, 7.6%, respectively. can thus provide robust estimation.

abstract: Chest X-ray image contains sufficient information that finds wide-spread applications in diverse disease diagnosis and decision making to assist the medical experts. This paper has proposed an intelligent approach detect Covid-19 from chest using hybridization of deep convolutional neural network (CNN) discrete wavelet transform (DWT) features. At first, is enhanced segmented through preprocessing tasks, then CNN DWT features are extracted. The optimum extracted these hybridized minimum redundancy maximum relevance (mRMR) along with recursive feature elimination (RFE). Finally, random forest-based bagging used for doing detection task. An extensive experiment performed, results confirm our gives satisfactory performance compare existing methods overall accuracy more than 98.5%.

title: Stabilization of Finite-Energy Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill States
abstract: We introduce a new approach to Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill (GKP) states that treats their finite-energy version in an exact manner. Based on this analysis, we develop qubit-oscillator circuits autonomously stabilize GKP manifold, correcting errors without relying qubit measurements. Finally, show numerically logical information encoded is very robust against typical oscillator noise sources when stabilized by these circuits.
detailed_text: We introduce a new approach to Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill (GKP) states that treats their finite-energy version in an exact manner. Based on this analysis, we develop qubit-oscillator circuits autonomously stabilize GKP manifold, correcting errors without relying qubit measurements. Finally, show numerically logical information encoded is very robust against typical oscillator noise sources when stabilized by these circuits. Stabilization of Finite-Energy Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill States

FadeNet: Deep Learning-Based mm-Wave Large-Scale Channel Fading Prediction and its Applications
abstract: Accurate prediction of the large-scale channel fading is fundamental to planning and optimization in 5G millimeter-wave cellular networks. The current methods, which are either too computationally expensive or inaccurate, unsuitable for city-scale cell optimization. This paper presents FadeNet, a convolutional neural-network enabled alternative predicting with high computation speed accuracy. By using carefully designed input features architecture capture topographical information, FadeNet accurately predicts from base station each location its coverage area. Evaluations on realistic data, derived cells across multiple cities, suggest that can achieve accuracy 5.6 decibels root mean square error. In addition, by leveraging parallel processing capabilities graphics unit, reduce time 40X - 1000X comparison industry prevalent methods like ray-tracing. Generalizations handle variable topographies heights, use optimal site selection also explored.
