abstract: Small manufacturing plants nowadays need to consider Industry 4.0 stay competitive in the market. Among challenges regarding transformation towards are requirements re-skill staff for new work environment. The have either adapt workplace brought by digitalisation, automation and robotics or face layoffs. This paper reports on a process which was conducted small enterprise where automated assembly line, industrial robots, codes algorithms replaced previous manual set-up. In order extend learning models from educational settings, we investigated how plant tackles challenge of with existing staff. We examined through non-participant observations 17 interviews during initiation phase, before, during, after robotic system launched. Based empirical study, propose (a) method respect adult scholarship (b) taxonomy work-integrated activities support needed manage transformations industry 4.0.

title: Evaluation of Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks for Data Augmentation of Chest X-ray Images
abstract: Medical image datasets are usually imbalanced due to the high costs of obtaining data and time-consuming annotations. Training a deep neural network model on such accurately classify medical condition does not yield desired results as they often over-fit majority class samples’ data. Data augmentation is performed training address issue by position techniques scaling, cropping, flipping, padding, rotation, translation, affine transformation, color brightness, contrast, saturation, hue increase dataset sizes. Radiologists generally use chest X-rays for diagnosis pneumonia. Due patient privacy concerns, access protected. In this study, we Chest X-ray generate artificial images under-represented through generative modeling Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Network (DCGAN). With just 1341 labeled Normal, samples were created retaining similar characteristics original with technique. Evaluating resulted in Fréchet Distance Inception (FID) score 1.289. We further show superior performance CNN classifier trained DCGAN augmented dataset.

title: Hierarchical Representation Learning in Graph Neural Networks With Node Decimation Pooling
abstract: In graph neural networks (GNNs), pooling operators compute local summaries of input graphs to capture their global properties, and they are fundamental for building deep GNNs that learn hierarchical representations. this work, we propose the Node Decimation Pooling (NDP), a operator generates coarser while preserving overall topology. During training, GNN learns new node representations fits them pyramid coarsened graphs, which is computed offline in preprocessing stage. NDP consists three steps. First, decimation procedure selects nodes belonging one side partition identified by spectral algorithm approximates MAXCUT solution. Afterward, selected connected with Kron reduction form graph. Finally, since resulting very dense, apply sparsification prunes adjacency matrix reduce computational cost GNN. Notably, show it possible remove many edges without significantly altering structure. Experimental results more efficient compared state-of-the-art reaching, at same time, competitive performance on significant variety classification tasks.

During training, GNN learns new node representations fits them pyramid coarsened graphs, which is computed offline in preprocessing stage. NDP consists three steps. First, decimation procedure selects nodes belonging one side partition identified by spectral algorithm approximates MAXCUT solution. Afterward, selected connected with Kron reduction form graph. Finally, since resulting very dense, apply sparsification prunes adjacency matrix reduce computational cost GNN. Notably, show it possible remove many edges without significantly altering structure. Experimental results more efficient compared state-of-the-art reaching, at same time, competitive performance on significant variety classification tasks. Hierarchical Representation Learning in Graph Neural Networks With Node Decimation Pooling

title: Automatic Defect Segmentation in X-Ray Images Based on Deep Learning
abstract: X-ray imaging has been broadly adopted as a nondestructive testing method for product quality inspection. Deep learning demonstrated powerful image scene understanding capabilities. In this article, U-Net with resnet101 is taken the baseline defect segmentation. First, there exist gray inhomogeneous and low-contrast regions in images, which can hardly be segmented. Contrast-limited adaptive histogram equalization (CLAHE) could used to improve contrast consistency of image. A two-stream convolutional neural network (CNN) proposed that takes original CLAHE processed inputs address issue. And then CNN, low-level feature maps are lacking semantic information, may lead worse results. gated multilayer fusion module adaptively fuse high-level features into features. Furthermore, loss functions (such cross entropy) segmentation usually pixel level, ignoring regional information. weighted intersection over union (IOU) function introduce IOU information guide model focus on objects easy mine. The experimental results prove three methods have better performance than our dataset, achieving 42.2 mIoU, 59.2 Dice, 54.5%, 74.9%, 86.3% small, middle, large object recall rate, respectively.

title: New Structure Design of Ferrite Cores for Wireless Electric Vehicle Charging by Machine Learning
abstract: In this article, a machine learning algorithm is applied for the first time in inductive power transfer (IPT) to find ferrite core structure with high magnetic coupling between transmitting (Tx) and receiving (Rx) coils an electric vehicle (EV) wireless charging system. Since formula-based theoretical design not available due nonlinear field distortion stemming from presence of IPT system, proposed has been achieved through finite-element analysis simulation-based data learning. The methods are so general that they can be any conventional coil design. Furthermore, it optimize structures coefficient, mutual inductance, desired flux density specific area, etc. By training only 0.011% out total possible cases, verified by simulation experiment obtained method inductance 0.6% higher than level case 15 cm distance Tx Rx coils, even though volume cores reduced 90%. Also, prototype 3.0 kW stationary EV system was implemented showed fairly better performance case.
detailed_text: In this article, a machine learning algorithm is applied for the first time in inductive power transfer (IPT) to find ferrite core structure with high magnetic coupling between transmitting (Tx) and receiving (Rx) coils an electric vehicle (EV) wireless charging system. The methods are so general that they can be any conventional coil design. Furthermore, it optimize structures coefficient, mutual inductance, desired flux density specific area, etc. By training only 0.011% out total possible cases, verified by simulation experiment obtained method inductance 0.6% higher than level case 15 cm distance Tx Rx coils, even though volume cores reduced 90%. Also, prototype 3.0 kW stationary EV system was implemented showed fairly better performance case. New Structure Design of Ferrite Cores for Wireless Electric Vehicle Charging by Machine Learning

title: Attenuation Coefficient Guided Two-Stage Network for Underwater Image Restoration
abstract: Underwater images suffer from severe color casts, low contrast and blurriness, which are caused by scattering absorption when light propagates through water. However, existing deep learning methods treat the restoration process as a whole do not fully consider underwater physical distortion process. Thus, they cannot adequately tackle both scattering, leading to poor results. To address this problem, we propose novel two-stage network for image (UIR), divides into two parts viz. horizontal vertical restoration. In first stage, model-based is proposed handle directly embedding model network. The attenuation coefficient, feature representation in characterizing water type information, estimated guide accurate estimation of parameters model. For second reconstruct clear image, put forth coefficient prior attention block (ACPAB) adaptively recalibrate RGB channel-wise maps suffering distortion. Experiments on synthetic dataset real-world demonstrate that our method can effectively compared with several state-of-the-art methods.

title: CovTANet: A Hybrid Tri-Level Attention-Based Network for Lesion Segmentation, Diagnosis, and Severity Prediction of COVID-19 Chest CT Scans
abstract: Rapid and precise diagnosis of COVID-19 is one the major challenges faced by global community to control spread this overgrowing pandemic. In article, a hybrid neural network proposed, named CovTANet, provide an end-to-end clinical diagnostic tool for early diagnosis, lesion segmentation, severity prediction utilizing chest computer tomography (CT) scans. Furthermore, attention mechanism been repeatedly utilized network, combining channel, spatial, pixel schemes generalization contextual information embedded map through recalibration operations. Outstanding performances have achieved all three extensive experimentation on large publicly available dataset containing 1110 CT-volumes, signifies effectiveness proposed scheme current

title: Artificial Intelligence Model of Drive-Through Vaccination Simulation
abstract: Planning for mass vaccination against SARS-Cov-2 is ongoing in many countries considering that vaccine will be available the general public near future. Rapid while a pandemic requires use of traditional and new temporary clinics. Use drive-through has been suggested as one possible effective vaccinations among other methods. In this study, we present machine learning model developed based on big dataset derived from 125K runs simulation tool. The results show able to reasonably well predict key outputs Therefore, turned an online application can help planners assess outcomes different types facilities much faster.

title: Improving Machine Reliability with Recurrent Neural Networks
abstract: This study explores the application of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to enhance machine reliability in industrial settings, specifically predictive maintenance systems. Predictive uses previous sensor data identify abnormalities and forecast breakdowns before they occur, lowering downtime costs. RNNs are ideal with their unique capacity handle sequential input while capturing temporal relationships. RNN-based models may reliably foresee detect early malfunction indicators, allowing for appropriate interventions. The paper investigates key RNN architectures, such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) Gated Recurrent Units (GRU), that have proven effective addressing limitations traditional learning models, particularly dealing long-term dependencies avoiding vanishing gradient issue. LSTMs GRUs noted excellent performance maintenance, which requires precise failure predictions. However, obstacles persist, notably regarding quality—sensor is often noisy, missing, or inconsistent—and model interpretability since RNNs' "black-box" nature makes comprehending predictions challenging. Addressing these difficulties critical adoption settings. Future directions include integrating domain knowledge improve accuracy creating hybrid combine techniques, convolutional (CNNs) support vector machines (SVMs), systems' robustness scalability. These developments might considerably impact equipment dependability operational efficiency production.

RNN-based models may reliably foresee detect early malfunction indicators, allowing for appropriate interventions. LSTMs GRUs noted excellent performance maintenance, which requires precise failure predictions. These developments might considerably impact equipment dependability operational efficiency production. Improving Machine Reliability with Recurrent Neural Networks

title: Concept of Development to Regulate Relations in the Field of Artificial Intelligence Technologies and Robotics: Analysis of the Main Provisions
abstract: Decree of the Government Russian Federation No. 2129-R August 19, 2020 approved Concept to regulate relations in field artificial intelligence and robotics technologies until 2024. This document currently represents a set legal perspectives this area it also defines framework for creating multidimensional platform intelligence. The concept offers different ways systems, particular, considers issues related liability insurance damage caused by systems or robots, data exchange personal protection problems exporting so on. Analysis main provisions allowed us conclude that, given variety directions taken into account document, we can say overall, is quite logical issue under consideration with some refinement additions individual sections may take its rightful place among similar foreign analogues.

title: A Creative Commons Textbook for Teaching Scientific Computing to Chemistry Students with Python and Jupyter Notebooks
abstract: Scientific computing and computer literacy are increasingly important skills for chemistry students to learn, but despite this need, there is an absence of chemistry-specific texts available teaching the subject. This article introduces a freely textbook released under Creative Commons license use in undergraduate scientific course basic Python programming; advanced processing, visualization, analysis data; coding simulations. Subjects include programming, signal machine learning, NMR data image among others. The book written teach subject using Python, Jupyter notebooks, SciPy stack which all open source cross-platform software; text assumes no previous programming background from students. provides descriptions philosophy behind structure content along with insights advice based on its course.

title: Binary MIMO Detection via Homotopy Optimization and Its Deep Adaptation
abstract:
In this paper we consider maximum-likelihood (ML) MIMO detection under
one-bit quantized observations and binary symbol constellations. This problem
is motivated by the recent interest in adopting coarse quantization massive
MIMO systems--as an effective way to scale down hardware complexity and
energy consumption. Classical techniques unquantized
observations, many of them are not applicable one-bit case. We
develop a new non-convex optimization algorithm for ML MIMO
detection problem, using strategy called homotopy optimization. The idea is
to transform problem into sequence approximate problems, from easy
(convex) hard (close ML), with each being gradual
modification its previous. Then, our attempt is iteratively trace the
solution path these problems. well
suited application deep unfolding, recently popular approach for
turning certain model-based algorithms data-driven, performance
enhanced, ones. While initial focus on detection, the
proposed technique also applies naturally classical unquantized MIMO
detection. We performed extensive simulations show that proposed
homotopy algorithms, both non-deep deep, have satisfactory bit-error
probability performance compared state-of-the-art algorithms. Also, the
deep has attractively low computational complexity.

title: Application of machine learning in the diagnosis of gastric cancer based on noninvasive characteristics
abstract: Background The diagnosis of gastric cancer mainly relies on endoscopy, which is invasive and costly. aim this study to develop a predictive model for the based noninvasive characteristics. Aims To construct with high accuracy Methods A retrospective 709 patients at Zhejiang Provincial People's Hospital was conducted. Variables age, gender, blood cell count, liver function, kidney lipids, tumor markers pathological results were analyzed. We used gradient boosting decision tree (GBDT), type machine learning method, evaluate model. Results Of patients, 398 diagnosed cancer; 311 health people or benign disease. Multivariate analysis showed that neutrophil lymphocyte ratio, hemoglobin, albumin, carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA), carbohydrate 125 (CA125) 199 (CA199) independent characteristics associated cancer. constructed using GBDT, area under receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) 91%. For test dataset, sensitivity 87.0% specificity 84.1% optimal threshold value 0.56. overall 83.0%. Positive negative values 83.0% 87.8%, respectively. Conclusion diagnose specificity. may reduce medical cost.

title: Radar-Spectrogram-Based UAV Classification Using Convolutional Neural Networks
abstract: With the upsurge in use of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) various fields, detecting and identifying them real-time are becoming important topics. However, identification UAVs is difficult due to their characteristics such as low altitude, slow speed, small radar cross-section (LSS). existing deterministic approach, algorithm becomes complex requires a large number computations, making it unsuitable for systems. Hence, effective alternatives enabling these new threats needed. Deep learning-based classification models learn features from data by themselves have shown outstanding performance computer vision tasks. In this paper, we propose deep model that learns micro-Doppler signatures (MDS) targets represented on spectrogram images. To enable this, first, recorded five LSS (three types two different human activities) with frequency modulated continuous wave (FMCW) scenarios. Then, converted signals into spectrograms form images Short time Fourier transform (STFT). After refinement augmentation, made our own dataset. Secondly, analyzed dataset ResNet-18 designed ResNet-SP less computation, higher accuracy stability based model. The results show proposed has training 242 s an 83.39%, which superior takes 640 79.88%.

abstract: Background A priority for health services is to reduce self-harm in young people. title: Edge-Dependent Efficient Grasp Rectangle Search in Robotic Grasp Detection
abstract: Grasping unseen objects has become one of the most critical abilities robots, where identifying feasible grasp locations is key technique. Previously proposed methods generally rely on grid search strategy, which evaluates candidates at regular interval, or directly adopt deep convolutional network, requires large datasets and powerful computational ability. In this article, we propose an edge-based detection combines low-level features a lightweight neural network (CNN). Specifically, two grip criteria are first introduced to select point pairs determine corresponding candidates. Then, CNN model rapidly trained with limited number samples in order recognize grasps. Our method does not require additional sensor information can work well only RGB image. Comparative experiments public dataset verify effectiveness our efficient search, superior existing strategies accuracy efficiency. Meanwhile, it achieves competitive results traditional CNN-based using less training time. addition, also test approach under real-world robotic grasping scenario.

abstract: Purpose Task‐based fMRI (TfMRI) is a diagnostic imaging modality for observing the effects of disease or other condition on functional activity brain. A compression step BOLD signal discrete wavelet transform (DWT) has proposed. adopted wavelets similar expected hemodynamic which enables DWT compress while highlighting its activation information. Finally, 2D CNN used classify patients as TD based features previous step. Results Preliminary results 100 dataset (50 ASD, 50 TD) obtain 80% correct classification tenfold cross validation (with sensitivity = 84%, specificity 76%). Conclusion experimental show high accuracy hold promise presented helpful adjunct currently tools.

title: How Will Digitalization Change Road Freight Transport? Scenarios Tested in Sweden
abstract: Road freight transport is a key function of modern societies. At the same time, road accounts for significant emissions. Digitalization, including automation, digitized information, and artificial intelligence, provide opportunities to improve efficiency, reduce costs, increase service levels in transport. Digitalization may also radically change business ecosystem sector. In this paper, question, “How will digitalization landscape?” addressed by developing four exploratory future scenarios, using Sweden as case study. The results are based on input from 52 experts. For each impacts sector investigated, barriers achieving sustainable transportation system scenarios discussed. all an vehicle kilometers traveled predicted, three increases recycling urban flows predicted. scenario development process highlighted how there important uncertainties society that be highly landscape. title: Loss-Based Attention for Interpreting Image-Level Prediction of Convolutional Neural Networks
abstract: Although deep neural networks have achieved great success on numerous large-scale tasks, poor interpretability is still a notorious obstacle for practical applications. In this paper, we propose novel and general attention mechanism, loss-based attention, upon which modify to mine significant image patches explaining parts determine the decision-making. This inspired by fact that some contain objects or their image-level decision. Unlike previous mechanisms adopt different layers parameters learn weights prediction, proposed mechanism mines utilizing same patch logits (class vectors), prediction simultaneously, so as connect with loss function boosting precision recall. Additionally, from popular utilize max-pooling stride operations in convolutional without considering spatial relationship of features, modified architectures first remove them preserve greatly reduce dependencies, then add two capsule extract features. With learned weights, decision weighted sum patches. Extensive experiments benchmark databases demonstrate can obtain better competitive performance state-of-the-art baseline interpretability. The source codes are available on: https://github.com/xsshi2015/Loss-based-Attention-for-Interpreting-Image-level-Prediction-of-Convolutional-Neural-Networks.

title: Multiarmed-Bandit-Based Decentralized Computation Offloading in Fog-Enabled IoT
abstract: The Internet-of-Things (IoT) environments have hard real-time tasks that need execution within fixed deadlines. As IoT devices consist of a myriad sensors, each task is composed multiple interdependent subtasks. Toward this, the cloud and fog computing platforms potential facilitating these sensor nodes (SNs) in accommodating complex operations with minimum delay. To further reduce operational latencies, we breakdown high-level into smaller subtasks form directed acyclic graph (DATG). Initially, SNs offload their to nearby node (FN) based on greedy choice. formulation helps selecting FN linear time while avoiding combinatorial optimizations at SN, which saves as well energy. are highly dynamic, mandates for adaptive solutions. At chosen FN, depending dependencies DATGs, its corresponding deadlines, varying conditions other FNs, propose an ϵ-greedy nonstationary multiarmed bandit-based scheme (D2CIT) online allocation among them. learning D2CIT allows autonomously select set FNs distributing themselves executes parallel latency, energy, resource usage. Simulation results show offers reduction latency by 17% compared traditional schemes. Additionally, upon comparison existing learning-based offloading solutions environments, improved speedup 59% due induced parallelism.

abstract: Current diagnostics of sleep apnea relies on the time-consuming manual analysis complex registrations, which is impractical for routine screening in hospitalized patients with a high probability apnea, e.g. those experiencing acute stroke or transient ischemic attacks (TIA). title: End-to-End Automatic Berry Counting for Table Grape Thinning
abstract: Bunch shape and berry size indicate the quality of table grapes crucially affect their market value. Berry thinning is one most important tasks in grape cultivation to achieve an ideal bunch make sufficient space for individual berries. A successful practice by skilled farmers Japan using number berries a guide process; hence, technique automatically counting working has been long desired improve efficiency task. This research presents novel end-to-end berry-counting based on deep neural network (DNN), its contributions are as follows. First, because DNN requires massive training data, data augmentation simulating process proposed. Second, new location-sensitive object detection model that integrates explicit location information supplementary classification loss into state-of-the-art instance segmentation was proposed detecting with high accuracy. Third, set features, together extraction algorithms, designed predicting (3D counting) detected single 2D image. Experiments collected from farmers' grape-thinning have conducted validate accuracy effectiveness methods.

title: Leveraging Edge Intelligence for Video Analytics in Smart City Applications
abstract: In smart city scenarios, the huge proliferation of monitoring cameras scattered in public spaces has posed many challenges to network and processing infrastructure. A few dozen are enough saturate city’s backbone. addition, most applications require a real-time response from system charge such large-scale video streams. Finding missing person using facial recognition technology is one these that immediate action on place where is. this paper, we tackle presenting distributed for analytics designed leverage edge computing capabilities. Our approach encompasses architecture, methods, algorithms for: (i) dividing burdensome streams into various machine learning tasks; (ii) deploying tasks as workflow data devices equipped with hardware accelerators neural networks. We also propose reuse nodes running shared by multiple applications, e.g., recognition, thus improving system’s throughput. Simulations showed that, our algorithm distribute workload, time process about 33% faster than naive approach.

title: Comparison of methods for texture analysis of QUS parametric images in the characterization of breast lesions
abstract: Purpose Accurate and timely diagnosis of breast carcinoma is very crucial because its high incidence morbidity. Screening can improve overall prognosis by detecting the disease early. Biopsy remains as gold standard for pathological confirmation malignancy tumour grading. The development diagnostic imaging techniques an alternative rapid accurate characterization masses necessitated. Quantitative ultrasound (QUS) spectroscopy a modality well suited this purpose. This study was carried out to evaluate different texture analysis methods applied on QUS spectral parametric images lesions. Methods Parametric mid-band-fit (MBF), spectral-slope (SS), spectral-intercept (SI), average scatterer diameter (ASD), acoustic concentration (AAC) were determined using from 193 patients with Texture used quantify heterogeneities images. Three statistical-based approaches that include Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM), Run-length (GRLM), Size Zone (GLSZM) evaluated. texture-parameters both core 5-mm margin in comparison histopathological order classify lesions either benign or malignant. We developed model classification algorithms including linear discriminant (LDA), k -nearest neighbours (KNN), support vector machine radial basis function kernel (SVM-RBF), artificial neural network (ANN). Model performance evaluated leave-one-out cross-validation (LOOCV) hold-out validation. Results Classifier performances ranged 73% 91% terms accuracy dependent inclusion classifier methodology. Utilizing information alone, ANN achieved best 93% sensitivity, 88% specificity, accuracy, 0.95 AUC parameters their GLSZM features. Conclusions A QUS-based framework enabled >90% accuracy. results suggest optimizing method extracting discriminative textural features performance. Evaluation proposed technique larger cohort proper validation demonstrated robustness generalization approach.

title: A Multi-Agent System for Data Fusion Techniques Applied to the Internet of Things Enabling Physical Rehabilitation Monitoring
abstract: There are more than 800 million people in the world with chronic diseases. Many of these do not have easy access to healthcare facilities for recovery. Telerehabilitation seeks provide a solution this problem. According researchers, topic has been treated as medical aid, making an exchange between technological issues such Internet Things and virtual reality. The main objective work is design distributed platform monitor patient’s movements status during rehabilitation exercises. Later, information can be processed analyzed remotely by doctor assigned patient. In way, follow progress, enhancing improvement recovery process. To achieve this, case study made using PANGEA-based multi-agent system that coordinates different parts architecture ubiquitous computing techniques. addition, uses real-time feedback from This makes patients aware their errors so they improve performance later executions. An evaluation was carried out real patients, achieving promising results.

title: RRAM-DNN: An RRAM and Model-Compression Empowered All-Weights-On-Chip DNN Accelerator
abstract: This article presents an energy-efficient deep neural network (DNN) accelerator with non-volatile embedded resistive random access memory (RRAM) for mobile machine learning (ML) applications. DNN implements weight pruning, non-linear quantization, and Huffman encoding to store all weights on RRAM, enabling single-chip processing large models without external memory. A four-core parallel programmable architecture adapts various configurations high utilization. We introduce a customized RRAM macro dynamic clamping offset-canceling sense amplifier (DCOCSA) that achieves sub-microampere input offset. The on-chip decompression error-resilient scheme enables 16 million (M) 8-bit (decompressed) using 24 Mb RRAM. proposed RRAM-DNN is the first digital featuring as all-on-chip storage eliminate energy-consuming off-chip accesses. fabricated design performs complete inference process of ResNet-18 model while consuming 127.9 mW power in TSMC-22 nm ULL CMOS. peak performance 123 GOPs precision, exhibiting measured energy efficiency 0.96 TOPs/W.

A four-core parallel programmable architecture adapts various configurations high utilization. The on-chip decompression error-resilient scheme enables 16 million (M) 8-bit (decompressed) using 24 Mb RRAM. proposed RRAM-DNN is the first digital featuring as all-on-chip storage eliminate energy-consuming off-chip accesses. fabricated design performs complete inference process of ResNet-18 model while consuming 127.9 mW power in TSMC-22 nm ULL CMOS. peak performance 123 GOPs precision, exhibiting measured energy efficiency 0.96 TOPs/W. abstract: Recently, extensive research has revealed the enormous potential of deep learning in application image steganography. However, some defects still exist previous studies on learning-based In this paper, we propose a novel end-to-end network architecture for steganography with channel attention mechanisms based generative adversarial networks, which can yield perceptually indistinguishable stego images at various capacities. Three subnetworks constitute our model, where generator embeds payload into cover images, an extractor extracts it from and powerful steganalyzer acts as discriminator to enhance steganographic security. We design specific module, tunes channel-wise features representation dynamically by exploiting interdependencies. The experimental results demonstrate that strategy is conducive improving quality generated accuracy message extraction. title: Artificial intelligence in the diagnosis and management of colorectal cancer liver metastases
abstract: Colorectal cancer (CRC) is the third most common malignancy worldwide, with approximately 50% of patients developing colorectal liver metastasis (CRLM) during follow-up period. Management CRLM best achieved via a multidisciplinary approach and diagnostic therapeutic decision-making process complex. In order to optimize patients' survival quality life, there are several unsolved challenges which must be overcome. These primarily include timely diagnosis identification reliable prognostic factors. Furthermore, allow optimal treatment options, precision-medicine, personalized required. The widespread digitalization healthcare generates vast amount data together accessible high-performance computing, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies can applied. By increasing accuracy, reducing timings costs, application AI could help mitigate current shortcomings in management. this review we explore available evidence possible role all phases natural history. Radiomics analysis convolutional neural networks (CNN) combine computed tomography (CT) images clinical have been developed predict development CRC patients. models also proven themselves perform similarly or better than expert radiologists detecting on CT magnetic resonance scans identifying them from noninvasive exhaled air. machine learning (ML) diagnosing has extended histopathological examination rapidly accurately identify tissue its different growth patterns. ML CNN shown good accuracy predicting response chemotherapy, early local tumor progression after ablation treatment, patient surgical chemotherapy. Despite initial enthusiasm accumulating evidence, technologies' management not yet fully established. Its limitations mainly concern safety lack regulation ethical considerations. unlikely replace any human but actively integrated facilitate physicians their everyday practice. Moving towards evidence-based management, further larger, prospective rigorous studies evaluating at risk affected by needed.

title: Tensor Completion via Complementary Global, Local, and Nonlocal Priors
abstract: Completing missing entries in multidimensional visual data is a typical ill-posed problem that requires appropriate exploitation of prior information the underlying data. Commonly used priors can be roughly categorized into three classes: global tensor low-rankness, local properties, and nonlocal self-similarity (NSS); most existing works utilize one or two them to implement completion. Naturally, there arises an interesting question: concurrently make use multiple unified way, such they collaborate with each other achieve better performance? This work gives positive answer by formulating novel completion framework which simultaneously take advantage global-local-nonlocal priors. In proposed framework, train (TT) rank adopted characterize correlation; meanwhile, Plug-and-Play (PnP) denoisers, including convolutional neural network (CNN) denoiser color block-matching 3 D filtering (CBM3D) denoiser, are incorporated preserve details exploit NSS, respectively. Then, we design proximal alternating minimization algorithm efficiently solve this model under PnP framework. Under mild conditions, establish convergence guarantee algorithm. Extensive experiments show these organically benefit from state-of-the-art performance both quantitatively qualitatively.

Then, we design proximal alternating minimization algorithm efficiently solve this model under PnP framework. Under mild conditions, establish convergence guarantee algorithm. Extensive experiments show these organically benefit from state-of-the-art performance both quantitatively qualitatively. Tensor Completion via Complementary Global, Local, and Nonlocal Priors

abstract: Pedestrians represent agile and low-observable targets, especially under adverse weather conditions, whose trajectory tracking plays a crucial role in determining pedestrian behavior autonomous urban driving. Thus, this article presents millimeter-wave radar-based trajectory-tracking (MRPT) system that enables all-weather perception with high precision. More specifically, to improve the performance presence of strong background clutters, track-before-detection-based algorithm is proposed address detection jointly, instead regarding them as two separate phases conventional methods. After that, continuous method based on integration target existence probability Markov transition matrix achieve superior by directly using unthresholded radar data. In addition, binary-phase-multiplex (BPM) strategy, validated low-cost automotive frequency-modulated-continuous-waveform (FMCW) multiple-input–multiple-output (MIMO) sensor. Consequently, extensive simulation experimental results demonstrate MRPT exhibits better low signal-noise-ratio (SNR) conditions compared traditional

title: Spatio-Temporal Self-Attention Network for Video Saliency Prediction
abstract: 3D convolutional neural networks have achieved promising results for video tasks in computer vision, including saliency prediction that is explored this paper. However, convolution encodes visual representation merely on fixed local spacetime according to its kernel size, while human attention always attracted by relational features at different time. To overcome limitation, we propose a novel Spatio-Temporal Self-Attention Network (STSANet) prediction, which multiple (STSA) modules are employed levels of backbone directly capture long-range relations between spatio-temporal time steps. Besides, an Attentional Multi-Scale Fusion (AMSF) module integrate multi-level with the perception context semantic and subspaces. Extensive experiments demonstrate contributions key components our method, DHF1K, Hollywood-2, UCF, DIEM benchmark datasets clearly prove superiority proposed model compared all state-of-the-art models.

title: Early-Stage Brown Spot Disease Recognition in Paddy Using Image Processing and Deep Learning Techniques
abstract: India is an agricultural country. Paddy the main crop here on which livelihood of millions people depends. Brown spot disease caused by fungus most predominant infection that appears as oval and round lesions paddy leaves. If not addressed time, it might result in serious loss. Pesticide use for plant treatment should be limited because raises costs pollutes environment. Usage pesticide loss both can minimized if we recognize a timely manner. Our aim to develop simple, fast, effective deep learning structure early-stage brown detection utilizing severity estimation using image processing techniques. The suggested approach consists two phases. In first phase, infected leaf dataset partitioned into sets named developed stage spot. This partition done basis calculated severity. Infection computed ratio pixel count total count. Total counts are determined segmenting region from background Otsu's thresholding technique. title: Parallel Scheduling of Large-Scale Tasks for Industrial Cloud–Edge Collaboration
abstract: Industrial Internet of Things is moving toward an intelligent level with large-scale collaborative cloud and edge resources, making it possible for online supervision, fast analysis, precise control many manufacturing job shops. However, processing industrial computation brings huge communication overhead energy consumption among cloud, edge, end devices. To improve the performance cloud–edge collaboration, this article establishes a practical model task scheduling considering two kinds modes. We propose parallel group-merge evolutionary algorithm to assign thousands tasks in seconds. The separates into weakly correlated groups applies modified operators find subsolution each group. Then, subsolutions are merged form complete solution fine-tuning based on cross-use heuristics. Experimental results show that proposed method could servers seconds, reduce overall computing time by 36.97%, save 23.71% at most.

Then, subsolutions are merged form complete solution fine-tuning based on cross-use heuristics. Experimental results show that proposed method could servers seconds, reduce overall computing time by 36.97%, save 23.71% at most. title: Application of Reinforcement Learning and Deep Learning in Multiple-Input and Multiple-Output (MIMO) Systems
abstract: The current wireless communication infrastructure has to face exponential development in mobile traffic size, which demands high data rate, reliability, and low latency. MIMO systems their variants (i.e., Multi-User Massive MIMO) are the most promising 5G technology due system throughput rate. However, significant challenges substantial problems exploiting multiple-antenna computational complexity. recent success of RL DL introduces novel powerful tools that mitigate issues systems. This article focuses on techniques for by presenting a comprehensive review integration between two areas. We first briefly provide necessary background RL, DL, MIMO. Second, potential applications different issues, such as detection, classification, compression; channel estimation; positioning, sensing, localization; CSI acquisition feedback, security, robustness; mmWave resource allocation, presented.

title: LQGDNet: A Local Quaternion and Global Deep Network for Facial Depression Recognition
abstract: Recent visual-based depression recognition methods mostly use hand-crafted features with information lost in color channels, or deep network a limited performance from the finite data. In this paper, we propose method called Local Quaternion and Global Deep Network (LQGDNet) which can combine advantages features. Specifically, XOR Asymmetrical Regional Gradient Coding (XOR-AR-LGC) is first designed, encodes facial images local textures quaternion domain to keep dependence of integrated into Feature Extractor (QFE). To best our knowledge, it attempt quaternion-based for recognition. Second, design Representation Module (LQRM) composed (LDFE) QFE output Third, global are encoded (GDRM) convolutional neural network. Finally, LQGDNet integrates LQRM GDRM predicts score. The experimental results on AVEC 2013 2014 show superiority compared state-of-the-art approaches.

title: A Review of the Fractal Market Hypothesis for Trading and Market Price Prediction
abstract: This paper provides a review of the Fractal Market Hypothesis (FMH) focusing on financial times series analysis. In order to put FMH into broader perspective, Random Walk and Efficient Hypotheses are considered together with basic principles fractal geometry. After exploring historical developments associated different hypotheses, an overview mathematical modelling is provided. The principal goal this consider intrinsic scaling properties that characteristic for each hypothesis. regard FMH, it explained why time can be taken characterised by 1/t1−1/γ law, where γ>0 Lévy index, which able quantify likelihood extreme changes in price differences occurring (or otherwise). context, explores how coupled other metrics, such as Lyapunov Exponent Volatility, combined provide long-term forecasts. Using these forecasts quantification risk assessment, short-term predictions using machine learning approach evolve nonlinear formula simulates values. A short case study presented reports use forecast Bitcoin exchange rate

title: Mapping technological innovation dynamics in artificial intelligence domains: Evidence from a global patent analysis
abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) is emerging as a technology at the center of many political, economic, and societal debates. This paper formulates new AI patent search strategy applies this to provide landscape analysis innovation dynamics evolution. The uses analyses, network source path link count algorithms examine spatial temporal trends, cooperation features, cross-organization knowledge flow technological routes. Results indicate growing yet concentrated, non-collaborative multi-path development protection profile for patenting, with flows based mainly on interorganizational citation links.

title: HISTOPATHOLOGICAL IMAGE ANALYSIS FOR ORAL CANCER CLASSIFICATION BY SUPPORT VECTOR MACHINE
abstract: Oral cancer is caused by the mutation of cells in lips or mouth. The incidence rate and prevalence oral are increasing worldwide. Recently, Machine Learning (ML) approaches play a vital role medical image diagnosis. They provide accurate rapid evaluation analysis histopathological images using supervised learning. In this study, three different modules developed namely preprocessing, feature extraction classification module. Initially, raw given to median filter for removal background noise preprocessing next module, temporal features such as energy, entropy etc., extracted from color components filtered images. Finally, done employing Support Vector (SVM) K-Nearest Neighbour (KNN) classify normal abnormal. Results show that SVM classifier better than KNN cancer. accuracy on 1224 has been improved 98% compared with results 83%.

abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive review of the wearable healthcare monitoring systems proposed by researchers to date. Thus, health systems, started with acquisition single signal/ parameter present generation smart and affordable multi-parameter recording/monitoring have evolved manifolds these two decades. Wearable dramatically changed terms size, cost, functionality, accuracy. Most present-day smartphones are not only capable recording various body temperature, rate, photoplethysmograph (PPG) signal, calory consumption, stress measurement, etc. through different apps, but they also help user get monitored family physician via GSM or even internet things (IoT). latest, state-of-the-art real-time personal IoT-cloud-based system (WISE), is beautiful amalgamation area sensor network (BASN) IoT framework ubiquitous monitoring. future will be far beyond BASN.

abstract: Over the world, there is growing worry about corrosion of reinforced concrete structures. title: Machine learning algorithms for forecasting and backcasting blood demand data with missing values and outliers: A study of Tema General Hospital of Ghana
abstract: The major challenge in managing blood products lies the uncertainty of demand and supply, with a trade-off between shortage wastage, especially most developing countries. Thus, reliable predictions can be imperative planning voluntary donation campaigns improving availability within Ghana hospitals. However, historical datasets on are predominantly contaminated missing values outliers due to improper database management systems. Consequently, time-series prediction challenging since data cleaning affect models’ predictive power. Also, machine learning (ML) power for backcasting past years’ lost is understudied compared their forecasting abilities. This study thus aims compare K-Nearest Neighbour regression (KNN), Generalised Regression Neural Network (GRNN), Auto-regressive (NNAR), Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP), Extreme Learning Machine (ELM) Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) models via rolling-origin strategy, from government hospital Ghana. KNN performed well (12.55% error); whereas, ELM achieved highest (19.36% error). Future studies also employ ML algorithms as good alternative that time-reversible.

title: BrainyEdge: An AI-enabled framework for IoT edge computing
abstract: Along with the proliferation of Internet Things (IoT) and surge in use artificial intelligence (AI), Edge Computing has proved considerable success reducing latency, network traffic consumption, security risks. The convergence AI Computing, emerging a brand-new paradigm called edge intelligence, been expected to unleash full potential intelligent IoT services. Unfortunately, integrating into is highly challenging due concerns over device performance, energy efficiency, privacy. In this paper, we present brainyEdge, an AI-enabled framework for devices able jointly satisfy Quality Experience (QoE) criteria applications. We enhanced models operating at edges by designing learning procedure consisting transfer incremental dynamically retrain personalized data locally stored. These are classified private permanently stored public shared cloud. This increases edge-cloud collaboration level while preserving To minimize cost deploying devices, developed lightweight deployment supporting cloud-compression edge-decompression based on user-desired compression ratio. Our prototype-based evaluation results indicate superiority brainyEdge typical paradigm.

title: Matrix-Inverse-Free Deep Unfolding of the Weighted MMSE Beamforming Algorithm
abstract: Downlink beamforming is a key technology for cellular networks. However, computing beamformers that maximize the weighted sum rate (WSR) subject to power constraint an NP-hard problem. The popular minimum mean square error (WMMSE) algorithm converges local optimum but still exhibits considerable complexity. In order address this trade-off between complexity and performance, we propose apply deep unfolding WMMSE MU-MISO downlink channel. main idea consists of mapping fixed number iterations into trainable neural network layers. formulation algorithm, as provided in Shi <italic>et al.</italic>, involves matrix inversions, eigendecompositions, bisection searches. These operations are hard implement standard Therefore, present variant i) circumvents these by applying projected gradient descent ii) that, result, only can be efficiently computed parallel on hardware platforms designed learning. We demonstrate our convergences stationary point WSR maximization problem accelerate its convergence incorporating Nesterov acceleration generalization thereof learnable structures. By means simulations, show proposed architecture performs par with truncated same iterations, yet at lower complexity, generalizes well changes channel distribution.

title: Autonomous Intersection Management for Connected and Automated Vehicles: A Lane-Based Method
abstract: Most existing studies on autonomous intersection management (AIM) often focus algorithms to accommodate conflicts among vehicles by assuming that the entrance lane and exit of are exogenous inputs. This paper shows allowing lanes be optimized can significantly improve traffic efficiency. In particular, this proposes “all-direction” lanes, where left-turn, through, right-turn is all allowed at same lane. We develop two methods for optimizing entering time (i.e., when enter intersection) route choice decisions lane), including sliding-time-window-based global optimum (GO-STW) first-come-first-served method with optimal choices (FCFS-R). The developed lane-based formulated as mixed integer linear programming (MILP) problems, which solved using CPLEX solver. A heuristic further adopted solve MILP model in a timely manner, illustrates potential real-time applicability proposed method. Numerical analysis conducted examine performance effectiveness heuristic. found optimization lane/route more critical than time.

title: A Right Invariant Extended Kalman Filter for Object Based SLAM
abstract: With the recent advance of deep learning based object recognition and estimation, it is possible to consider level SLAM where pose each estimated in process. In this letter, on a novel Lie group structure, right invariant extended Kalman filter (RI-EKF) for proposed. MATLAB code made publicly available.

title: Machine Learning Techniques Focusing on the Energy Performance of Buildings: A Dimensions and Methods Analysis
abstract: The problem of energy consumption and the importance improving existing buildings’ performance are notorious. title: Water Budget Closure in the Upper Chao Phraya River Basin, Thailand Using Multisource Data
abstract: Accurate quantification of the terrestrial water cycle relies on combinations multisource datasets. This analysis uses data from remotely sensed, in-situ, and reanalysis records to quantify budget/balance component uncertainties in upper Chao Phraya River Basin May 2002 April 2020. Three closure techniques are applied merge independent budget components, creating up 72 probabilistic realizations monthly for Basin. An artificial neural network (ANN) model is used gap-fill between GRACE GRACE-FO-based storage anomalies. The ANN performed well with r ≥ 0.95, NRMSE = 0.24 − 0.37, NSE 0.89 during calibration validation phases. cumulative residual error ensemble mean accounts ~15% both precipitation evapotranspiration. increasing trend 0.03 mm month−1 errors may be partially attributable increases human activity relative redistribution biases among other variables. All three show similar directions constraints (i.e., wet or dry bias) variables slightly different magnitudes. Our help benchmark regional hydroclimate models understanding past, present, future status components effectively manage resources, especially extremes.

title: Taking back control over the economy: From economic populism to the economic consequences of populism
abstract: Abstract Economic populism was once recognized as a paradigmatic understanding of the boom‐and‐bust cycles Latin America. By now, concept has lost its analytical strength and academic attractiveness. Nevertheless, policy analysts cannot neglect supply side analysis contemporary populism, that is, what populists actually do elected into government. Adopting operationalizing ideational definition article identifies three major consequences populist incumbency: (1) inclination to embark on redistributive policies favoring “our” people against “others,” (2) their critical attitude toward autonomous organizations, professionals, institutions, (3) antagonistic relationship with competitive market mechanism. The demonstrates is no longer about myopic irresponsible policies; instead, tend disregard institutional constraints economic decision making.

The demonstrates is no longer about myopic irresponsible policies; instead, tend disregard institutional constraints economic decision making. title: A Pose-Only Solution to Visual Reconstruction and Navigation
abstract: Visual navigation and three-dimensional (3D) scene reconstruction are essential for robotics to interact with the surrounding environment. Large-scale scenarios computational robustness great challenges facing research community achieve this goal. This paper raises a pose-only imaging geometry representation algorithms that might help solve these challenges. The representation, equivalent classical multiple-view geometry, is discovered be linearly related camera global translations, which allows efficient robust motion estimation. As result, spatial feature coordinates can analytically reconstructed do not require nonlinear optimization. Comprehensive experiments demonstrate efficiency of recovering associated poses significantly improved by 2-4 orders magnitude.

title: Finite-time stabilization for fractional-order inertial neural networks with time varying delays
abstract: This paper deals with the finite-time stabilization of fractional-order inertial neural network varying time-delays (FOINNs). Firstly, by correctly selected variable substitution, system is transformed into a first-order fractional differential equation. Secondly, building Lyapunov functionalities and using analytical techniques, as well new control algorithms (which include delay-dependent delay-free controller), novel effective criteria are established to attain addressed system. Finally, two examples used illustrate effectiveness feasibility obtained results.

title: The journey to preventing dislocation after total hip arthroplasty
abstract: Dislocation following total hip arthroplasty (THA) is a well-known and potentially devastating complication. Clinicians have used many strategies in attempts to prevent dislocation since the introduction of THA. While importance postoperative care cannot be ignored, particular emphasis has been placed on preoperative planning prevention dislocation. The progressed from more traditional approaches, including modular implants, size femoral head, augmentation offset, newer concepts, patient-specific component positioning combined with computer navigation, robotics, use dual-mobility implants. As clinicians continue pursue improved outcomes reduced complications, these concepts will lay foundation for future innovation THA ultimately outcomes. Cite this article: Bone Joint J 2022;104-B(1):8–11.

title: Reversible Room Temperature H2 Gas Sensing Based on Self-Assembled Cobalt Oxysulfide
abstract: Reversible H2 gas sensing at room temperature has been highly desirable given the booming of Internet Things (IoT), zero-emission vehicles, and fuel cell technologies. Conventional metal oxide-based semiconducting sensors have considered as suitable candidates their low-cost, high sensitivity, long stability. However, dominant mechanism is based on chemisorption molecules which requires elevated temperatures to activate catalytic reaction target with chemisorbed O, leaving drawbacks high-power consumption poor selectivity. In this work, we introduce an alternative candidate cobalt oxysulfide derived from calcination self-assembled sulfide micro-cages. It found that majority S atoms are replaced by O in oxysulfide, transforming crystal structure tetragonal coordination slightly expanding optical bandgap energy. The performances fully reversible temperature, demonstrating peculiar p-type responses a magnitude 15% for 1% degree selectivity over CH4, NO2, CO2. Such excellent possibly ascribed physisorption dominating gas–matter interaction. This work demonstrates great potentials transition compounds room-temperature sensing.

title: Machine Learning Methods for Spaceborne GNSS-R Sea Surface Height Measurement From TDS-1
abstract: Sea surface height (SSH) retrieval based on spaceborne Global Navigation Satellite System Reflectometry (GNSS-R) usually uses the GNSS-R geometric principle and delay-Doppler map (DDM). The traditional method condenses DDM information into a single scalar measure requires error model correction. In this article, idea of using machine learning methods to retrieve SSH is proposed. Specifically, two widely-used methods, principal component analysis combined with support vector regression (PCA-SVR) convolution neural network (CNN), are used for verification comparative observation data provided by Techdemosat-1 (TDS-1). According inversion method, ten features from TDS-1 Level 1 selected as inputs; Danmarks Tekniske Universitet (DTU) 15 ocean wide mean DTU global tide output SSH. For hyperparameters in model, grid search strategy find optimal values. By analyzing 31 GPS satellites, absolute (MAE), root-mean-square (RMSE) coefficient determination (R<sup>2</sup>) PCA-SVR 0.61 m, 1.72 99.56%, respectively; MAE, RMSE, R<sup>2</sup> CNN 0.71 1.27 99.76%, respectively. addition, time required train models also analyzed. Overall, technique proposed article can be confidently applied data.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Statistical Techniques in Short-Term Load Forecasting: a Review
abstract: Electrical utilities depend on short-term demand forecasting to adjust proactively the production and distribution in anticipation of major variations. This systematic review analyzes 240 works published scholarly journals between 2000 2019 that focus applying Artificial Intelligence (AI), statistical, hybrid models Short-Term Load Forecasting (STLF). work represents most comprehensive this subject date. A complete analysis literature is conducted order identify popular accurate techniques as well existing gaps. title: Quantized Distributed Federated Learning for Industrial Internet of Things
abstract: Federated learning (FL) enables multiple devices to collaboratively train a shared machine (ML) model while keeping all the local data private, which is crucial enabler implement artificial intelligence (AI) at edge of Industrial Internet Things (IIoT) scenario. Distributed FL (DFL) based on Device-to-Device (D2D) communications can solve single point failure and scaling issue centralized FL, but subject communication resource limitation D2D links. Thus, it reduce transmission volume models between devices. In this article, we propose quantization-based DFL (Q-DFL) mechanism in network prove its convergence. Q-DFL contains two phases: 1) phase I, trained with stochastic gradient descent (SGD) algorithm each IIoT device then exchanges quantified parameters neighboring nodes 2) II, quantitative consensus designed ensure converge same global model. We also an adaptive stopping synchronization protocol fulfill transition from I II. Simulation results reveal that Q-DFL, 1-bit quantizer be employed without affecting convergence price slight accuracy reduction, achieves significant bandwidth saving. Further simulation for MobileNet fulfilled different quantization bit levels, reveals their performance tradeoff among system information flow consumption, time delay, energy cost.

title: Expendable to essential? Changing perceptions of gig workers on Twitter in the onset of COVID-19
abstract: While ride-hailing ridership declined in 2020 due to COVID-19 induced restrictions like stay-at-home orders, food/grocery delivery services became quasi-essential. title: Accelerating the estimation of collisionless energetic particle confinement statistics in stellarators using multifidelity Monte Carlo
abstract: Abstract In the design of stellarators, energetic particle confinement is a critical point concern which remains challenging to study from numerical view. Standard Monte Carlo (MC) analyses are highly expensive because large number trajectories need be integrated over long time scales, and small steps must taken accurately capture features wide variety trajectories. Even when they based on guiding center trajectories, as opposed full-orbit these standard MC studies too included in most stellarator optimization codes. We present first multifidelity (MFMC) scheme for accelerating estimation stellarators. Our approach relies two-level hierarchy, model serves high-fidelity model, data-driven linear interpolant leveraged low-fidelity surrogate model. apply MFMC four-period quasi-helically symmetric stellarator, assessing various metrics confinement. Stemming very high computational efficiency our well its sufficient correlation we obtain speedups up 10 with compared MC.

title: Reporting and Interpreting One-Way Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) Using a Data-Driven Example: A Practical Guide for Social Science Researchers
abstract: One-way (between-groups) analysis of variance (ANOVA) is a statistical tool or procedure used to analyse variation in response variable (continuous random variable) measured under conditions defined by discrete factors (classification variables, often with nominal levels). The detect difference means 3 more independent groups. It compares the samples groups order make inferences about population means. can be construed as an extension t-test. After data been gathered cleaned, test assumptions see if meet those assumptions. this, then do necessary computations calculate F-ratio (ANOVA result) using software. To this end, critical value table simply look at p-value against established alpha. If calculated greater than value, hypothesis will rejected upheld.

title: From Spatial Urban Site Data to Path Loss Prediction: An Ensemble Learning Approach
abstract: Machine learning (ML) models have become increasingly popular in the field of path loss prediction. Their performance depends profoundly on data they use as their input. The work at hand proposes and evaluates new input features for urban propagation. These were obtained via image processing tools. Moreover, we propose a two-level ensemble model using concept stacked generalization. proposed is based seven different basic ML models. To best authors knowledge, this first time that method applied to modeling problem electromagnetics. results demonstrate features, coupled with ensemble, provide improved prediction performance.

A Clinical Prognostic Model Based on Machine Learning from the Fondazione Italiana Linfomi (FIL) MCL0208 Phase III Trial
abstract: Background: Multicenter clinical trials are producing growing amounts of data. Machine Learning (ML) might facilitate the discovery novel tools for prognostication and disease-stratification. Taking advantage a systematic collection multiple variables, we developed model derived from data collected on 300 patients with mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) Fondazione Italiana Linfomi-MCL0208 phase III trial (NCT02354313). Methods: We score clustering algorithm applied to variables. The candidate was correlated overall survival (OS) validated in two independent series European MCL Network (NCT00209222, NCT00209209); Results: Three groups were significantly discriminated: Low, Intermediate (Int), High risk (High). Seven discriminants identified by feature reduction approach: albumin, Ki-67, lactate dehydrogenase, lymphocytes, platelets, bone marrow infiltration, B-symptoms. Accordingly, Int had shorter OS rates than those Low groups, respectively (Int→Low, HR: 3.1, 95% CI: 1.0–9.6; High→Int, 2.3, 1.5–4.7). Based 7 markers, defined engineered international prognostic index (eMIPI), which confirmed cohorts; Conclusions: ML-based MCL. Even when currently limited baseline predictors, our approach has high scalability potential.

title: Prediction Of Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Personality Using Long Short-Term Memory
abstract: Personality is defined as the mix of features and qualities that make up an individual's particular character, including thoughts, feelings, behaviors. title: EXPLORING TEACHERS’ ATTITUDES TOWARDS USING CHATGPT
abstract: ChatGPT has the potential to revolutionize education. By allowing machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) algorithms interact with students in real-time, can provide personalized interactive experiences that are tailored specifically for their individual needs. This study uses Technology Acceptance Model explore attitudes of faculty members towards using ChatGPT. Semi-structured interviews 20 a private university Pakistan were conducted. Additionally, future research should focus on student perceptions use quantitative methods gain further insight into how teaching purposes.

title: Dense-PSP-UNet: A neural network for fast inference liver ultrasound segmentation
abstract: Liver Ultrasound (US) or sonography is popularly used because of its real-time output, low-cost, ease-of-use, portability, and non-invasive nature. Segmentation liver US essential for diagnosing analyzing conditions (e.g., hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)), assisting the surgeons/radiologists in therapeutic procedures. In this paper, we propose a method using modified Pyramid Scene Parsing (PSP) module tuned neural network backbones to achieve segmentation without compromising accuracy. Considering widespread noise data impact on outcomes, study pre-processing influence loss functions performance. We have tested our after annotating publicly available dataset containing 2400 images 8 healthy volunteers (link annotated provided); results show that Dense-PSP-UNet model achieves high Dice coefficient 0.913±0.024 while delivering performance 37 frames per second (FPS).

In this paper, we propose a method using modified Pyramid Scene Parsing (PSP) module tuned neural network backbones to achieve segmentation without compromising accuracy. Considering widespread noise data impact on outcomes, study pre-processing influence loss functions performance. We have tested our after annotating publicly available dataset containing 2400 images 8 healthy volunteers (link annotated provided); results show that Dense-PSP-UNet model achieves high Dice coefficient 0.913±0.024 while delivering performance 37 frames per second (FPS). Dense-PSP-UNet: A neural network for fast inference liver ultrasound segmentation

title: A Review of Research on Wind Turbine Bearings’ Failure Analysis and Fault Diagnosis

abstract: Satellite-based and reanalysis precipitation products have experienced increasing popularity in agricultural, hydrological meteorological applications, but their accuracy is still uncertain different areas. title: Upper-Bound Energy Minimization to Search for Stable Functional Materials with Graph Neural Networks
abstract: The discovery of new materials in unexplored chemical spaces necessitates quick and accurate prediction thermodynamic stability, often assessed using density functional theory (DFT), efficient search strategies. Here, we develop a approach to finding stable inorganic materials. We start by defining an upper bound the fully relaxed energy obtained via DFT as resulting from constrained optimization over only cell volume. Because fractional atomic coordinates for these calculations are known a priori, this can be quickly accurately predicted with scale-invariant graph neural network (GNN). generate structures ionic substitution prototypes, train our GNN on database 128 000 comprising both volume-only structures. By minimizing upper-bound energy, discover 99% accuracy (versus DFT). demonstrate method promising candidates solid-state battery (SSB) electrolytes that not possess required but also additional properties such large electrochemical stability windows high conduction ion fraction. expect proposed framework directly applicable wide range design challenges science.

title: Emergency collision avoidance strategy for autonomous vehicles based on steering and differential braking
abstract: Abstract This paper develops a novel integrated collision avoidance strategy for autonomous vehicles in an emergency based on steering and braking. Specifically, the framework of is composed two parts: up-level decision-making layer low-level controller layer. The purpose to select appropriate control vehicle information, drive according instructions generated by up-level. More concretely, proposed integrating four-wheel steering, active rear differential braking with guaranteed path-tracking accuracy driving stability adaptive model predictive (AMPC). Finally, extensive co-simulations MATLAB/Simulink CarSim are conducted verify effectiveness terms tracking error, yaw rate, roll angle.
detailed_text: Abstract This paper develops a novel integrated collision avoidance strategy for autonomous vehicles in an emergency based on steering and braking. Specifically, the framework of is composed two parts: up-level decision-making layer low-level controller layer. The purpose to select appropriate control vehicle information, drive according instructions generated by up-level. More concretely, proposed integrating four-wheel steering, active rear differential braking with guaranteed path-tracking accuracy driving stability adaptive model predictive (AMPC). title: Robust modelling development for optimisation of hydrogen production from biomass gasification process using bootstrap aggregated neural network
abstract: In this study, a robust model using bootstrapped aggregated neural network (BANN) was developed for optimising operating conditions of two-stage gasification high carbon conversion, hydrogen yield and low CO2. The BAAN predicted accurately (R2 0.999) the gas composition 95% confidence bounds predictions on unseen validation data indicated good prediction reliability various feedstock. BANN also used to predict optimum condition production from waste wood (1st stage temperature 900 °C, 2nd 1000 steam/carbon molar ratio 5.7) achieve (71–72 mol%), (98–99 wt%) CO2 (17–18 mol%). optimal were tested in laboratory experimental results agreed well with an error 0.01–0.05. Sensitivity analysis revealed that increase temperatures both stages favoured H2 conversion.

title: A Local–Global Framework for Semantic Segmentation of Multisource Remote Sensing Images
abstract: Recently, deep learning has been widely used in the segmentation tasks of remote sensing images. title: A Natural CHI3L1—Targeting Compound, Ebractenoid F, Inhibits Lung Cancer Cell Growth and Migration and Induces Apoptosis by Blocking CHI3L1/AKT Signals
abstract: Our previous big data analyses reported a strong association between CHI3L1 expression and lung tumor development. In this present study, we investigated whether CHI3L1-inhibiting natural compound, ebractenoid F, inhibits cancer cell growth migration induces apoptosis. Ebractenoid F concentration-dependently (0, 17, 35, 70 µM) significantly inhibited the proliferation of A549 H460 cells induced mechanism found that bound to suppressed CHI3L1-associated AKT signaling. Combined treatment with an inhibitor, LY294002, synergistically decreased CHI3L1. Moreover, combination further apoptosis, as well levels apoptosis-related proteins. Thus, our demonstrate may serve potential anti-lung compound targeting

title: Shrimp Body Weight Estimation in Aquaculture Ponds Using Morphometric Features Based on Underwater Image Analysis and Machine Learning Approach
abstract: Shrimp is a marine culture found globally due to the ability of its yields boost country's economy. It imperative monitor size determine condition shrimp underwater with complex noise using non-invasive method. Therefore, this study aims develop new method for measuring body weight morphometric features based on image analysis and machine learning approach. The used consists several steps, data collection an camera, grayscale, binary, edge detection, region interest extraction, camera calibration Triangle Similarity (TS), Correction Factor (CF), calculation value, create model, training data, testing estimation weight. After get best accuracy value RMSE = 0.05, MAE 0.04, R2 0.96 from MLR In conclusion, results showed that hybrid TS-CF-MLR lowest error rate highest coefficient determination.

title: Dual Bayesian ResNet: A Deep Learning Approach to Heart Murmur Detection
abstract:
This study presents our team PathToMyHeart's contribution to the George B.
Moody PhysioNet Challenge 2022. Two models are implemented. The first model is
a Dual Bayesian ResNet (DBRes), where each patient's recording is segmented
into overlapping log mel spectrograms. These undergo two binary
classifications: present versus unknown or absent, and present
or absent. classifications aggregated give a final
classification. second output of DBRes integrated with
demographic data signal features using XGBoost.DBRes achieved best
weighted accuracy $0.771$ on hidden test set for murmur classification,
which placed us fourth task. (On clinical outcome task,
which we neglected, scored 17th with costs $12637$.) On held-out
subset training set, integrating demographic signal
features improved DBRes's from $0.762$ $0.820$. However, this
decreased weighted $0.780$ $0.749$. Our results
demonstrate that spectrograms an effective representation heart
sound recordings, networks provide strong supervised classification
performance, treating ternary classification as binary
classifications increases performance accuracy.

title: Responsible AI: Concepts, critical perspectives and an Information Systems research agenda
abstract: Being responsible for Artificial Intelligence (AI) harnessing its power while minimising risks individuals and society is one of the greatest challenges our time. A vibrant discourse on Responsible AI developing across academia, policy making corporate communications. In this editorial, we demonstrate how different literature strands intertwine but also diverge propose a comprehensive definition as practice developing, using governing in human-centred way to ensure that worthy being trusted adheres fundamental human values. This clarifies not specific category artifacts have special properties or can undertake responsibilities, humans are ultimately AI, consequences controlling development use. We explain four papers included issue manifest practices synthesise their findings into an integrative framework includes business models, services/products, design processes data. suggest IS Research contribute socially relevant knowledge about providing insights balance instrumental humanistic outcomes themes future research AI.

title: Use of UAVs and Deep Learning for Beach Litter Monitoring
abstract: Stranded beach litter is a ubiquitous issue. Manual monitoring and retrieval can be cost labour intensive. Therefore, automatic an essential mitigation strategy. In this paper, we present important foundational blocks that expanded into autonomous monitoring-and-retrieval pipeline based on drone surveys object detection using deep learning. Drone footage collected the islands of Malta Gozo in Sicily (Italy) Red Sea coast was combined with publicly available datasets used to train algorithm (YOLOv5) detect objects recorded during surveys. Across all classes objects, 50%–95% mean average precision (mAP50-95) 0.252, performance single well-represented reaching up 0.674. We also approach geolocate detected by algorithm, assigning latitude longitude coordinates each detection. combination morphology information derived from digital elevation models (DEMs) for path finding identifying inaccessible areas robot, research provides building automated pipeline.

title: GPApred: The first computational predictor for identifying proteins with LPXTG-like motif using sequence-based optimal features
abstract: The cell surface proteins of gram-positive bacteria are involved in many important biological functions, including the infection host cells. Owing to their virulent nature, these also considered strong candidates for potential drug or vaccine targets. Among various bacteria, LPXTG-like form a major class. These have highly conserved C-terminal wall sorting signal, which consists an LPXTG sequence motif, hydrophobic domain, and positively charged tail. targeted envelope by sortase enzyme via transpeptidation. A variety been experimentally characterized; however, number public databases has increased owing extensive bacterial genome sequencing without proper annotation. In absence experimental characterization, identifying annotating sequences is extremely challenging. Therefore, this study, we developed first machine learning-based predictor called GPApred, can identify from primary sequences. Using newly constructed benchmark dataset, explored different classifiers five feature encodings hybrids. Optimal features were derived using recursive elimination method, then trained support vector algorithm. performance models was evaluated independent datasets, final model (GPApred) selected based on consistency during cross-validation assessment. GPApred be effective tool predicting further employed functional characterization targeting. Availability: https://procarb.org/gpapred/.

abstract: Abstract Label-sensor is an essential component of the label printer which becoming a most significant tool for development Internet Things (IoT). However, some drawbacks traditional infrared label-sensor make fail to realize high-speed recognition labels as well stable printing. Herein, we propose self-powered and highly sensitive tribo-label-sensor (TLS) accurate identification, positioning counting by embedding triboelectric nanogenerator into indispensable roller structure printer. The sensing mechanism, device parameters deep comparison with sensor are systematically studied both in theory experiment. As results, TLS delivers 6 times higher signal magnitude than one. Moreover, immune jitter temperature variation during fast printing can also be used transparent directly shows long-term robustness. This work may provide alternative toolkit outstanding advantages improve current further promote IoT.
