title: Emotion Recognition Using Continuous Wavelet Transform and Ensemble of Convolutional Neural Networks through Transfer Learning from Electroencephalogram Signal
abstract: Purpose: Emotions are integral brain states that can influence our behavior, decision-making, and functions. Electroencephalogram (EEG) is an appropriate modality for emotion recognition since it has high temporal resolution a non-invasive cheap technique. Materials Methods: A novel approach based on Ensemble pre-trained Convolutional Neural Networks (ECNNs) proposed to recognize four emotional classes from EEG channels of individuals watching music video clips. First, scalograms built one-dimensional signals by applying the Continuous Wavelet Transform (CWT) method. Then, these images used re-train five CNNs: AlexNet, VGG-19, Inception-v1, ResNet-18, Inception-v3. majority voting method applied make final decision about classes. The 10-fold cross-validation evaluate performance 32 subjects DEAP database. title: Prediction of Solar Energy Yield Based on Artificial Intelligence Techniques for the Ha’il Region, Saudi Arabia
abstract: In order to satisfy increasing energy demand and mitigate global warming worldwide, the implementation of photovoltaic (PV) clean installations needs become common practice. However, solar is known be dependent on several random factors, including climatic geographic conditions. Prior promoting PV systems, an assessment study potential considered location in terms power yield should conducted carefully. Manual tools are unable handle high amounts data. overcome this difficulty, aims investigate various artificial intelligence (AI) models—with respect intuitive prediction benchmark models from literature—for predicting Ha’il region Saudi Arabia. Based daily data, seven seasonal models, namely, naïve (N), simple average (SA), moving (SMA), nonlinear auto-regressive (NAR), support vector machine (SVM), Gaussian process regression (GPR) neural network (NN), were investigated compared based root mean square error (RMSE) absolute percentage (MAPE) performance metrics. The obtained results showed that all provided good forecasts over three years (2019, 2020, 2021), with showing small superiority. can used by decision-makers specialists analyze systems estimate payback efficiency projects.

title: 3D Conformational Generative Models for Biological Structures Using Graph Information-Embedded Relative Coordinates
abstract: Developing molecular generative models for directly generating 3D conformation has recently become a hot research area. Here, an autoencoder based model was proposed generation. A unique feature of our method is that the graph information embedded relative coordinate (GIE-RC), satisfying translation and rotation invariance, as novel way encoding three-dimensional structure. Compared with commonly used Cartesian internal coordinate, GIE-RC less sensitive on errors when decoding latent variables to coordinates. By using this method, complex generation task can be turned into node problem. Examples were shown both ligand peptide Additionally, efficient sampling augment data needed in construction neural network-based force field.

Also experiments demonstrate improvement different crossover operators algorithm.

title: Deep Learning Based Heart Murmur Detection using Frequency-time Domain Features of Heartbeat Sounds
abstract: The goal of the George B. Moody PhysioNet Challenge 2022 was to use heart sound recordings gathered from various auscultation locations identify murmurs and clinical outcomes.Our team, CAU UMN, proposes a deep learning-based model that automatically identifies phonocardiogram (PCG).We converted heartbeat into 2D features in frequencytime domain through feature extraction techniques such as log-mel spectrogram, Short Time Fourier Transform (STFT), Constant Q (CQT).The frequencytemporal were modeled using voice classification models Convolutional neural networks (CNN) Light CNN (LCNN).The spectrogram LCNN ranked 5th for murmur detection with weighted accuracy 0.767 outcome cost 11933 test dataset Challenge.We believe our learning based system will be promising automatic PCG.

Moody PhysioNet Challenge 2022, we present an approach based on Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (BiLSTM) neural networks for detection murmurs prediction clinical outcome from Phonocardiograms (PCGs).We used homomorphic, Hilbert, power spectral density, wavelet envelopes as signal features, which extracted fixed-length segments 4 seconds train network.Using official challenge scoring metrics, our team SmartBeatIT achieved murmur weighted accuracy score 0.757 hidden test set (ranked 6th out 40 teams), cost 13815 25th 39 teams).With 5-fold cross-validation training set, in task obtained sensitivities 0.827 0.312 Present Unknown classes specificity 0.801; sensitivity 0.676 0.544 task.

Gaussian process regression-based Bayesian optimization of the insulation-coating process for Fe–Si alloy sheets
abstract: High-efficiency Fe–Si alloy sheets have recently gained increasing attention in the automobile industry, and these must be coated with insulation to reduce energy loss. However, it is difficult maintain coating without peeling realize high electrical high-temperature heat treatment process during coating. In this study, using an artificial intelligence algorithm— Gaussian regression (GPR)-assisted Bayesian optimization (BO)—we successfully developed a zirconia-based material for sheets, yielding resistance high-quality surface properties. The through optimized exhibits silvery-white surface, absence of damage even after at temperatures exceeding 1100 K, current value 600 mA or less, which measure insulation. Notably, compared existing trial-and-error method, number experiments required simultaneously achieve target characteristics was reduced less than 0.1% GPR-assisted BO, demonstrating feasibility approach. This result also validates efficiency effectiveness proposed method achieving multidimensional nonlinear actual mass production steel.

title: Deep Learning Design for Multiwavelength Infrared Image Sensors Based on Dielectric Freeform Metasurface
abstract: Abstract Near‐infrared multispectral imaging technology enhances target detection and recognition by distinguishing the spectral characteristics of various targets. However, traditional systems heavily rely on complex optical filter designs that are often bulky mechanically unstable, posing significant challenges for miniaturization integration challenging. In this study, a freeform dielectric metasurface with wavelength‐multiplexing focusing effect based deep learning model is designed, which can separate mixed near‐infrared light into distinct wavelengths. To effectively modulate amplitude transmitted at three wavelengths (1150, 1350, 1550 nm), high‐index silicon nanostructures supporting rich resonant modes proposed. An inverse design utilized to generate individual pixel pixel, satisfying requirement multiplexed metalens design. Both simulated experimental results show devices in good agreement negligible crosstalk. Finally, employed realize imaging, allows decoding images The proposed has wide range applications clinical medicine, biological tissue deep‐space exploration.

title: BD-SKUNet: Selective-Kernel UNets for Building Damage Assessment in High-Resolution Satellite Images
abstract: When natural disasters occur, timely and accurate building damage assessment maps are vital for disaster management responders to organize their resources efficiently. Pairs of pre- post-disaster remote sensing imagery have been recognized as invaluable data sources that provide useful information identification. Recently, deep learning-based semantic segmentation models widely successfully applied tasks. In this study, a two-stage, dual-branch, UNet architecture, with shared weights between two branches, is proposed address the inaccuracies in footprint localization per-building level classification. A newly introduced selective kernel module improves performance model by enhancing extracted features applying adaptive receptive field variations. The xBD dataset used train, validate, test based on evaluation metrics such F1-score Intersection over Union (IoU). Overall, experiments comparisons demonstrate superior model. addition, results further confirmed evaluating geographical transferability completely unseen from new region (Bam city earthquake 2003).

title: A PSO-CNN-Based Deep Learning Model for Predicting Forest Fire Risk on a National Scale
abstract: Forest fires have a significant impact on terrestrial ecosystems, leading to harm biodiversity and environment. To mitigate the ecological damage caused by forest fires, it was necessary develop prediction models of fire risk. In this study, evolving optimal architecture parameters using particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm, convolutional neural network (CNN) deep learning model proposed predict risk national scale. Utilizing data factors from 2001 2020 in China, PSO-CNN-based (PSO-CNN) utilized tested. Compared logistic regression, random forest, support vector machine, k-nearest neighbors, CNN models, PSO-CNN exhibited superior performance with an accuracy 82.2% AUC value 0.92. These results clearly highlighted effectiveness enhancing prediction. Furthermore, level estimated scale for entire country mostly consistent actual distribution, indicating its potential be used as important direction research.

title: Conceptual Framework and Prospective Analysis of EU Tourism Data Spaces
abstract: This article delves deeply into the burgeoning field of Tourism Data Spaces (TDS) in Europe, focusing on how technologies like Big and IoT are redefining tourism sector. technological shift is steering traditional tourist destinations towards smarter, more sustainable models. The study utilizes a multifaceted approach, combining documentary bibliographical analysis with empirical data from EU’s DATES project. title: Navigation and Robotics in Interventional Oncology: Current Status and Future Roadmap
abstract: Interventional oncology (IO) is the field of Radiology that provides minimally invasive procedures under imaging guidance for diagnosis and treatment malignant tumors. title: Assessment of machine learning methods predicting the axial vibration frequencies of microbars
abstract: Abstract Microbars are one of the important components microelectromechanical systems. With recent increase in their applications, importance understanding mechanical response has become an topic. In this study, for first time, behavior microbars based on strain gradient theory is investigated using a machine learning (ML) approach. Four distinct ML models, namely artificial neural network (ANN), support vector regression (SVR), decision tree (DTR), and random forest (RFR), developed with clamped boundary conditions. The performance these models individually assessed five different metrics: coefficient determination ( R 2 ), Mean Absolute Error (MAE), root mean square error (RMSE), absolute percentage (MAPE) Nash‐Sutcliffe efficiency (NSE). best‐performing model selected comparisons. Additionally, semi‐analytical approach employed to determine natural frequencies under general elastic conditions Fourier sine series Stokes' transform. While value all four indicated good fit 0.999, difference MAE RMSE values between training testing data DTR RFR was relatively higher as compared ANN SVR. results showed that SVR exhibit best predicting both across three metrics. Finally, study free axial vibration microbar various effects conducted.

title: Perception of Generative Artificial Intelligence in Higher Education Research
abstract: Integrating Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) into higher education research holds great promise, but understanding researchers' perceptions and addressing associated challenges is crucial for success. This study investigates how researchers perceive the potential benefits of AI, its ease use, affecting adoption in research. It aims to uncover diverse perspectives insights effective integration. Using a qualitative case approach, data was collected from 33 social sciences at one institution through online surveys interviews. Thematic analysis, guided by Technology Acceptance Model (TAM), identified recurring themes. The findings reveal significant engagement with AI adoption, most participants integrating their However, readiness adopt varied, reflecting different levels enthusiasm preparedness. Participants' ranged recognizing AI's convenience expressing concerns about negative impacts such as becoming overly reliant, aligning TAM constructs. Additionally, stressed importance responsible ethical usage training awareness initiatives. These lay foundation strategies promoting integration Implications institutions aiming integrate effectively emphasize need understand address concerns.

title: Artificial Intelligence in Predicting Microsatellite Instability and KRAS, BRAF Mutations from Whole-Slide Images in Colorectal Cancer: A Systematic Review
abstract: Mismatch repair deficiency (d-MMR)/microsatellite instability (MSI), KRAS, and BRAF mutational status are crucial for treating advanced colorectal cancer patients. Traditional methods like immunohistochemistry or polymerase chain reaction (PCR) can be challenged by artificial intelligence (AI) based on whole slide images (WSI) to predict tumor status. In this systematic review, we evaluated the role of AI in predicting MSI status, mutations cancer. Studies published PubMed up June 2023 were included (n = 17), reported risk bias performance each study. Some studies impacted reduced number slides data set lack external validation cohorts. Deep learning models d-MMR/MSI showed a good training cohorts (mean AUC 0.89, [0.74–0.97]) but slightly less than expected cohort when available 0.82, [0.63–0.98]). Contrary prediction KRAS was explored with robust methodology. The lower, maximum 0.77 cohort, 0.58 0.82 BRAF.

title: Experimental Results of Underwater Sound Speed Profile Inversion by Few-Shot Multi-Task Learning
abstract: Underwater Sound Speed Profile (SSP) distribution is crucial for the propagation mode of acoustic signals, so fast and accurate estimation SSP great importance in building underwater observation systems. The state-of-the-art inversion methods include frameworks matched field processing (MFP), compressive sensing (CS), feed-forward neural networks (FNNs), among which FNN shows better real-time performance while maintaining same level accuracy. However, training needs quite a lot historical samples, difficult to satisfy many ocean areas. This situation called few-shot learning. To tackle this issue, we propose multi-task learning (MTL) model with partial parameter sharing different tasks. By MTL, common features could be extracted, accelerates process on given tasks, reduces demand reference enhancing generalization ability verify feasibility effectiveness deep-ocean experiment was held April 2023 South China Sea. Results show that MTL outperforms other mainstream terms accuracy inversion, inheriting advantage during stage.

title: STUDENT DROPOUT PREDICTION USING MACHINE LEARNING
abstract: In a higher education environment, we considered the likelihood of probable dropouts from first-year undergraduate Computer Science program. order to achieve this, data five academic sessions were obtained Department Science, University Benin, Nigeria. Out nine hundred and forty seven (947) obtained, only total six (906) was usable after cleaning preprocessing. Six distinct classifiers including Naive Bayes (NB), Logistic Regression (LR), Support Vector Machine (SVM), Decision Tree (DT), K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN), Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) modeled for prediction student success dropouts. The performance stated have performed on average at 90.4%, 98.9%, 98.5%, 97.4%, 96.0% 97.3% respectively. Although there wasn't much difference between DT, SVM, LR, LR model chosen deployment since it performs better than other two models in terms F1_score Recall.

title: XAI-PDF: A Robust Framework for Malicious PDF Detection Leveraging SHAP-Based Feature Engineering
abstract: With the increasing number of malicious PDF files used for cyberattacks, it is essential to develop efficient and accurate classifiers detect prevent these threats. Machine Learning (ML) models have successfully detected files. This paper presents XAI-PDF, an system detection designed enhance accuracy minimize decision-making time on a modern dataset, Evasive-PDFMal2022 dataset. The proposed method optimizes classifier performance by employing feature engineering guided Shapley Additive Explanations (SHAP). Particularly, model development approach comprises four phases: data preparation, building, explainability models, derived features. Utilizing interpretability SHAP values, crucial features are identified, new ones generated, resulting in improved classification that showcases effectiveness interpretable AI techniques enhancing performance. Various ML were implemented, with Lightweight Gradient Boosting (LGBM) outperforming other classifiers. Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) global surrogate generated explanations LGBM predictions. Experimental comparisons XAI-PDF baseline methods revealed its superiority achieving higher accuracy, precision, F1-scores minimal False Positive (FP) Negative (FN) rates (99.9%, 100%, 99.89%,0.000, 0.002, respectively). Additionally, requires only 1.36 milliseconds per record predictions, demonstrating increased resilience detecting evasive compared state-of-the-art

abstract: Every year, cardiovascular disease (CVD) claims the lives of nearly 17 million people worldwide. Predicting heart early and accurately can help delay therapies improve results. Patient data analysis machine learning techniques have shown promise for better predictive capabilities than conventional methods; however, there are still gaps in areas such as algorithm blending, standardization, feature optimization, model tuning that require strong methodology. On public dataset, refined exceptional performance, highlighting methodical prediction. external validation optimization various patient populations should be main attention future research.

title: Comparative analysis of SMLR, ANN, Elastic net and LASSO based models for rice crop yield prediction in Uttarakhand
abstract: The study was aimed to develop the yield forecast model for rice crop yield. Four different techniques i.e. Stepwise Multiple Linear Regression (SMLR), Artificial Neural Network (ANN), Least Absolute Shrinkage and Selection Operator (LASSO) Elastic Net (ELNET)were used build prediction models. Dataset of meteorological data 15 years have been developed models were also validated on dataset three years. assessment wasdone by using root mean square error (RMSE),normalized (nRMSE),Mean Error (MAE) basis coefficient determination (R2). experimental analysis suggested that performance (R2=0.99, RMSE=0.07, nRMSE=2.20, MAE=0.06) is better as compared SMLR(R2=0.97, RMSE=0.08, nRMSE=2.34, MAE=0.05), LASSO (R2=0.62, RMSE=0.26, nRMSE=7.81, MAE=0.24) ELNET (R2=0.54, RMSE=0.38, nRMSE=11.41, MAE=0.37) predictionof Udham Singh Nagar (USN) district Uttarakhand. Therefore, yield, ANN technique can be well utilised Uttarakhand.

title: Mastering Prompt Engineering: Optimizing Interaction with Generative AI Agents
abstract: Generative AI technologies are reshaping multiple sectors by enhancing how tasks executed, and information is processed. title: Unveiling the Power of Deep Learning: A Comparative Study of LSTM, BERT, and GRU for Disaster Tweet Classification
abstract: Disasters have serious effects on people"s lives and buildings. Therefore, social media platforms, such as Twitter, become more critical. They are crucial tools for responding to managing disasters effectively. This study examined the effectiveness of various deep learning models, bidirectional encoder representations from transformers (BERT), gated recurrent units (GRU), long short-term memory (LSTM) classifying disaster-related tweets. Twitter data related different were collected using hashtags. The then cleaned, preprocessed, manually annotated by a team. divided into training, validation, testing sets. used train three models based BERT, GRU, LSTM categorical classification disaster Finally, evaluated compared test data. BERT achieved an accuracy 96.2%, making it most effective model. In contrast, GRU 93.2% 88.4%, respectively. These findings underscore potential in tweets, offering insights that could enhance management strategies, refine monitoring processes, bolster public safety, provide directions future research.

abstract: In recent years, edge intelligence (EI) has emerged, combining computing with AI, and specifically deep learning, to run AI algorithms directly on devices. practical applications, EI faces challenges related computational power, power consumption, size, cost, the primary challenge being trade-off between consumption. The experimental results show that when running at clock speed of 100 MHz, PIPELINE accelerator, compared UNROLL experiences an 8.09% increase in consumption but speeds up by 14.972 times, accelerator superior performance. title: Mitigating cyber threats in healthcare systems: the role of artificial intelligence and machine learning
abstract: As we move further into the digital era, importance of cybersecurity becomes increasingly apparent, especially in healthcare industry, where sensitive patient data is stored and transmitted through various technological systems. The advancement technology makes safeguarding systems from cyber threats more critical than ever. Cybercriminals target information, financial data, medical records, resulting severe consequences like reputational damage, loss trust, losses, legal consequences, potential harm to patients. title: AUTOMATED QUALITY ASSESSMENT OF APPLES USING CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORKS
abstract: Quality assessment of apples is a pivotal task in the agriculture and food industries, with direct implications for economic gains consumer satisfaction. Traditional methods, whether manual, mechanical or electromechanical, face challenges terms labor intensity, speed, quality control. This paper introduces solution using machine learning algorithms – specifically, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) more nuanced efficient apple assessment. Our approach offers balance between high-speed capabilities electromechanical sorting detailed recognition achievable human evaluation. A dataset consisting over 2000 images, labeled as 'Good' 'Damaged', was compiled training validation purposes. The investigates various architectures hyperparameter settings several CNN models to optimize performance metrics, such accuracy, precision, recall. Preliminary evaluations indicate that MobileNet Inception yield highest levels emphasizing potential significantly enhance processes. Such improvements can lead greater efficiency, reduced costs, rigorous control measures.

title: Systematic Review of Marketing Attribution Techniques for Omnichannel Customer Acquisition Models
abstract: In the evolving landscape of digital commerce, ability to accurately attribute marketing outcomes specific touchpoints within customer journey is critical for optimizing omnichannel acquisition strategies. This systematic review examines current state attribution techniques applied in models, with goal identifying prevailing methodologies, comparative effectiveness, and emerging trends. A comprehensive search peer-reviewed journals, industry reports, conference proceedings published between 2013 2024 was conducted using databases such as Scopus, Web Science, Google Scholar. The categorizes into rule-based models (e.g., first-touch, last-touch, linear), algorithmic logistic regression, Markov chains), advanced machine learning approaches Shapley value deep learning). Findings indicate a significant shift from traditional methods data-driven probabilistic that account inter-channel synergies temporal dependencies. Algorithmic like chains demonstrate superior performance capturing non-linear dynamic nature journeys, while offer greater predictive accuracy scalability complex environments. However, challenges data integration across disparate channels, bias, model interpretability, real-time application remain prominent. further highlights importance contextual factors type, segmentation, campaign objectives selecting appropriate models. It also identifies growing interest hybrid frameworks blend business rules enhanced transparency decision-making support. study concludes hold substantial promise, successful implementation hinges on quality, cross-functional collaboration, technological maturity. Future research should focus adaptive attribution, causal inference techniques, standardized evaluation metrics advance field. provides foundation marketers, analysts, researchers seeking enhance through informed

Study on the Spatiotemporal Variation in and Driving Mechanism of Water Quality in Baiyangdian Lake
abstract: Analyzing 165 data from five national control sites in Baiyangdian Lake, this study unveils its spatiotemporal pattern of water quality. Utilizing machine learning and multivariate statistical techniques, elucidates the effects rainfall human activities on lake’s The results show that main pollutants Lake are TN, TP, IMN. Spatially, drivers quality, with poorest quality observed surrounding village area. temporal dynamics parameters exhibit three distinct patterns: Firstly, predominantly influenced by point source pollution, like TN NH4+-N, lower concentrations during flood periods. Secondly, affected non-point such as higher Thirdly, irregular variations were pH, DO, evaluation Lake’s based grey relationship analysis method indicates is good, falling within Classes I II. Time series found dilution effect scouring action runoff dominate variation Lake. major pollution sources identified domestic sewage, followed agricultural release internal pollutants. Additionally, aquaculture emerged a significant contributor to pollution. This research provides scientific basis for controlling continuous deterioration restoring ecological function.

title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in Predicting Oil Production Based on Water Injection Rate
abstract: The utilization of artificial intelligence (AI) has become imperative across various domains, including the oil and gas industry, which covers several fields, reservoirs, drilling, production. In production, conventional methods, such as reservoir simulation, are used to predict production rate. This simulation requires comprehensive data, so each process step takes a long time is expensive. AI urgently needed can be solution in this case. research aims apply techniques forecast rates based on water injection from two wells. Three wells connected with direct line drive pattern. different methods were applied, multiple linear polynomial regression (PR), (MLR), neural networks (ANN) constructing rate prediction models. Actual field data 1180 used, history one well. dataset been split randomly into 80% training 20% allocated for testing subsets. build predictive models, while validate model performance. Comparative analysis selects lowest root mean square error (RMSE) highest R^2 test value. Results demonstrate that ANN achieves smallest Root Mean Square Error 0.142 value 16.2%, outperforming PR MLR methods. provides rapid efficient approach estimating rates.

title: Suggestions for the Use of Fashion Images with Generative AI-Focusing on Application of AI Training Data and AI Technology-
abstract: 머신러닝 이후 급속히 발달한 인공지능은 다량의 데이터와 최신 기술이 적용되어 생성형 인공지능으로 진화하였다. 다양한 인공지능 플랫폼 개방으로 이를 활용한 연구가 필요한 실정이다. 본 연구는 최신기술이 탑재된 인공지능을 활용하여 패션 디자인분야에 적용 방법을 제시하는 것을 목적으로 한다. 이론적 배경은 학습과 적용된 기술에 중점을 두었다. 인공지능이 어떻게 학습되고 어떠한 이미지 발전하였는지를 분석 하였다. 국내외 선행연구와 연구소의 기술자료 등 문헌중심의 질적 연구방법을 택하였다. 실증 연구로 기술인 멀티모달 '빙 챗(Bing Chat)GPT'를 디자인 도구로 활용하였다. 제시어를 입력하여 패션디자인에 결과물을 생성하여 그 활용성을 논하였다.BR 연구범위는 적용하기 위한 주요 요소인 데이터의 가공과 패션데이터세트를 기반으로 인공지능기술은 패션이미지 생성을 딥러닝 모델연구와 실행을 최신인공지능 기술로 범위를 제한하였다.BR 연구 결과는 다음과 같다.BR 첫째, 추구하는 목적에 의해 수집되고 가공된 데이터는 패션데이터세트로 구성되어 학습을 모델로 개발되었다.BR 둘째, 데이터세트는 생성 모델을 패션이미지를 생성하는 인공지능에 활용되었다.BR 셋째, 시각적 이미지가 중요시 되는 디자인에는 보조디자인 활용이 가능하다.BR 넷째, 가장 최신기술인 멀티모달이 인공지능인 Chat)GPT'는 드로잉, 테마 디자인, 무드보드, 도식화, 패션모델 등의 생성에 활용될 수 있다.BR 패션디자인 분야에 기존의 동향조사에서 벗어나 창의적 활동이 가능하다. 또한 과정에 시간을 절약해 주는 효과가 있다. 이러한 인공지능의 적용은 기술의 진화와 함께 무한할 것이다.

abstract: Menter k-ω shear stress transport (SST) turbulence model demonstrates excellent performance for incompressible, subsonic and transonic flows with mild separation but shows overprediction of the bubble supersonic shock-wave/boundary layer interaction (SWBLI). Some efforts focus on effect structure parameter in limiter an ad-hoc way. Few studies attempt to construct relation between flow field variables. The motivation this work is such a augment prediction SST by introducing correction factor. Machine learning methods are used since physical mechanism SWBLI complex unclear. simulation results show that constructed enhances near shock wave boundary when applied model. Compared direct numerical experimental data, pressure skin friction coefficients along wall velocity significantly improved. In addition, introduced factor can automatically degrade benchmark case NACA4412 airfoil maintain accuracy original model, delay location case.

title: A new technique for cataract eye disease diagnosis in deep learning
abstract: Automated diagnosis of eye diseases using fundus images is challenging because manual analysis time-consuming, prone to errors, and complicated. Thus, computer-aided tools for automatically detecting various ocular disorders from are needed. Deep learning algorithms enable improved image classifi-cation, making automated targeted disease detection feasible. This study employed state-of-the-art deep classifiers, such as VGG-19, categorize the highly imbalanced ODIR-5K (Ocular Disease Intelligent Recognition) dataset 5000 across eight classes, including cata-ract, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration. To address this imbalance, multiclass problem converted into binary classification tasks with equal samples in each category. The was preprocessed augmented generate balanced datasets. classifiers were trained on flat data VGG-19 (Visual Geometry Group) model. approach achieved an accuracy 95% distinguishing normal versus cataract cases only 15 epochs, outperforming previous methods. Precision recall high both classes – Normal Cataract, F1 scores 0.95-0.96. Balanc-ing significantly images. With further research, could lead deploying AI (Artificial intelligence)-assisted ophthalmologists screen patients support clinical decision-making.

title: The Rapid Determination of Three Toxic Ginkgolic Acids in the Decolorized Process of Ginkgo Ketone Ester Based on Raman Spectroscopy and ResNeXt50 Deep Neural Network
abstract: The decolorization process plays a pivotal role in refining Ginkgo ketone ester by primarily eliminating ginkgolic acids, toxic component. Presently, the conventional testing method involves sending samples for analysis, causing delays that impact formulation production. Hence, development of rapid control becomes imperative. This study introduces swift detection approach three acids during ester’s decolorization. Initially, an ultra-high-performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UPLC-MS/MS) assessed acid C13:0, C15:1, and C17:1 concentrations 91 decolorized solution samples, establishing reference values. Subsequently, using portable Raman spectrometer, spectra within 3200–200 cm−1 wavelength range were collected. Ultimately, employing partial least squares regression (PLSR) ResNeXt50 deep learning algorithms, two quantitative calibration models correlated content to spectral data. Both exhibited high predictive accuracy, with model demonstrating superior performance. prediction set correlation coefficients (Rp2) 0.9962, 0.9971, 0.9974, respectively, root mean square error (RMSEP) values 0.0144, 0.0130, 0.0122 μg/mL. In contrast, PLSR yielded Rp2 0.9862, 0.9839, 0.9480, RMSEP 0.0273, 0.0305, 0.0545 μg/mL acids. not only showcased higher precision but also enhanced interpretability, as analyzed through gradient-weighted class activation mapping (Grad-CAM). integration spectroscopy furnishes real-time precise monitor preparation. significant advancement establishes robust framework implementing quality measures process.

title: Measurement of the dynamic viscosity of water-based nanofluids containing Al2O3, TiO2, and ZnO using the Artificial Neural Network method
abstract: Nanofluids are strong candidates as heat carriers due to their excellent thermophysical properties. Among these properties, viscosity is critical in transfer and pressure loss calculations. In this study, three different water-based nanofluids, Al2O3, TiO2, ZnO, were prepared with volumetric concentrations ranging from 0.1% 1%. The dynamic viscosities of nanofluids experimentally measured within a temperature range 20 °C 50 °C. Artificial neural networks (ANN) employed predict the results based on experimental data. Two approaches applied implementation ANN method. first approach involved creating separate models, each dedicated predicting nanofluids. second used single generalized all evaluated using criteria R-squared (R2) root mean square error (RMSE) values. R2 values exceeded 99%, while RMSE calculated for ZnO nanofluid models model be 0.40%, 0.30%, 0.04%, 0.28% respectively. These demonstrate that nanofluid's can effectively predicted individually multiple an model.
detailed_text: Nanofluids are strong candidates as heat carriers due to their excellent thermophysical properties. Among these properties, viscosity is critical in transfer and pressure loss calculations. In this study, three different water-based nanofluids, Al2O3, TiO2, ZnO, were prepared with volumetric concentrations ranging from 0.1% 1%. The dynamic viscosities of nanofluids experimentally measured within a temperature range 20 °C 50 °C. Artificial neural networks (ANN) employed predict the results based on experimental data. Two approaches applied implementation ANN method. first approach involved creating separate models, each dedicated predicting nanofluids. second used single generalized all evaluated using criteria R-squared (R2) root mean square error (RMSE) values. R2 values exceeded 99%, while RMSE calculated for ZnO nanofluid models model be 0.40%, 0.30%, 0.04%, 0.28% respectively. These demonstrate that nanofluid's can effectively predicted individually multiple an model. Measurement of the dynamic viscosity of water-based nanofluids containing Al2O3, TiO2, and ZnO using the Artificial Neural Network method

title: Strategic Allocation of Building Carbon Emission Rights Within Urban Frameworks: A Case Study of Henan Province Under China’s Dual Carbon Objectives
abstract: The advent of China's “dual carbon” objectives necessitates stringent carbon emission reductions across all sectors, notably within the construction industry, which accounts for a significant proportion nation's emissions. This study presents comprehensive examination allocation building rights, underpinned by an index system specifically designed sector, to adhere overarching goals neutrality. Ten refined indicators were developed, encapsulating principles fairness, efficiency, and sustainability, including metrics such as stock value added industry. Employing methodological framework that integrates centralized Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) approach, entropy method, k-means clustering, this research delineates effective strategy quotas. initial Henan Province in 2023 revealed geographical variance, characterized higher quotas west compared east, with Zhengzhou City allocated 16.53 Mt emissions—3.59 times greater than Zhoukou City, municipality receiving lowest quota. Subsequent optimization adjustment led identification that, out eighteen cities municipalities, ten require no immediate modification their rights. Meanwhile, four found have surplus, faced deficit. findings not only offer actionable insights implementation urban-level reduction strategies but also enhance discourse on thereby contributing broader aim achieving approach empirical demonstration serve pivotal reference similar endeavors other regions, emphasizing necessity tailored, data-driven account local economic activities practices.

title: The Direction of Writing Education in the Era of Generative Artificial Intelligence
abstract: 이 논문은 생성형 인공지능과 글쓰기 교육에 대한 다음의 3가지 초점을 중심으로, 인공지능 시대 대학 교육의 방향을 설계하였다. 첫째, 인공지능이 미치게 될 영향에 예측이다. 현재 많은 논의들이 글쓰기의 편리성과 효율성에 근거해 글쓰기에 인공지능을 활용하는 방법을 모색하는 한편, 윤리의 문제, 정보의 부정확성 사고 능력의 저하 문제 등 활용이 내포하는 위험성 또한 의식하고 있다. 인공지능의 ‘편리성’과 ‘효율성’은 창조적 · 비판적 사고의 주체로서 인재양성의 목표를 대체할 수 없다. 따라서 앞으로의 교육은 인공지능에 의해 쉽게 대체 있는 ‘기능’ 숙련의 차원에서 접근하기보다는, 과정의 체험으로서 접근하는 방향으로 나아가야 한다. 둘째, 시대의 교육과 평가 방법론에 모색이다. 사고력과 창조력을 보존하고 육성하는 교육을 위해서는 글쓰기가 요구하는 지적 활동의 과정들을 학습자가 직접 경험할 있도록 단계들을 고안하고, 각 단계의 수행적 성취도를 평가하는 평가의 방식이 요구된다. 셋째, 의미변화와 새롭게 요구되는 작문 능력에 전망이다. 성공적으로 상호작용하며 인간의 능력과 기계의 잠재력을 동시에 발휘하기 위해 필요한 읽기와 쓰기의 메타적 역량은 기초 리터러시의 숙련도를 요구한다. 기계 기반 리터러시와 함께 리터러시 역량을 기르는 다양한 경험을 제공해야 이러한 세 가지 문제의식을 바탕으로, 성찰적 학술적 실용적 영역에서 학습자의 양성하기 위한 수업 및 기본 제시하고자 하였다.

The Direction of Writing Education in the Era of Generative Artificial Intelligence

title: Development and Evaluation of an Intelligent Control System for Sustainable and Efficient Energy Management
abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive study on the integration of Intelligent Control Systems in global industrial sector, focusing enhancing energy management through synergy Supervisory and Data Acquisition (SCADA), Machine Learning (ML), Digital Twin technologies. We elaborate novel ICS architecture designed to optimize consumption, reduce operational costs, minimize environmental impacts. Our system leverages SCADA for real-time monitoring control, ML algorithms predictive analytics optimization, technology advanced simulation efficiency. The implementation mid-scale facility demonstrated significant improvements: 15% reduction an 18% decrease peak demand, 30% CO2 emissions, downtime, with accuracy standing at 90%. These results underline potential integrating digital technologies management, offering scalable model sustainable efficient practices. Future work will explore broader applications incorporation emerging further enhance system's capabilities applicability diverse settings.

title: Constructing Revenue Growth Acceleration Frameworks through Strategic Fintech Partnerships in Digital E-Commerce Ecosystems
abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for accelerating revenue growth in digital e-commerce ecosystems through strategic financial technology (fintech) partnerships. The rise of commerce has redefined the dynamics market engagement, where customer-centric innovation, inclusivity, and data intelligence are pivotal. Fintech entities serve as critical enablers, providing technological infrastructure, services, analytical capabilities necessary to optimize user experience, enhance operational efficiency, drive business scalability. proposed identifies integrates key drivers growth, including personalization technologies, advanced payment solutions, real-time customer insights, into collaborative partnership models. It also addresses platform interoperability, risk management, compliance core structural components. By operationalizing these dimensions alignment, performance metrics, adaptability mechanisms, offers viable roadmap sustainable growth. study concludes with policy recommendations while highlighting future avenues AI integration, embedded finance, global regulatory convergence further enrich strategies evolving marketplaces.

title: AntiHalluciNet: A Potential Auditing Tool of the Behavior of Deep Learning Denoising Models in Low-Dose Computed Tomography

title: Cascading Machine Learning to Monitor Volcanic Thermal Activity Using Orbital Infrared Data: From Detection to Quantitative Evaluation
abstract: Several satellite missions are currently available to provide thermal infrared data at different spatial resolutions and revisit time. Furthermore, new planned thus enabling keep a nearly continuous ‘eye’ on volcanic activity around the world. This massive volume of requires development artificial intelligence (AI) techniques for automatic processing in order extract significant information about volcano conditions short Here, we propose robust machine learning approach accurately detect, recognize quantify high-temperature features using Sentinel-2 MultiSpectral Instrument (S2-MSI) imagery. We use entire archive high resolution containing more than 6000 S2-MSI scenes ten volcanoes Combining ‘top-down’ cascading architecture, two models, scene classifier (SqueezeNet) pixel-based segmentation model (random forest), achieved very accuracy, namely 95%. These results show that can be applied near-real time any image, providing full description scene, with an important contribution monitoring, mapping characterization features.

title: An IoT-Based Hydroponic Monitoring and Control System for Sustainable Food Production
abstract: The agricultural sector, historically the main source of food globally, faces unprecedented challenges due to decreasing soil fertility and unsustainable farming practices. This study presents a smart method, tailored approach cultivating arable crops, as sustainable innovative method. Hydroponics involves growing plants in nutrient water solutions rather than soil, establishing controlled environment free from external conditions. We developed sophisticated hydroponics system equipped with sensors monitoring temperature, humidity, pH, light levels. Using IoT technologies, we enabled real-time data transmission dedicated web server - Amazon services (AWS) an Android mobile application powered by Raspberry Pi3. setup allows remote control hydroponic system, reducing human intervention. experiment validated sensor network's efficiency accurately transmitting data. findings suggest that widespread adoption could substantially enhance global security. Future advancements this method include plant growth rates incorporating additional sensors, like carbon dioxide (CO2) sensors. research is significant step toward agriculture. It offers technologically advanced solution capable transforming production methods ensuring more secure supply worldwide.

title: Enhancing Disease Management in Mango Cultivation: A Machine Learning Approach to Classifying Leaf Diseases
abstract: This study explores the application of machine learning techniques in agricultural domain, focusing on classification two common diseases mango leaves: Powdery Mildew and Sooty Mould. Utilizing MangoLeafBD dataset, research employs a Gradient Boosting Classifier, enhanced with mean shift image segmentation Hu moments for feature extraction. The performance model was rigorously evaluated through 5-fold cross-validation, yielding insights into its accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score. results demonstrate moderate success, highest accuracy precision observed initial fold, indicating model's potential reliable disease identification. addresses challenge distinguishing between similar symptomatic appearances, offering novel, data-driven approach management cultivation. contributes to growing field agriculture, highlighting enhancing diagnosis treatment strategies, thus supporting sustainable practices.

title: Exploring CO2 storage potential in Lithuanian deep saline aquifers using digital rock volumes: a machine learning guided approach
abstract: The increasing significance of carbon capture, utilization and storage (CCUS) as a climate mitigation strategy has underscored the importance accurately evaluating subsurface reservoirs for CO 2 sequestration. In this context, digital rock volumes, obtained through advanced imaging techniques such micro-Xray computed tomography (MXCT), offer intricate insights into porous permeable structures geological formations. This study presents comprehensive methodology assessing viability within Lithuanian deep saline aquifers, namely Syderiai Vaskai, by utilizing petrophysical properties estimated from volumes samples analogous It also demonstrates potential integrating techniques, machine learning, numerical modeling accurate assessment effective management storage.

title: NU-Biped-4.5: A Lightweight and Low-Prototyping-Cost Full-Size Bipedal Robot
abstract: This paper presents the design of a new lightweight, full-size bipedal robot developed in Humanoid Robotics Laboratory at Nazarbayev University. The robot, equipped with 12 degrees freedom (DOFs), stands 1.1 m tall and weighs only 15 kg (excluding battery). Through implementation simple mechanical utilization off-the-shelf components, overall prototype cost remained under USD 5000. incorporation high-performance in-house-developed servomotors enables robot’s actuation system to generate up 2400 W power, resulting power-to-weight ratio 160 W/kg. details electrical are presented alongside formalization forward kinematic model using successive screw displacement method solution inverse kinematics. Tests conducted both simulation environment on real demonstrate that is capable accurately following reference joint trajectories execute quasi-static gait, achieving an average power consumption 496 W.

abstract: The global population’s rapid growth necessitates a 70% increase in agricultural production, posing challenges exacerbated by weed infestation and herbicide drawbacks. To address this, machine learning (ML) models, particularly convolutional neural networks (CNNs), are employed precision agriculture (PA) for detection. Furthermore, 4, 96.15%, highest one. ML can help automate crop problem detection, promote organic farming, optimize resource use, aid reduce waste, boost efficiency, contribute greener, sustainable future.

title: FusionMamba: dynamic feature enhancement for multimodal image fusion with Mamba
abstract: Abstract Multimodal image fusion aims to integrate information from different imaging techniques produce a comprehensive, detail-rich single for downstream vision tasks. Existing methods based on local convolutional neural networks (CNNs) struggle capture global features efficiently, while Transformer-based models are computationally expensive, although they excel at modeling. Mamba addresses these limitations by leveraging selective structured state space (S4) effectively handle long-range dependencies maintaining linear complexity. In this paper, we propose FusionMamba, novel dynamic feature enhancement framework that overcome the challenges faced CNNs and Vision Transformers (ViTs) in computer The improves visual state-space model integrating convolution channel attention mechanisms, which not only retains its powerful modeling capability, but also greatly reduces redundancy enhances expressiveness of features. addition, have developed new module called (DFFM). It combines (DFEM) texture disparity perception with cross-modal (CMFM), focuses enhancing inter-modal correlation suppressing redundant information. Experiments show FusionMamba achieves state-of-the-art performance variety multimodal tasks as well experiments, demonstrating broad applicability superiority.

title: From Excitement to Anxiety: Exploring English as a Foreign Language Learners' Emotional Experiences in the Artificial Intelligence‐Powered Classrooms
abstract: ABSTRACT The use of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies in second/foreign language education has recently gained a bulk attention. However, the emotional experiences English as foreign (EFL) learners AI‐mediated classes have been ignored. To fill this gap, present qualitative study examined 34 Chinese EFL students' perceptions AI‐induced emotions and regulation strategies. A semi‐structured interview narrative frame were used to collect data. gathered data thematically analysed through latest version MAXQDA software (v. 2023). findings revealed that students had mostly experienced positive ‘motivation’, ‘excitement’, ‘engagement’ ‘confidence’. On negative side, they reported experiencing ‘frustration’, ‘anxiety’ ‘stress’ more frequently their classes. Furthermore, indicated participants six strategies, namely ‘seeking help from others’, ‘shifting attention’, ‘cognitive change’, ‘persistent practice’, ‘staying positive’ ‘suppression’ regulate emotions. are discussed implications provided for educators understand aspect AI injection into L2 education.

title: Transformative strategies in photocatalyst design: merging computational methods and deep learning
abstract: Photocatalysis is a unique technology that harnesses solar energy through in-situ processes, operating without the need for external inputs. It integral to advancing environmental, energy, chemical, and carbon-neutral objectives, promoting dual goals of pollution control carbon reduction. However, conventional approach photocatalyst design faces challenges such as inefficiency, high costs, low success rates, highlighting integrating modern technologies seeking new paradigms. Here, we demonstrate comprehensive overview transformative strategies in design, combining computational materials science with deep learning technologies. The review covers fundamental principles followed by examination methods workflow deep-learning-assisted design. Deep approaches are extensively reviewed, focusing on discovery novel photocatalysts, microstructure property optimization, approaches, application exploration, mechanistic insights into photocatalysis. Finally, highlight synergy between multidimensional computation learning, while discussing future directions development. This offers summary offering not only enhance development photocatalytic but also expand practical applications photocatalysis various domains.

title: Comparative analysis of deep neural network architectures for renewable energy forecasting: enhancing accuracy with meteorological and time-based features
abstract: Abstract This study evaluates and differentiates five advanced machine learning models—LSTM, GRU, CNN-LSTM, Random Forest, SVR—aimed at precisely estimating solar wind power generation to enhance renewable energy forecasting. LSTM achieved a remarkable Mean Squared Error (MSE) of 0.010 R2 score 0.90, highlighting its proficiency in capturing intricate temporal relationships. GRU closely followed, demonstrating potential as viable option due combination computational efficiency accuracy (MSE = 0.015, 0.88). In datasets abundant spatial correlations, the CNN-LSTM hybrid demonstrated utility by providing novel insights into spatial–temporal patterns; nonetheless, it lagged considerably accuracy, with mean squared error 0.020 0.87. Conversely, traditional models reliable albeit less dynamic ability elucidate complexities data; for instance, Forest exhibited 0.025, while Support Vector Regression (SVR) recorded an MSE 0.030. The results affirm that deep architectures, particularly LSTM, offer transformative method forecasting, hence enhancing reliability management systems.

title: How Does the Psychiatrist Know?
abstract: How do clinical psychiatrists arrive at their diagnostic conclusions? Little attention has been directed to this question by philosophers of psychiatry. Adrian Kind presents a systematic, in-depth philosophical investigation into and argues that psychiatric reasoning can be understood as model-based procedure analogous scientific reasoning. To support this, he draws on ideas from the philosophy science, psychiatry, cognitive artificial intelligence. This study is an invaluable resource for practicing psychiatrists, interested in researchers intelligence or science medical cognition.

Adrian Kind presents a systematic, in-depth philosophical investigation into and argues that psychiatric reasoning can be understood as model-based procedure analogous scientific reasoning. To support this, he draws on ideas from the philosophy science, psychiatry, cognitive artificial intelligence. This study is an invaluable resource for practicing psychiatrists, interested in researchers intelligence or science medical cognition. How Does the Psychiatrist Know?

title: Decoding TDP-43: the molecular chameleon of neurodegenerative diseases
abstract: TAR DNA-binding protein 43 (TDP-43) has emerged as a critical player in neurodegenerative disorders, with its dysfunction implicated wide spectrum of diseases including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD), and Alzheimer's disease (AD). This comprehensive review explores the multifaceted roles TDP-43 both physiological pathological contexts. We delve into TDP-43's crucial functions RNA metabolism, splicing regulation, mRNA stability, miRNA biogenesis. Particular emphasis is placed on recent discoveries regarding involvement DNA interactions chromatin dynamics, highlighting broader impact gene expression genome stability. The also examines complex pathogenesis TDP-43-related discussing protein's propensity for aggregation, effects mitochondrial function, non-cell autonomous impacts glial cells. provide an in-depth analysis pathology across various conditions, from well-established associations ALS FTLD to emerging such Huntington's Niemann-Pick C disease. potential therapeutic target explored, focus developments targeting cryptic exon inclusion other TDP-43-mediated processes. synthesizes current knowledge biology pathology, offering insights central role neurodegeneration promising avenues future research interventions.

title: Artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques for power quality event classification: a focused review and future insights
abstract: Power Quality (PQ) disturbances are critical in modern power systems, significantly impacting electrical networks' stability, reliability, and efficiency. With the increasing penetration of renewable energy sources, non-linear loads, electronic devices, detection, classification, mitigation PQ have become more complex. Traditional analysis methods, which rely heavily on human expertise rule-based often insufficient handling growing complexity volume data real-time applications. This review comprehensively analyzes latest advancements Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) techniques applied to analysis, achieving classification accuracies as high 99.94 % with hybrid approaches like dual-tree wavelet packet transforms combined extreme learning machine (ELM). Integrating advanced signal processing techniques, such empirical mode decomposition, has demonstrated accuracy improvements up 5 challenging scenarios. paper explores challenges associated AI-based including need for large datasets, overfitting issues, lack interpretability complex models. Future research directions outlined, emphasizing development models, explainable AI adaptability dynamic grid conditions. provides a holistic understanding state-of-the-art AI/ML methods analysis. It highlights their potential transform systems by ensuring higher better fault efficient delivery.

title: Is the Future of Materials Amorphous? Challenges and Opportunities in Simulations of Amorphous Materials
abstract: Amorphous solids form an enormous and underutilized class of materials. In order to drive the discovery new useful amorphous materials further we need achieve a closer convergence between computational experimental methods. this review, highlight some important gaps simulations experiments, discuss popular state-of-the-art techniques such as Activation Relaxation Technique nouveau (ARTn) Reverse Monte Carlo (RMC), introduce more recent advances: machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) generative for matter (e.g., MAP). Examples are drawn from silicon silica literature well molecular glasses. Our outlook stresses methods extend time- length-scales accessible through numerical simulations.

title: Visible light-driven copper vanadate/biochar nanocomposite for heterogeneous photocatalysis degradation of tetracycline: Performance, mechanism, and application of machine learning
An Automated Compliance Framework for Critical Infrastructure Security Through Artificial Intelligence
abstract: Current data on cybercrime shows a rising influence of online threats, leading to significant financial impacts across vital industries like finance, healthcare, and energy. These encompass the theft confidential information, service interruptions, expenses tied breach remediation, underscoring urgent necessity for strengthened cybersecurity strategies. Machine learning (ML) is highly effective in signifying standards, leveraging large-scale analysis, pattern recognition, adaptability emerging threats. Unlike other traditional methods such as rule-based that relay predefined criteria. This study presents an automated ML framework recommend audits, compliance measures, enhancing monitoring infrastructure systematically. Nine including seven international (e.g., ISO/IEC 27001:2022, NIST, CIS) two national standards (UAE, KSA), were analyzed using from official sources. Data preprocessing addressed duplicates missing values, with validation via Pearson Correlation Chi-square tests (Chi-square = 55.79, p 0.0017). Attributes extracted Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) technique refined through Recursive Feature Elimination (RFE). A content-based filtering (CBF) recommender system, aligned organizational maturity levels, was developed enhanced feedback loop user insights. The recommendation model validated three growth scenarios: ad-hoc, managed, adaptive. UAE standard recommended 158 controls Scenario-1, while KSA led Scenario-2. We evaluate performance 3-ML classifiers Random Forest (RF), K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN), Support Vector (SVM). Model assessed F1 score ROC AUC score. Testing adaptive scenarios showed RF classifier achieved 81% accuracy 0.98. supports alignment global enhances governance, enables ongoing tracking, aiding resilience improving GCI rankings.

title: The Escalating AI’s Energy Demands and the Imperative Need for Sustainable Solutions
abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs), such as GPT-4, represent a significant advancement in contemporary Artificial Intelligence (AI), demonstrating remarkable natural language processing, customer service automation, and knowledge representation capabilities. However, these advancements come with substantial energy costs. The training deployment of LLMs require extensive computational resources, leading to escalating consumption environmental impacts. This paper explores the driving factors behind high demands through lens Technology Environment Organization (TEO) framework, assesses their ecological implications, proposes sustainable strategies for mitigating challenges. Specifically, we explore algorithmic improvements, hardware innovations, renewable adoption, decentralized approaches AI deployment. Our findings contribute literature on provide actionable insights industry stakeholders policymakers.

title: GenSQLi: A Generative Artificial Intelligence Framework for Automatically Securing Web Application Firewalls Against Structured Query Language Injection Attacks
abstract: The widespread adoption of web services has heightened exposure to cybersecurity threats, particularly SQL injection (SQLi) attacks that target the database layers applications. Traditional Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) often fail keep pace with evolving attack techniques, necessitating adaptive defense mechanisms. This paper introduces a novel generative AI framework designed enhance SQLi mitigation by leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs). achieves two primary objectives: (1) generating diverse and validated payloads using in-context learning, thereby minimizing hallucinations, (2) automating mechanisms testing these against vulnerable application secured WAF, classifying bypassing attacks, constructing effective WAF security rules through techniques. Experimental results GPT-4o LLM demonstrate framework’s efficacy: 514 new were generated, 92.5% which MySQL 89% successfully bypassed ModSecurity equipped latest OWASP Core Rule Set. By applying our automated rule-generation methodology, 99% previously successful effectively blocked only 23 rules. In contrast, Google Gemini-Pro achieved lower bypass rate 56.6%, underscoring performance variability across LLMs. Future work could extend proposed autonomously defend other including Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), session hijacking, specific Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks.

title: Dual-Modal Memory Enabled by a Single Vertical N-Type Organic Artificial Synapse for Neuromorphic Computing
abstract: Complementary neural network circuits combining multifunctional high-performance p-type with n-type organic artificial synapses satisfy sophisticated applications such as image cognition and prosthesis control. However, implementing the dual-modal memory features that are both volatile nonvolatile in a synaptic transistor is challenging. Herein, for first time, we propose single vertical (VNOST) novel polymeric mixed ionic-electronic conductor core channel material to achieve learning/memory behaviors at different operating current densities via formation of an electric double layer reversible ion doping. As device, resulting VNOST demonstrated unprecedented density MA cm<sup>-2</sup>. Meanwhile, it capable 150 analog states, symmetric conductance modulation, good state retention (100 s) synapse. Importantly, networks (ANNs) recognition accuracy handwritten digital data sets rate up 94% based on its feature. This study provides promising platform building neuromorphic complex application scenarios where high-performing synapse transistors dual-mode characters necessitated.

title: Artificial Intelligence Transforming Post-Translational Modification Research
abstract: Post-Translational Modifications (PTMs) are covalent changes to amino acids that occur after protein synthesis, including modifications on side chains and peptide backbones. Many PTMs profoundly impact cellular molecular functions structures, their significance extends evolutionary studies as well. In light of these implications, we have explored how artificial intelligence (AI) can be utilized in researching PTMs. Initially, rationales for adopting AI its advantages understanding the discussed. Then, various deep learning architectures programs, recent applications language models, predicting PTM sites proteins regulatory compared. Finally, our high-throughput PTM-data-generation pipeline, which formats data suitably training predictions is described. We hope this review illuminates areas where future models improved, thereby contributing field bioengineering.

title: A High‐Accuracy Facial Expression Recognition System Combining Triboelectric Hydrogel Sensors With Deep Learning
abstract: Abstract Facial expression recognition (FER) is significant for daily mental health monitoring because facial expressions reflect an individual's condition. However, it still hard to achieve accurate and convenient FER using wearable devices. Here, a high‐accuracy, self‐powered, intelligent system reported consisting of triboelectric hydrogel sensor network collect signals deep learning model process recognize the signals. The sensors are demonstrated show excellent properties, such as 50% stretchability, 90% transparency, response time 48 ms. With 1D convolutional neural network, six basic can be recognized with average accuracy 99.44%. Finally, 3D virtual character built on computer display real emotions synchronously. Compared previous similar reports, this more types significantly improved accuracy. Therefore, work potentially not only help doctors determine patient's condition through communication while protecting privacy but also provide highly promising approach telemedicine in future.

title: Recent Web Platforms for Multi-Omics Integration Unlocking Biological Complexity
abstract: The rapid advancement of high-throughput technologies has led to the generation vast amounts omics data, including genomics, epigenomics, and metabolomics. Integrating these diverse datasets become essential for gaining comprehensive insights into complex biological systems enhancing personalized healthcare solutions. This critical review examines current state multi-omics data integration platforms, highlighting both strengths limitations existing tools. By evaluating latest digital such as GraphOmics, OmicsAnalyst, others, paper explores how they support seamless analysis in applications. Special attention is given their role clinical decision-making, disease prediction, medicine, with a focus on interoperability, scalability, usability. also discusses challenges platforms face, complexity, standardization issues, need improved machine learning AI-based analytics. Finally, proposes directions future research development, emphasizing importance more advanced, user-friendly, secure that can better serve needs.

abstract: Abstract Generating computer‐generated holograms (CGHs) for 3D scenes by learning‐based methods can reconstruct arbitrary with higher quality and faster speed. Recent Advances in Antimicrobial Resistance: Insights from Escherichia coli as a Model Organism
abstract: Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) represents a critical global health threat, and thorough understanding of mechanisms in Escherichia coli is needed to guide effective treatment interventions. This review explores recent advances for investigating AMR E. coli, including machine learning pattern analysis, laboratory evolution generate resistant mutants, mutant library construction, genome sequencing in-depth characterization. Key are discussed, drug inactivation, target modification, altered transport, metabolic adaptation. Additionally, we highlight strategies mitigate the spread AMR, such as dynamic monitoring, innovative therapies like phage therapy CRISPR-Cas technology, tighter regulation antibiotic use animal production systems. provides actionable insights into identifies promising directions future development management.

title: Ischemic Heart Disease Prognosis: A Hybrid Residual Attention-Enhanced LSTM Model
abstract: Well-timed prediction and an accurate diagnosis of Ischemic Heart disease (IHD) can reduce the risk death, whereas inaccurate prove fatal. So, there is a need to develop optimal heart model avoid ischemic further treatment. Recently, researchers have developed several deep learning techniques that take input from medical practitioners, automatically find hidden patterns in enormous volumes data, predict diseases without human intervention. Further, help doctors classify severity choose appropriate treatment accordingly. These models be improved achieve greater accuracy stability. Creating hybrid combines attention residual with Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) one method it. Our suggested Hybrid Residual Attention-Enhanced LSTM (HRAE-LSTM) approach improves stability by combining LSTM. For evaluating effectiveness proposed HRAE-LSTM model, realistic datasets 303 instances dataset (UCI), were used. The outperforms existing cardiac systems 97.7 % UCI dataset, respectively.

title: Gut microbiota in treating inflammatory digestive diseases: Current challenges and therapeutic opportunities
abstract: Accumulating evidence indicates that the gut microbiota is intricately involved in initiation and progression of human diseases, forming a multidirectional regulatory axis centered on intestinal microbiota. This article illustrates challenges exploring role inflammatory digestive such as metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) bowel (IBD), summarizes existing microbiome-focused treatment strategies (probiotics, prebiotics, symbiotics, fecal transplantation, bacteriophages therapy), emerging technologies (gut microbiome-on-a-chip artificial intelligence), well possible future research directions. Taken together, these therapeutic present both opportunities challenges, which require researchers clinicians to test rationality feasibility various modalities continuous practice.

title: Vehicular Network Security Through Optimized Deep Learning Model with Feature Selection Techniques
abstract: In recent years, vehicular ad hoc networks (VANETs) have faced growing security concerns, particularly from Denial of Service (DoS) and Distributed (DDoS) attacks. These attacks flood the network with malicious traffic, disrupting services compromising resource availability. While various techniques been proposed to address these threats, this study presents an optimized framework leveraging advanced deep-learning models for improved detection accuracy. The Intrusion Detection System (IDS) employs Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), Deep Belief (DBN) alongside robust feature selection techniques, Random Projection (RP) Principal Component Analysis (PCA). This extracts analyzes significant features using a publicly available application-layer DoS attack dataset, achieving higher accuracy than traditional methods. Experimental results indicate that combining CNN, LSTM networks, DBN like PCA in classification performance, 0.994, surpassing state-of-the-art machine learning models. novel approach enhances reliability safety vehicle communications by providing efficient, real-time threat detection. findings contribute significantly VANET security, laying foundation future advancements connected protection.

title: AirQFormer: Improving regional air quality forecast with a hybrid deep learning model
Non‐Invasive Diagnosis of Moyamoya Disease Using Serum Metabolic Fingerprints and Machine Learning
abstract: Abstract Moyamoya disease (MMD) is a progressive cerebrovascular disorder that increases the risk of intracranial ischemia and hemorrhage. Timely diagnosis intervention can significantly reduce new‐onset stroke in patients with MMD. However, current diagnostic methods are invasive expensive, non‐invasive using biomarkers MMD rarely reported. To address this issue, nanoparticle‐enhanced laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry (LDI MS) was employed to record serum metabolic fingerprints (SMFs) aim establishing method for Subsequently, model developed based on deep learning algorithms, which exhibited high accuracy differentiating group from HC (AUC = 0.958, 95% CI 0.911 1.000). Additionally, hierarchical clustering analysis revealed significant association between SMFs across different groups vascular cognitive impairment This approach holds promise as novel intuitive Furthermore, study may have broader implications other neurological disorders.

title: Enhancing primary healthcare delivery in Nigeria through the adoption of advanced technologies
abstract: Enhancing primary healthcare delivery in Nigeria by adopting advanced technologies holds substantial promise for improving accessibility, quality, and efficiency. Primary focuses on community-based, essential care that is practical, socially acceptable, affordable. Despite efforts to improve delivery, challenges persist, particularly rural underserved areas. The aim of this study was explore the transformative potential such as telemedicine, Electronic Health Records (EHRs), Information Systems (HIS), Artificial Intelligence (AI), medical drones addressing these challenges. Telemedicine facilitates access remote areas overcoming geographical barriers. EHRs streamline administrative clinical processes, enhancing patient safety. HIS improves data management, safety, provider communication. AI revolutionizes diagnostics, treatment personalization, operational Medical offer innovative solutions delivering supplies locations. paper also addresses associated with technologies, including infrastructure limitations, regulatory issues, privacy concerns. Recommendations include investing infrastructure, developing frameworks, building capacity, fostering public-private partnerships, engaging communities, implementing robust security measures. By recommendations, can leverage enhance achieve better health outcomes.

title: Detecting Subtle Cyberattacks on Adaptive Cruise Control Vehicles: A Machine Learning Approach
abstract: With the emergence of vehicles featuring advanced driver-assistance systems like adaptive cruise control (ACC) and additional automated driving functionalities, there has arisen a heightened potential for cyberattacks targeting these (AVs). While overt attacks that lead to collisions are more conspicuous, subtle slightly modify behaviors can cause widespread impacts, including increased congestion, fuel consumption, crash risks without being easily detected. To address detection such attacks, we first present traffic modeling framework three types cyberattacks: malicious manipulation vehicle commands, data poison denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. Subsequently, examine consequences on both singular dynamics (micro) broader flow patterns (macro). We introduce new anomaly model based generative adversarial networks (GAN) designed real-time pinpointing using trajectory data. Numerical results presented show effectiveness our machine learning strategy in identifying equipped with ACC. The proposed approach is observed outperform contemporary neural network models detecting irregular ACC vehicles.

The proposed approach is observed outperform contemporary neural network models detecting irregular ACC vehicles. title: An Efficient and General Automated Power Amplifier Design Method Based on Surrogate Model Assisted Hybrid Optimization Technique
abstract: In layout-level optimization-oriented power amplifier (PA) design, the need for a good quality initial design and high computational cost of electromagnetic (EM) simulations are remaining challenges. To address these challenges, new method called efficient general Bayesian neural network (BNN)-assisted hybrid optimization algorithm PA (E-GASPAD), is proposed. The key innovations E-GASPAD include introduction BNN to model landscape co-working with prediction optimization. performance demonstrated by 27–31 GHz class-AB 24–31 wideband Doherty PA. Considering around 30 variables wide search ranges, complete set specifications, full-wave EM simulations, high-performance designs obtained automatically within few hundred (i.e., less than 72 h).

title: Integrating Radar-Based Obstacle Detection with Deep Reinforcement Learning for Robust Autonomous Navigation
abstract: This study presents an approach to autonomous navigation for wheeled robots, combining radar-based dynamic obstacle detection with a BiGRU-based deep reinforcement learning (DRL) framework. Using filtering and tracking algorithms, the proposed system leverages radar sensors cluster object points track obstacles, enhancing precision by reducing noise fluctuations. A BiGRU-enabled DRL model is introduced, allowing robot process sequential environmental data make informed decisions in unpredictable environments, achieving collision-free paths reaching goal. Simulation experimental results validate method’s efficiency adaptability, highlighting its potential real-world applications scenarios.

A BiGRU-enabled DRL model is introduced, allowing robot process sequential environmental data make informed decisions in unpredictable environments, achieving collision-free paths reaching goal. Simulation experimental results validate method’s efficiency adaptability, highlighting its potential real-world applications scenarios. title: Knowledge, Attitudes, Perceptions, and Practices Related to Artificial Intelligence in Radiology Among Indian Radiologists and Residents: A Multicenter Nationwide Study
abstract: Background Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing medical science, with significant implications for radiology. abstract: This study examines the impact of targeted interventions on development 4C skills—critical thinking, communication, collaboration, and creativity—among students in control experimental groups. title: Next Generation of Colorectal Cancer Management: Integrating Omics, Targeted Therapies, and Smart Technologies
abstract: Colorectal cancer (CRC) remains a significant global health concern, with increasing incidence rates observed in young adults and Asian populations. Recent advancements diagnostic tools, targeted therapies, precision medicine approaches have revolutionized CRC management. This review aimed to summarize the latest developments diagnosis, treatment, prevention, focusing on innovative technologies personalized approaches. Advanced imaging techniques, including high-definition colonoscopy, virtual integrated PET-CT scans, enhanced detection staging accuracy. Novel biomarkers such as circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA), microRNAs (miRNAs), exosomes show promise for early diagnosis treatment monitoring. Precision employs molecular profiling guide epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) inhibitors, V-raf murine sarcoma viral oncogene homolog B1 (BRAF) immune checkpoint inhibitors. Anti-cancer metal ions platinum, ruthenium, gallium compounds demonstrate efficacy through diverse mechanisms. The application of artificial intelligence (AI) analysis, pathology, planning enhances accuracy care. Herbal traditional medicines, curcumin green tea catechins, exhibit anti-tumor properties potential synergistic effects conventional therapies. Prevention strategies include lifestyle modifications, screening programs, risk-based Emerging organoid engineering nanomedicine, offer new avenues drug discovery delivery. Integrating advanced has substantially improved However, challenges remain addressing heterogeneity, resistance, accessibility. Future research should focus validating emerging large-scale clinical trials further enhance outcomes.

title: Machine learning-based prediction of the mechanical properties of β titanium shape memory alloys
abstract: This study developed machine learning (ML) models to predict the mechanical properties of Ni-free β-type titanium shape memory alloys (SMAs). Using a dataset 107 entries derived from both literature and laboratory experiments, we focused on predicting ultimate tensile strength (UTS) elongation (EL). Key features, including Mo equivalent, bond order, d-orbital energy level, were selected for through Pearson correlation maps subset selection methods. Four ML algorithms—Linear Regression (LIN), Support Vector (SVR), Random Forest (RFR), Gradient Boosting (GBR)—were employed evaluated using metrics like mean absolute error (MAE), squared (MSE), coefficient determination (R2). The GBR model EL showed highest prediction accuracy (R2 = 0.998 training R2 0.817 testing), whereas UTS predictions less accurate < 0.6 testing). Although also adapted yield stress (YS), their was reduced, with improvements seen when incorporating phase constitution information reflecting stability. primary reasons discrepancy in this include small size absence microstructural features. research demonstrates potential SMAs, highlighting importance integrating domain-specific knowledge feature engineering overcome challenge data sets, enhance robustness.
