title: Advancing Healthcare AI Governance: A Comprehensive Maturity Model Based on Systematic Review
abstract: Abstract Artificial Intelligence (AI) deployment in healthcare is accelerating, yet comprehensive governance frameworks remain fragmented and often assume extensive resources. Through a systematic review of 22 published between 2019-2024, we identified seven critical domains AI governance: organizational structure, problem formulation, external product evaluation, algorithm development, model integration, monitoring maintenance. While existing provide valuable guidance, they frequently target only large academic medical centers, creating barriers for smaller organizations. To address this gap, propose the Healthcare Readiness Assessment (HAIRA), five-level maturity that provides actionable pathways based on resources capabilities. HAIRA spans from Level 1 (Initial / Ad Hoc) suitable small practices to 5 (Leading) major with specific benchmarks across all domains. This tiered approach enables organizations assess their current capabilities establish appropriate advancement targets. Our framework addresses need adaptive strategies can support AI-enabled value diverse settings ensures implementation delivers tangible benefits systems varying sizes resource levels.
detailed_text: Abstract Artificial Intelligence (AI) deployment in healthcare is accelerating, yet comprehensive governance frameworks remain fragmented and often assume extensive resources. Through a systematic review of 22 published between 2019-2024, we identified seven critical domains AI governance: organizational structure, problem formulation, external product evaluation, algorithm development, model integration, monitoring maintenance. While existing provide valuable guidance, they frequently target only large academic medical centers, creating barriers for smaller organizations. To address this gap, propose the Healthcare Readiness Assessment (HAIRA), five-level maturity that provides actionable pathways based on resources capabilities. HAIRA spans from Level 1 (Initial / Ad Hoc) suitable small practices to 5 (Leading) major with specific benchmarks across all domains. This tiered approach enables organizations assess their current capabilities establish appropriate advancement targets. Our framework addresses need adaptive strategies can support AI-enabled value diverse settings ensures implementation delivers tangible benefits systems varying sizes resource levels. Advancing Healthcare AI Governance: A Comprehensive Maturity Model Based on Systematic Review

abstract: ABSTRACT Purpose A debilitating and poorly understood symptom of Parkinson's disease (PD) is freezing gait (FoG), which increases the risk falling. title: World‐making for a future with sentient AI
abstract: Abstract The ways people imagine possible futures with artificial intelligence (AI) affects future world‐making—how the is produced through cultural propagation, design, engineering, policy, and social interaction—yet there has been little empirical study of everyday people's expectations for AI futures. We addressed this by analysing two waves (2021 2023) USA nationally representative data from Artificial Intelligence, Morality, Sentience (AIMS) survey on public's forecasts about an imagined world widespread sentience (total N = 2401). title: Soft Robotic Devices for Mechanotherapy of the Upper and Lower Extremities
abstract: Abstract Soft robotics are rapidly emerging as a promising method for mechanotherapeutic applications. Through mechanical stimulation, they aid in the recovery and regeneration of soft tissues improve lymphatic fluid blood flow. With their ability to safely interact with humans, robotic devices applied across various fields, including medicine, physical therapy, space physiology. The wearable nature these allows mobility comfort during treatment, enabling continuous personalized therapeutic interventions. This review provides an overview recent advancements mechanotherapy, focusing on applications upper lower extremities. A comprehensive investigation is conducted actuation, sensing, control, power technologies identify current trends. Finally, future developments potential innovations mechanotherapy discussed.

title: Climate and performance-driven architectural floorplan optimization using deep graph networks
abstract: Purpose This study introduces a novel approach to generating and optimizing energy-efficient climate-responsive architectural floorplans. Design/methodology/approach The DGraph-cGAN model utilizes advanced deep-learning techniques produce diverse, realistic layouts that meet specific design constraints functional requirements. Findings results show significant energy savings (32.1% overall) across different building types climate conditions, with reductions in use intensity, CO2 emissions annual costs. Case studies demonstrate notable improvements savings, emission reduction, daylight autonomy, thermal comfort cost savings. Practical implications has great potential for advancing optimization, opportunities further refinement application various contexts. Originality/value contributes developing floorplans using deep learning techniques. It provides valuable tool architects designers create energy-efficient, buildings.

title: InTec: integrated things-edge computing: a framework for distributing machine learning pipelines in edge AI systems
Large language models for causal hypothesis generation in science
abstract: Abstract Towards the goal of understanding causal structure underlying complex systems—such as Earth, climate, or brain—integrating Large language models (LLMs) with data-driven and domain-expertise-driven approaches has potential to become a game-changer, especially in data expertise-limited scenarios. Debates persist around LLMs’ reasoning capacities. However, rather than engaging philosophical debates, we propose integrating LLMs into scientific framework for hypothesis generation alongside expert knowledge data. Our goals include formalizing probabilistic imperfect experts, developing adaptive methods generation, establishing universal benchmarks comprehensive comparisons. Specifically, introduce spectrum integration LLMs, approaches. We review existing classify them within this spectrum. As an example, our hybrid (LLM + data) discovery algorithm illustrates ways deeper integration. Characterizing experts along dimensions such (1) reliability, (2) consistency, (3) uncertainty, (4) content vs. are emphasized adaptable methods. Lastly, stress importance model-agnostic benchmarks.

title: Random survival forest predicts survival in patients with metastatic laryngeal and hypopharyngeal cancer and the prognostic benefits of surgery and radiotherapy
abstract: Background: Laryngeal and hypopharyngeal cancers are prominent within head neck malignancies. The diagnosis of distant metastasis (DM) invariably signals poor prognosis, underscoring the need to optimize current treatment approaches. Methods: Patient data for metastatic laryngeal cancer were extracted from SEER database (2000-2020). Cox regression propensity score matching (PSM) analyses identified independent prognostic factors performed stratified survival based on receipt primary tumor surgery radiotherapy. A random forest (RSF) model was subsequently developed predict patient survival. Results: total 1,626 patients included. PSM-based analysis revealed that significantly improved in under 70 years those with cancer. Radiotherapy enhanced across all age groups, a benefit primarily squamous-cell carcinoma (SCC). RSF demonstrated robust predictive performance, highlighting chemotherapy, surgery, radiotherapy as top three influencing Conclusion: clinical pathological features laryngeal/hypopharyngeal systematically analyzed using an artificial intelligence (AI) Subgroup most likely These findings may guide development personalized strategies, potentially improving prognosis DM.

title: FNI-DETR: real-time DETR with far and near feature interaction for small object detection
abstract: Abstract In recent years, real-time object detectors have gained significant traction in domains such as autonomous driving, industrial inspection, and remote sensing. The Detection Transformer has emerged a research focal point due to its end-to-end architecture that eliminates the need for post-processing. However, Transformer’s tendency focus on global information, small objects are often overlooked. To address this limitation, we propose FNI-DETR, tailored detection by incorporating Far Near Feature Interaction. Specifically, FNI-DETR integrates state space models with form Mamba-Encoder block, enabling interaction of feature information across different spatial scales. This enhances representation learning near-end while improving extraction semantic information. Additionally, introduce Lightweight Spatial Attention block backbone stage capture detailed regions interest. Furthermore, ADOWN is employed downsampling, reducing likelihood discarding from map increasing model’s objects. Experimental results show achieves an average precision(mAP 50:95 ) 49.5% COCO val2017 dataset, which 4.2% higher than Real-Time (RT-DETR) 1.7% YOLOv10-L network. targets also reach 31.7% APs. Moreover, our network speed 116 FPS dataset. On VisDrone 2019 test FNI-DETR’s mAP 50 achieved 37.4% 21.7%, reaching SOTA level. Our code made available at https://github.com/hzx-123-wq/FNI-DETR/tree/master/FNI-DETR .

The Detection Transformer has emerged a research focal point due to its end-to-end architecture that eliminates the need for post-processing. To address this limitation, we propose FNI-DETR, tailored detection by incorporating Far Near Feature Interaction. Specifically, FNI-DETR integrates state space models with form Mamba-Encoder block, enabling interaction of feature information across different spatial scales. This enhances representation learning near-end while improving extraction semantic information. Additionally, introduce Lightweight Spatial Attention block backbone stage capture detailed regions interest. Furthermore, ADOWN is employed downsampling, reducing likelihood discarding from map increasing model’s objects. Experimental results show achieves an average precision(mAP 50:95 ) 49.5% COCO val2017 dataset, which 4.2% higher than Real-Time (RT-DETR) 1.7% YOLOv10-L network. targets also reach 31.7% APs. Moreover, our network speed 116 FPS dataset. On VisDrone 2019 test FNI-DETR’s mAP 50 achieved 37.4% 21.7%, reaching SOTA level. Our code made available at https://github.com/hzx-123-wq/FNI-DETR/tree/master/FNI-DETR . FNI-DETR: real-time DETR with far and near feature interaction for small object detection

title: Enhancing Healthcare Pricing Transparency: A Machine Learning and AI-Driven Approach to Pricing Strategies and Analytics
abstract: This paper introduces an advanced framework for healthcare pricing transparency by leveraging cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and robust cloud computing infrastructure. The proposed model integrates diverse datasets, including historical claims, provider costs, patient demographics, to enable precise cost prediction, reduce billing disparities 70%, improve administrative efficiency 47%. A combination of XGBoost ARIMA models achieved 92% prediction accuracy, supported federated privacy-preserving analytics real-time predictive modeling. empowers stakeholders with actionable insights, fosters trust across the ecosystem, establishes a scalable, regulation-compliant solution addressing challenges opacity in U.S. system.

A combination of XGBoost ARIMA models achieved 92% prediction accuracy, supported federated privacy-preserving analytics real-time predictive modeling. empowers stakeholders with actionable insights, fosters trust across the ecosystem, establishes a scalable, regulation-compliant solution addressing challenges opacity in U.S. system. title: The promising and problematic potential of generative AI as a leveler of the publishing playing field
abstract: Abstract This perspective paper considers the affordances and challenges of generative AI for linguaculturally diverse scholars in a still English-dominant academic publishing world. Chief among questions examined is whether offers viable path forward toward greater research publication equity but, at same time, something much more fraught. title: Optimized Sentiment Classification of Google Play Store App Ratings Using Advanced Machine Learning Models
abstract: The Google Play Store, the primary distribution platform for Android applications, hosts millions of apps and receives a large number user reviews. However, extracting actionable insights from these reviews, particularly classifying rating sentiment (positive, negative, or neutral), remains challenge. This paper addresses this issue by proposing novel framework app classification on Store data. We leverage rich dataset reviews acquired GitHub employ battery advanced machine learning models. Specifically, we explore efficacy AdaBoost, XGBoost, Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) in conjunction with optimization techniques. Our approach significantly outperforms existing research, achieving superior accuracy ranging 85% to 98% compared 78-95.9% reported prior studies. significant improvement translates deeper understanding across ecosystem. It enables developers better gauge satisfaction, prioritize improvements, ultimately enhance experience. work also paves way further research analysis exploring fine-grained detection analyzing dynamics over time.

title: Enhancing the Diagnosis of Cardiovascular Disease: A Comparative Examination of Support Vector Machine and Artificial Neural Network Models Utilizing Extensive Data Preprocessing Techniques
abstract: This research delves into the classification of cardiovascular disease (CVD) utilizing state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms, namely Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Artificial Neural Network (ANN). Before model training, extensive data preprocessing techniques were implemented, including cleaning, feature scaling, encoding, Feature selection, handling imbalanced data, normalization, cross-validation. After preparation, an evaluation performance was carried out against various parameters like accuracy, precision, specificity, positive likelihood ratio (LR+), negative (LR-), diagnostic odd (DOR). The comparison SVM ANN indicates that has a better sensitivity in detecting cases while ANNs have more accuracy classification. paper not only documents use new methods but also highlights advantages disadvantages models, therefore helps to improve applications making health care decisions on CVD diagnosis.

title: Advances in Public-Private Partnerships for Strengthening National Financial Governance and Crisis Response Systems
abstract: Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs) have emerged as critical tools in enhancing national financial governance and improving resilience against economic shocks. The increasing frequency of crises, exacerbated by global pandemics, geopolitical instability, climate-related disruptions, underscores the urgency for innovative, collaborative frameworks that align public policy objectives with private sector capabilities. This paper examines recent advances PPPs proposes strategic mechanisms to strengthen coordination between governments institutions recovery crisis response systems. Through a comprehensive review case studies models from various economies, this study identifies key enablers successful PPPs, including transparent regulatory environments, risk-sharing frameworks, data-driven decision-making, institutional trust. It further explores how digital technologies, such blockchain artificial intelligence, are revolutionizing oversight, transparency, enabling real-time monitoring fiscal monetary policies. emphasizes importance adaptive structures allow flexibility while maintaining accountability. proposed include establishment Integrated Financial Response Units (IFRUs) composed government agencies, central banks, institutions, fintech actors. These units would facilitate rapid information exchange, coordinated liquidity injections, agile deployment stimulus packages. also advocates creation National Resilience Indices (NFRIs) measure preparedness guide adjustments real time. Additionally, it highlights need capacity-building programs incentive alignment ensure sustainable PPP engagement, particularly developing economies where gaps often hinder collaboration. By framing not merely infrastructure finance but dynamic vehicles systemic governance, reimagines public-private interface core component resilience. concludes offering roadmap institutionalizing these mechanisms, aligning them development goals international best practices.

title: Artificial Intelligence Governance and Regulation: A Roadmap to Developing Legal Policies for Artificial Intelligence Deployment
abstract: Abstract The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) presents substantial challenges for global regulation and governance. This study explores various approaches adopted by countries industries in formulating legal policies that promote the responsible innovative use AI. It examines regulatory frameworks European Union, United States, China, alongside deployment AI automotive healthcare sectors. Empirical evidence suggests stringent regulations, such as those enhance clarity foster public trust but impose higher compliance costs hinder innovation. Conversely, States' more lenient approach promotes innovation leads to ambiguity. Key challenges, including standards harmonization, algorithm transparency, accountability, remain critical issues stakeholders. concludes emphasizing need an equilibrium between regulation, achieved through international collaboration establish robust, secure, sustainable governance frameworks. Keywords: Artificial Intelligence, policy, governance, Abstrak Pesatnya perkembangan kecerdasan buatan membawa tantangan yang signifikan dalam hal regulasi dan tata kelola global. Artikel ini bertujuan untuk memeriksa pendekatan berbagai negara industri mengembangkan kebijakan hukum mendukung penerapan bertanggung jawab inovatif. Studi menyoroti peraturan di Uni Eropa, Amerika Serikat, Cina, serta sektor otomotif perawatan kesehatan. Data empiris menunjukkan bahwa meskipun ketat, seperti memberikan kejelasan meningkatkan kepercayaan publik, itu juga menambah beban biaya memperlambat inovasi. Di sisi lain, lebih longgar Serikat mendorong inovasi tetapi menciptakan ketidakpastian hukum. Tantangan harmonisasi standar, transparansi algoritma, akuntabilitas adalah masalah utama harus ditangani oleh para pemangku kepentingan. menyimpulkan keseimbangan antara diperlukan melalui kolaborasi internasional tangguh, aman, berkelanjutan. Kata kunci: Kecerdasan Buatan, AI, Tata Kelola Regulasi

title: Predictive Infrastructure Scaling in Fintech Systems Using AI-Driven Load Balancing Models
abstract: As the fintech industry continues to experience exponential growth, ability scale infrastructure dynamically and efficiently has become a critical concern. Traditional methods of load balancing resource scaling often fail meet demands real-time applications, resulting in performance bottlenecks, high operational costs, system inefficiencies. This paper explores integration artificial intelligence (AI) predictive address these challenges. Specifically, it investigates AI-driven models, including machine learning algorithms such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks hybrid ensemble methods, that forecast demand trigger automated decisions cloud environments. By predicting traffic surges requirements advance, models not only optimize allocation but also ensure improved reliability cost-efficiency. The presents conceptual framework for integrating AI prediction engines with auto-scaling policies evaluates implementation considerations data collection, model training, continuous monitoring. findings demonstrate enhances scalability, reliability, cost-efficiency systems, enabling seamless, optimization. Additionally, discusses implications design, highlighting need modular, cloud-native architectures robust DevOps workflows. Future research directions include exploration edge AI, federated privacy-preserving scaling, blockchain enhanced security applications.

title: Optimization of joint strength in friction stir welded wood plastic composites using ANFIS and Cheetah Optimizer
abstract: This study focuses on modeling and optimizing the friction stir welding (FSW) process of wood-plastic composites (WPCs) made low-density polyethylene reinforced with wood flour to improve joint performance. The input parameters considered are rotational speed (RS) (WS), while output properties flexural strength modulus, measured after tool entry before exit. Three machine learning algorithms—multilayer perceptron (MLP), decision tree (DT), adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system (ANFIS)—were used model relationships between responses. ANFIS showed best predictive performance, R2 values above 0.98 minimal errors, indicating its reliability in FSW properties. Optimization using Cheetah Optimizer determined optimal 1116 RPM for RS 0.20 mm/s WS, which resulted a maximum 13.96 MPa 13.50 exit, along consistent modulus values. emphasizes importance uniform heat distribution prevent polymer degradation weld quality. Verification experiments optimization model's effectiveness, relative errors 13.42% 5.50% exit strength. research demonstrates that combining metaheuristic can significantly enhance performance WPCs, offering insights improving strength, consistency, thermal stability WPC technology.

title: MHRA-MS-3D-ResNet-BiLSTM: A Multi-Head-Residual Attention-Based Multi-Stream Deep Learning Model for Soybean Yield Prediction in the U.S. Using Multi-Source Remote Sensing Data
abstract: Accurate prediction of soybean yield is important for safeguarding food security and improving agricultural management. Recent advances have highlighted the effectiveness ability Machine Learning (ML) models in analyzing Remote Sensing (RS) data this purpose. However, most these do not fully consider multi-source RS prediction, as processing increases complexity limits their accuracy generalizability. In study, we propose Multi-Residual Attention-Based Multi-Stream 3D-ResNet-BiLSTM (MHRA-MS-3D-ResNet-BiLSTM) model, designed to integrate various types, including Sentinel-1/2 imagery, Daymet climate data, soil grid information, improved county-level U.S. prediction. Our model employs a multi-stream architecture process diverse types concurrently, capturing complex spatio-temporal features effectively. The 3D-ResNet component utilizes 3D convolutions residual connections pattern recognition, complemented by Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (BiLSTM) enhanced long-term dependency learning arrangements forward backward directions. An attention mechanism further refines model’s focus dynamically weighting significance different input efficient We trained MHRA-MS-3D-ResNet-BiLSTM using datasets from 2019 2020 evaluated its performance with 2021 2022. results demonstrated robustness adaptability unseen achieving an R2 0.82 Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) 9% 2021, 0.72 MAPE 12% This surpassed some state-of-the-art like MS-3D-ResNet-BiLSTM, other traditional ML methods Random Forest (RF), XGBoost, LightGBM. These findings highlight methodology’s capability handle multiple role predictions, which can be helpful sustainable agriculture.

abstract: Abstract Infectious diseases significantly impact both public health and economic stability, underscoring the critical need for precise outbreak predictions to effictively mitigate their impact. Notably, in context this achieves optimal balance between precision recall, with 93.31%, 57%, recall 63%, highlighting its reliability effective prediction.

title: Integrating machine learning to customize chemotherapy for oral cancer patients
abstract: Oral cancer, particularly oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC), poses a significant global health burden, with over 350,000 new cases annually. Despite chemotherapy being critical for advanced-stage treatment, its lack of personalization often results in inconsistent responses, severe side effects, and limited efficacy. Current methodologies, such as rule-based systems traditional statistical models, fail to account the complex, nonlinear interactions between patient-specific factors drug underscoring need advanced solutions. This paper introduces machine learning (ML)-driven framework optimize regimens cancer patients. By leveraging multi-modal datasets, including genomic profiles, clinical histories, tumor burden indices, toxicity metrics, proposed model achieves remarkable results. Utilizing an ensemble random forests neural networks, accuracy 92 %, outperforming existing ML methods (85 %) approaches (78 %). Additionally, it demonstrates 25 % reduction chemotherapy-induced 20 decrease treatment costs. Key innovations include novel efficacy-toxicity trade-off metric adaptability through reinforcement real-time regimen refinement. To address data privacy concerns, incorporates federated learning, ensuring scalability across diverse healthcare systems. Preliminary highlight 15–20 improvement efficacy 10 adverse effects compared methods. interdisciplinary approach bridges gap oncology ML, offering robust foundation personalized medicine. tailoring regimens, this aims improve survival rates, minimize treatment-related complications, enhance quality life patients globally.

abstract: Background: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to technology that can efficiently perform tasks typically require human intelligence, such as decision-making, teaching, object detection, and solving complex problems. As a veritable tool in medical education, this study was conducted assess students’ awareness, perception usage of AI learning. Methodology: This at the Department Paediatrics, University Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital (UPTH). title: Factors Affecting Digital Financial Service Adoption in Bangladesh: Evidence from SEM-ANN Approaches
abstract: The rapid growth of Digital Financial Services (DFS) has revolutionized the financial landscape in developing countries, including Bangladesh. Despite its growing importance, understanding factors influencing DFS adoption remains limited, particularly when leveraging advanced analytical frameworks. This study investigates key drivers affecting Bangladesh by employing Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) and Artificial Neural Network (ANN) approaches. Using survey data collected from 340 users, SEM analysis validates proposed relationships, identifying literacy, trust, access to capital, digital payment usage, inclusion as significant driving adoption. ANN modeling further highlights relative importance these predictors, revealing literacy most influential factor, closely followed inclusion, trust services, capital usage. dual-method provides nuanced insights for policymakers, institutions, technology providers, aiming enhance promote

title: ChatGPT, Google, or PINK? Who Provides the Most Reliable Information on Side Effects of Systemic Therapy for Early Breast Cancer?
abstract: Introduction: The survival in early breast cancer (BC) has been significantly improved thanks to numerous new drugs. Nevertheless, the information about need for systemic therapy, especially chemotherapy, represents an additional stress factor patients. A common coping strategy is searching further information, traditionally via search engines or websites, but artificial intelligence (AI) also increasingly being used. title: Evaluation of Machine Learning Models for Stress Symptom Classification of Cucumber Seedlings Grown in a Controlled Environment
abstract: Stress by unfavorable environmental conditions, including temperature, light intensity, and photoperiod, significantly impact early-stage growth in crops, such as cucumber seedlings, often resulting yield reduction quality degradation. Advanced machine learning (ML) models combined with image-based analysis offer promising solutions for precise, non-invasive stress monitoring. This study aims to classify symptom levels seedlings using ML extracting critical color, texture, morphological features from RGB images. In a controlled plant factory setup, two-week-old were subjected varied conditions across five chambers differing temperatures (15, 20, 25, 30 °C), intensities (50, 250, 450 µmol m−2 s−1), day-night cycles (8/16, 10/14, 16/8 h). A cost-effective camera, integrated microcontroller, captured images the top of over two-week period, which sequential forward floating selection (SFFS) correlation matrices used streamline feature extraction. Four classifiers: Support Vector Machine (SVM), K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN), Naïve Bayes (NB), Random Forest (RF), trained detect symptoms based on selected features, highlighting that detectable after day 4. KNN achieved highest accuracy at 0.94 (94%), followed closely SVM RF, both 93%, while NB reached 88%. Findings suggested color texture indicators stress, model, optimized hyperparameters, provided reliable classification monitoring under environments. highlights potential ML-driven detection seedling production, enabling real-time decision-making optimize crop health productivity.

abstract: COVID-19 pneumonia is a persistent worldwide health problem that usually affects the most vulnerable groups in society: newborn and aged populations. Most of current endeavors toward handling diagnosis classification have used numerous techniques for machine learning deep learning, with particular focus on pneumonia. title: Advancing Brain Tumor Detection: A Thorough Investigation of CNNs, Clustering, and SoftMax Classification in the Analysis of MRI Images
abstract: Brain tumors pose a significant global health challenge due to their high prevalence and mortality rates across all age groups. Detecting brain at an early stage is crucial for effective treatment patient outcomes. This study presents comprehensive investigation into the use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) tumor detection using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) images. The dataset, consisting MRI scans from both healthy individuals patients with tumors, was processed fed CNN architecture. SoftMax Fully Connected layer employed classify images, achieving accuracy 98%. To evaluate CNN's performance, two other classifiers, Radial Basis Function (RBF) Decision Tree (DT), were utilized, yielding 98.24% 95.64%, respectively. also introduced clustering method feature extraction, improving accuracy. title: From molecular mechanisms to precision medicine: Transformative approaches in cirrhosis management
abstract: Background: Cirrhosis represents a major global health burden, driven by rising prevalence of risk factors like viral hepatitis, alcohol abuse, and obesity. Purpose: This paper reviews current understanding cirrhosis pathogenesis, limitations traditional therapies, recent revolutionary innovations in disease management. Main Body: Chronic liver injury triggers inflammation activation hepatic stellate cells, key drivers fibrosis. Resulting architectural distortions impair function. While conventional treatments dietary modifications provide temporary relief, they fail to halt progression. Advanced diagnostics elastography biomarkers enable early noninvasive detection monitoring. Novel antifibrotics anti-inflammatories show promise targeting molecular pathways underlying Precision medicine facilitates personalized therapies based on genetic profiles biomarker signatures. Regenerative approaches using stem cells tissue engineering aim restore structure Transplantation advancements expand donor pools improve outcomes. Emerging technologies AI analytics, wearables, telemedicine optimize clinical decision-making accessibility. However, challenges remain regarding biomarkers' inconsistent accuracy, animal models' limitations, translating research into practice. Conclusion: Recent hold immense potential for unraveling the enigma transforming patient care through enhanced diagnostics, molecularly targeted treatments, regenerative strategies, leveraging cutting-edge technologies. But continued multidisciplinary collaboration are vital overcome existing barriers realize precision, therapies.

abstract: Effective implementation and impact assessment of multinational public health programs are critical to achieving global goals, particularly in an era marked by cross-border threats disparities. By identifying transferable strategies evidence-based tools, contributes discourse improving outcomes coordinated, attuned, data-driven programming.

title: Advances in Cross-Industry Application of Predictive Marketing Intelligence for Revenue Uplift
abstract: Predictive Marketing Intelligence (PMI) has emerged as a transformative approach that leverages advanced analytics, machine learning, and big data to anticipate consumer behaviors optimize marketing strategies. Its cross-industry application gained significant traction, providing businesses across sectors with actionable insights enhance customer engagement, streamline operations, drive substantial revenue uplift. This explores the evolution implementation of PMI in various industries, including retail, finance, healthcare, telecommunications, hospitality. Each sector utilized predictive intelligence address unique challenges ranging from personalized product recommendations e-commerce churn prediction telecom demand forecasting travel healthcare. A key contribution lies its ability unify disparate sources such CRM systems, web social media activity create dynamic profiles deliver targeted, timely, contextually relevant interventions. These capabilities not only increase acquisition retention but also spend improve return on investment (ROI). Moreover, analysis reveals transferable methodologies, behavioral segmentation propensity modeling, which can be adapted new contexts effectiveness. highlights innovative case studies where yielded measurable gains operational efficiencies. While benefits are clear, is without challenges. Issues privacy compliance, algorithmic bias, integration legacy systems pose ongoing concerns. Nevertheless, emerging technologies real-time generative AI, edge computing expanding boundaries paving way for broader adoption. review concludes represents critical lever competitive advantage sustained growth. Organizations invest ethical practices well-positioned thrive an increasingly customer-centric marketplace.

title: Optimal design and performance prediction of stepped honeycomb labyrinth seal using CFD and ANN
abstract: A stepped honeycomb labyrinth seal was optimized, and its leakage performance predicted across various operating conditions using computational fluid dynamics (CFD) artificial neural networks (ANNs). The process involved two stages: geometry optimization prediction. In the first stage, incremental Latin hypercube sampling (i-LHS) used to select geometric design points for training ANN with CFD providing data. An ANN-based prediction metamodel developed, a genetic algorithm applied optimize geometry, achieving 12.34% improvement in over reference seal. second stage wide range of conditions, including pressure ratios, rotational speeds, clearances. Similar optimization, i-LHS ANN. reflecting developed by evaluating generalization practicality impact ratio, speed, clearance on predicted. optimized compared seal, showing improvements from 1.44% 16.74%. This study revealed effectiveness predictions optimizing complex geometries, such as seals, developing models that account conditions.

title: A review on the powertrains and energy management strategies of electric tractors
abstract: <p>Given the increasing demand for sustainable agricultural practices and energy conservation, advanced technologies electric machinery (EAM) are critically needed. This paper provides a comprehensive review analysis of powertrain systems management strategies (EMSs) tractors (ETs), key representative EAM. Specifically, this paper: (1) outlines current development status research significance ET powertrains, including single-energy powertrains (SEPs), diesel-electric hybrid (DEHPs), storage (HESSs); (2) offers an in-depth EMS approaches—covering rule-based, optimization-based, learning-based strategies—and evaluates their performance in terms efficiency, adaptability, cost reduction; (3) identifies future hotspots, such as intelligent data-driven EMSs, multi-source integration, optimization algorithms to improve reliability power systems. The findings highlight critical role EMSs enhancing operational range, economic viability ETs, offering insights guidance further technologies.</p>

title: Artificial intelligence for chest X-ray image enhancement
abstract: The chest X-ray (CXR) imaging has been the most frequently performed radiographic examination for decades, and its demand continues to grow due their critical role in diagnosing various diseases. However, image quality of CXR long a factor limiting diagnostic accuracy. As post-processing procedure, enhancement can cost-effectively improve quality. Recently, successful application deep learning (DL) algorithms medical analysis prompted researchers propose design DL-based algorithms. This review examines advancements methods from 2018 2023, categorizing them into four groups: bone suppression, denoising, super-resolution reconstruction, contrast enhancement. For each group, unique approaches, strengths, challenges are analyzed. concludes by discussing shared across these proposing directions future research.

title: Leaf Water Potential in a Mixed Mediterranean Forest from Machine Learning and Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)-Based Hyperspectral Imaging
abstract: Leaf water potential (ψleaf) is a key indicator of plant status, but its measurement labor-intensive and limited in spatial coverage. While remote sensing has emerged as useful tool for estimating vegetation ψleaf remains unexplored, particularly mixed forests. Here, we use spectral indices derived from unmanned aerial vehicle-based hyperspectral imaging machine learning algorithms to assess mixed, multi-species Mediterranean forest comprised five woody species: Pinus halepensis, Quercus calliprinos, Cupressus sempervirens, Ceratonia siliqua, Pistacia lentiscus. Hyperspectral images (400–1000 nm) were acquired monthly over one year, concurrent with measurements each species. Twelve thousands normalized difference index (NDSI) combinations evaluated. Three algorithms—random (RF), extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost), support vector (SVM)—were used model ψleaf. We compared the results linear models based on NDSI. SVM, using species information feature, performed best relatively good assessment (R2 = 0.53; RMSE 0.67 MPa; rRMSE 28%), especially considering small seasonal variance (±σ 0.8 MPa). Predictions sempervirens 0.80) lentiscus 0.49), which had largest variances > 1 Aggregating data at plot scale ‘general’ markedly improved 0.79, 0.31 13%), providing promising monitoring The fact that non-species-specific, could predict implies such can also be coarser resolution satellite data. Our study demonstrates combining imagery non-invasive estimation forests while highlighting challenges capturing interspecies variability.

Hyperspectral images (400–1000 nm) were acquired monthly over one year, concurrent with measurements each species. Twelve thousands normalized difference index (NDSI) combinations evaluated. Three algorithms—random (RF), extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost), support vector (SVM)—were used model ψleaf. We compared the results linear models based on NDSI. SVM, using species information feature, performed best relatively good assessment (R2 = 0.53; RMSE 0.67 MPa; rRMSE 28%), especially considering small seasonal variance (±σ 0.8 MPa). Predictions sempervirens 0.80) lentiscus 0.49), which had largest variances > 1 Aggregating data at plot scale ‘general’ markedly improved 0.79, 0.31 13%), providing promising monitoring The fact that non-species-specific, could predict implies such can also be coarser resolution satellite data. Our study demonstrates combining imagery non-invasive estimation forests while highlighting challenges capturing interspecies variability. title: Advances in Artificial Intelligence in Education: Leading Contributors, Current Hot Topics, and Emerging Trends
abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has emerged as a burgeoning field in education, characterized by rapid growth and diverse research interests. This study employs bibliometric analysis to explore the landscape of AI focusing on studies indexed Web Science (WOS) database. A comprehensive search identified 1383 articles published between 1981 2024, which were analysed using Bibliometrix R package. The encompassed performance analysis, science mapping, network yielding visualizations such annual scientific production trends, most cited documents, thematic maps. Flow Cytometric Assessment of FcγRIIIa-V158F Polymorphisms and NK Cell Mediated ADCC Revealed Reduced NK Cell Functionality in Colorectal Cancer Patients
abstract: Antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC) by NK cells is a key mechanism in anti-cancer therapies with monoclonal antibodies, including cetuximab (EGFR-targeting) and avelumab (PDL1-targeting). Fc gamma receptor IIIa (FcγRIIIa) polymorphisms impact ADCC, yet their clinical relevance cell functionality remains debated. We developed two complementary flow cytometry assays: one to predict the FcγRIIIa-V158F polymorphism using machine learning model, 15-color panel assess antibody-induced cancer-immune interactions. Samples were collected from healthy donors metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) patients FIRE-6-Avelumab phase II study. The model accurately predicted 94% of samples. FF homozygous showed diminished cetuximab-mediated ADCC compared VF or VV carriers. In mCRC patients, dysfunctions evident as impaired decreased CD16 downregulation, reduced CD137/CD107a induction. Elevated PD1+ levels, lysis PDL1-expressing CRC improved activation combination PDL1-targeting indicate that PD1-PDL1 axis contributes cetuximab-induced function. Together, these optimized assays effectively identify offer potential for broader application evaluating across cancers therapeutic settings.

title: Predictive performance of count regression models versus machine learning techniques: A comparative analysis using an automobile insurance claims frequency dataset
abstract: Accurate forecasting of claim frequency in automobile insurance is essential for insurers to assess risks effectively and establish appropriate pricing policies. Traditional methods typically rely on a Poisson distribution modeling counts; however, this approach can be inadequate due frequent zero-claim periods, leading zero inflation the data. Zero occurs when more zeros are observed than expected under standard or negative binomial (NB) models. By addressing challenge zero-inflation data, offers insights into predictions. Although based single dataset, findings provide valuable perspectives enhancing prediction risk management practices industry.

title: Generative AI Solutions to Empower Financial Firms
abstract: The advent of generative AI (GenAI) has caused consternation across the industrial landscape. financial industry is no exception. scramble to find GenAI solutions in led a proliferation academic and practitioner literature on subject. However, field knowledge remains scattered. authors offer four deliverables. First, using survey interviews managers firms, they create funnel-shaped, two-stage framework how can empower businesses. top stage comprises seven value propositions for condensed into EMPOWER acronym. bottom includes three functions each proposition. Second, propose ten novel GenAI-based applications spanning five verticals services, thus extending current focus applications. Third, outline benefits risks these applications, visualizing them benefit–risk matrix assist prioritizing Fourth, research questions guide policy making at intersection finance.

title: Addressing Data Imbalance in Crash Data: Evaluating Generative Adversarial Network’s Efficacy Against Conventional Methods
abstract: In the realm of traffic safety analysis, inherent imbalance in crash datasets, particularly terms injury severity, poses a significant challenge for machine learning-based classification models. This study delves into efficacy Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), with specific focus on Conditional Tabular GAN (CTGAN), synthesizing minority data to address this imbalance. Utilizing from Chicago spanning 2020 2022, research evaluates capabilities CTGAN against three traditional resampling methods, as well an additional cost-sensitive learning approach. These methods are evaluated across various severity scenarios (2-class, 3-class, and 4-class) using five commonly applied The study’s dual evaluation approach encompasses both quality synthetic enhancement model performance. pivotal findings reveal that: 1) markedly outperforms other techniques generating superior data, least represented category; 2) While demonstrates substantial improvements over performance, advantage diminishes number categories increases; 3) Surprisingly, CTGAN’s does not result better performance compared learning, especially more complex scenarios. Cost-sensitive combined LightGBM achieves best all Given significantly lower computational resources required by is recommended handling imbalanced data.

title: Recent Developments of Directional Overcurrent Relay Coordination in Ring Distribution Network Based on Hybrid Optimization Techniques
abstract: As power distribution systems evolve from conventional radial structures to more complex ring networks, driven by the widespread integration of distributed generation (DG), challenge ensuring reliable and effective protection becomes increasingly critical. Directional Overcurrent Relays (DOCRs) are pivotal in this context, protect network through precise coordination between primary backup schemes. However, optimizing these settings is a daunting task due nonlinear nature problem myriad constraints involved. This paper embarks on comprehensive exploration cutting-edge optimization techniques deployed tackle DOCR challenges. The delves into Nature-Inspired Algorithms (NIAs), metaheuristic approaches, mathematical formulations, artificial intelligence methods, critically assessing their capabilities navigating landscape relay coordination. While NIAs excel exploring vast search spaces, slower convergence can be drawback. Metaheuristics offer robust solutions but at cost high computational demand, traditional though precise, may fall short dynamic environments. Pushing boundaries current methodologies, investigates hybrid that fuse strengths multiple approaches. These hybrids show promise transcending limitations individual offering innovative for intricate configurations. Moreover, sheds light profound impact emerging energy technologies existing frameworks, emphasizing urgent need adaptive strategies ensure stable delivery. Through investigation, actionable insights forward-thinking proposed bolster safety resilience modern positioning them meet demands rapidly transforming landscape.

title: Robust Spike Sorting Using Dual Tree Complex Wavelet Transform: Overcoming Traditional Limitations
abstract: Accurate spike sorting is vital for understanding the neural network dynamics of brain through extracellular recordings. Traditional feature extraction methods like Haar wavelet and principal component analysis (PCA) face limitations in high-noise environments when dealing with similar waveforms. This study proposes use dual-tree complex transform (DT-CWT), which an enhanced version traditional discrete transform, as a extractor sorting. The proposed approach aims to leverage approximate shift invariance superior time-frequency localization capabilities DT-CWT discrimination. A simulated dataset varying noise levels waveform similarities was used validation. performance compared PCA using both original modified superparamagnetic clustering approaches. Results demonstrated that DT-CWT-based achieved significantly lower average error rates across all subsets, especially challenging conditions high Moreover, DT-CWT’s computational efficiency suitability real-time, on-chip implementations next-generation wireless computer interface devices highlight its practical advantages. By providing robust discriminative features under stringent resource constraints, outperforms methods, establishing itself preferred choice scalable efficient demanding scenarios.

title: Optimizing Breast Cancer Mammogram Classification Through a Dual Approach: A Deep Learning Framework Combining ResNet50, SMOTE, and Fully Connected Layers for Balanced and Imbalanced Data
abstract: Breast cancer is a global health concern where early and accurate diagnosis crucial. Mammogram scans provide detailed imaging but require expert interpretation, which time-consuming. While deep learning shows promise in medical image analysis, the prevalence of imbalanced datasets hinders development reliable classification models. We propose novel deep-learning framework for breast from scans. The addresses data through unique two-module pipeline incorporating Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique (SMOTE). One module employs SMOTE on entire dataset to balance class distribution. At same time, second separates portion (20%) original evaluation applies remaining 80%. incorporates blockwise Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), utilizing VGG16 preprocessing input standardization ResNet50 feature extraction. A fully connected model, consisting multiple dense layers with batch normalization dropout regularization, was developed assess extracted features. model architecture iteratively refined combat overfitting, final version three (128, 256, 128 neurons) rates 0.5. This work contributes analysis computer-aided diagnosis. proposed techniques handling providing results can be extended improve various conditions.

title: NATE: Non-pArameTric approach for Explainable credit scoring on imbalanced class
abstract: Credit scoring models play a crucial role for financial institutions in evaluating borrower risk and sustaining profitability. Logistic regression is widely used credit due to its robustness, interpretability, computational efficiency; however, predictive power decreases when applied complex or non-linear datasets, resulting reduced accuracy. In contrast, tree-based machine learning often provide enhanced performance but struggle with interpretability. Furthermore, imbalanced class distributions, which are prevalent scoring, can adversely impact model accuracy as the majority tends dominate. Despite these challenges, research that comprehensively addresses both explainability aspects within domain remains limited. This paper introduces Non-pArameTric oversampling approach Explainable (NATE), framework designed address challenges by combining techniques classifiers enhance NATE incorporates balancing methods mitigate of data distributions integrates interpretability features elucidate model’s decision-making process. Experimental results show substantially outperforms traditional logistic classification, improvements 19.33% AUC, 71.56% MCC, 85.33% F1 Score. Oversampling approaches, particularly gradient boosting, demonstrated superior effectiveness compared undersampling, achieving optimal metrics AUC: 0.9649, MCC: 0.8104, Score: 0.9072. Moreover, enhances providing detailed insights into feature contributions, aiding understanding individual predictions. These findings highlight NATE’s capability managing imbalance, improving performance, enhancing demonstrating potential reliable transparent tool applications.

abstract: Scientific writing is a major consideration when research paper, as it encompasses all aspects of the research. With rise digitalization, new opportunities have emerged for development Artificial intelligence (AI)-driven tools and algorithms designed to analyze vast amounts data being uploaded. It has allowed researchers practitioners more efficiently access evaluate array scientific papers. This capability facilitates connection related studies from past, identifies gaps, speeds up processes literature review, evidence generation, knowledge discovery. Despite these advancements, AI are subject ethical considerations, regulatory approval, compliance with protection regulations, journal guidelines, transparency, public perception. Some text prompts used instruct generate effective information. Fostering trust transparency in includes operationalizing frameworks, addressing discrepancies, reducing plagiarism, generating innovative ideas. Future trends suggest that capabilities will keep advancing developing, underscoring need considerations balance automation human expertise. title: The impact of artificial intelligence in general surgery: enhancing precision, efficiency, and outcomes
abstract: The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into general surgery has brought significant advancements in surgical precision, postoperative complication prediction, and intraoperative assistance. Despite its potential, AI faces challenges regarding broad implementation clinical practice. This systematic review aims to assess the impact on outcomes surgery, including diagnostic accuracy, error reduction. A was conducted using PubMed, Scopus, Web Science databases, focusing studies published between 2020 2024. Inclusion criteria required that evaluated AI’s role with a sample size at least 50 patients. Studies reporting both qualitative quantitative outcomes, prediction assistance, were included. Ten selected, involving total 12,580 patients undergoing various procedures such as hepatectomies, colectomies, cholecystectomies. significantly improved accuracy (25% improvement over traditional methods) reduced errors by 18%. Additionally, AI-assisted surgeries showed an average reduction 30 minutes time, from 150 120 complex cases. proven be valuable tool particularly where precision are critical. However, further needed validate models across diverse populations healthcare settings ensure widespread adoption.
detailed_text: The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into general surgery has brought significant advancements in surgical precision, postoperative complication prediction, and intraoperative assistance. Despite its potential, AI faces challenges regarding broad implementation clinical practice. This systematic review aims to assess the impact on outcomes surgery, including diagnostic accuracy, error reduction. A was conducted using PubMed, Scopus, Web Science databases, focusing studies published between 2020 2024. Inclusion criteria required that evaluated AI’s role with a sample size at least 50 patients. Studies reporting both qualitative quantitative outcomes, prediction assistance, were included. Ten selected, involving total 12,580 patients undergoing various procedures such as hepatectomies, colectomies, cholecystectomies. significantly improved accuracy (25% improvement over traditional methods) reduced errors by 18%. Additionally, AI-assisted surgeries showed an average reduction 30 minutes time, from 150 120 complex cases. proven be valuable tool particularly where precision are critical. However, further needed validate models across diverse populations healthcare settings ensure widespread adoption. The impact of artificial intelligence in general surgery: enhancing precision, efficiency, and outcomes

title: Configuration of a multisensor platform for advanced plant phenotyping and disease detection: Case study on Cercospora leaf spot in sugar beet
abstract: Plant phenotyping, which involves measuring and analysing plant traits, has seen significant advances in recent years by integrating autonomous platforms sophisticated sensor systems. In contrast to traditional methods, modern unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs) provide robust accurate phenotyping capabilities enabling close, detailed continuous monitoring of crops under different environmental conditions. This study presents the configuration validation a multi-sensor platform (MSP) integrated with UGV improve through advanced data fusion co-registration techniques. The incorporates red, green, blue channel (RGB), hyperspectral from visible light (VIS) near-infrared (NIR) spectrum, thermal sensors, three-dimensional (3D) detection ranging (LiDAR), all subjected extensive calibration ensure precise temporal spatial alignment. Intrinsic was applied, including correcting spectral signatures VIS NIR. Additionally, timestamps were synchronised using as primary reference due its central position higher acquisition frequency. Homography matrices computed checkerboard patterns for geometric alignment across motion corrections accounted movement sample distance. LiDAR point clouds transformed into depth-maps (DMs) radial basis function interpolation, enriching further analysis. co-registered MSP tested detecting Cercospora leaf spot (CLS) sugar beet plants during field experiment. Two models implemented: (1) soil segmentation model based on DeepLabV3+ architecture, achieving an F1-score 0.85 accuracy 0.95, (2) CLS severity scoring custom convolutional neural network (CNN). model, leveraging NIR DM channels, achieved 0.7066, 0.7104, recall 0.7167, wavelengths between 814Image 1 851Image contributing significantly performance. These results highlight importance synchronisation systems phenotyping. Moreover, demonstrates potential multiple sensors precision agriculture, thereby enhancing effectiveness crop disease detection.

title: Efficient Net-Based Deep Learning for Visual Fault Detection in Solar Photovoltaic Modules
abstract: Detecting faults in solar photovoltaic modules (PVM) is crucial for enhancing their longevity, power output, and overall reliability. Visual anomalies such as soiling, partial shading, cell damage, glass breakage pose significant challenges fault identification, particularly harsh environmental conditions. Therefore, it essential to maintain healthy PV systems with extended lifecycles optimal performance through the quick efficient detection of faults. This work introduces a comprehensive approach that encompasses dataset creation, preprocessing, classification utilizing EfficientNet B0 model. Processed RGB images serve input model, enabling visual PVM. The evaluation proposed deep neural network model includes metrics accuracy, F1 score, specificity, recall. results highlight exceptional achieving accuracy 97.24% identification modules. Moreover, study underscores model's robustness efficacy comparative analysis other techniques reported literature.

Moreover, study underscores model's robustness efficacy comparative analysis other techniques reported literature. title: Machine-Learning-Powered Information Systems: A Systematic Literature Review for Developing Multi-Objective Healthcare Management
abstract: The incorporation of machine learning (ML) into healthcare information systems (IS) has transformed multi-objective management by improving patient monitoring, diagnostic accuracy, and treatment optimization. Notwithstanding its revolutionizing capacity, the area lacks a systematic understanding how these models are divided analyzed, leaving gaps in normalization benchmarking. present research usually overlooks holistic for comparing ML-enabled ISs, significantly considering pivotal function criteria like precision, sensitivity, specificity. To address gaps, we conducted broad exploration 306 state-of-the-art papers to novel taxonomy IS management. We categorized studies six key areas, namely systems, treatment-planning monitoring resource allocation preventive hybrid systems. Each category was analyzed depending on significant variables, uncovering that adaptability is most effective parameter throughout all models. In addition, majority were published 2022 2023, with MDPI as leading publisher Python prevalent programming language. This extensive synthesis not only bridges but also proposes actionable insights ML-powered

title: An Energy Storage System for Regulating the Maximum Demand of Traction Substations
abstract: With the development of electrified railways towards high speed and heavy load, peak power traction loads is increasing, maximum demand negative sequence current substations are also increasing. Therefore, this article proposes an energy storage system (ESS) based on Li-ion batteries for regulating substations. An ESS connected to DC bus a railway conditioner (RPC), which two supply arms substation. In response large fluctuation paper active regulation method short-term prediction load. The load adopts time series BP neural network error correction. Then, value substation state charge ESS, collaborative control strategy RPC formulated enable achieve suppression function simultaneously. Finally, simulation experiments were conducted using MATLAB, results showed that compared with traditional reference values, proposed in significantly reduces number charging discharging cycles, improves effect demand, has higher net income during lifecycle. At same time, it takes into account function, thereby improving comprehensive economic benefits quality grids.

title: Applications of Transformers in Computational Chemistry: Recent Progress and Prospects
abstract: The powerful data processing and pattern recognition capabilities of machine learning (ML) technology have provided technical support for the innovation in computational chemistry. Compared with traditional ML deep (DL) techniques, transformers possess fine-grained feature-capturing abilities, which are able to efficiently accurately model dependencies long-sequence data, simulate complex diverse chemical spaces, explore logic behind data. In this Perspective, we provide an overview application transformer models We first introduce working principle analyze transformer-based architectures Next, practical applications a number specific scenarios such as property prediction structure generation. Finally, based on these research results, outlook field future.

title: Deep Learning Based Panchromatic2RGB Image Generation from VHR Images
abstract: Image colorization is the process of obtaining colored images by assigning RGB color values to a grayscale or panchromatic image. This technique has an important place in field computer vision because provide better visual experience and are widely used areas such as image recognition object detection. It also many practical applications coloring historical photographs, adding colors be analysis medical images, improving satellite images. Colorization methods divided into two main categories: brush sample-based coloring. Both have certain limitations. The performance these depends on selected reference may sometimes contain false significant errors. While require operator intervention pre-defined rules, deep learning based largely automated uses neural networks understand global local context image, leading more realistic contextually accurate colorizations. presented study Denoising Diffusion Null-Space Model (DDNM) architecture. DDNM method that aims obtain efficient high-quality results compared approaches available literature. In study, weight data architecture was predict from using SpaceNet 6 open access dataset. dataset includes combination Capella Space 0.5m Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imagery Maxar's electro-optical (EO) imagery. order assess results, Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio (PSNR) Structural Similarity Index Measure (SSIM) accuracy metrics calculated.

title: Leveraging AI and Machine Learning for Digital Forensics
abstract: This article explores the digital forensics of cryptocurrencies and dark web, focusing on role blockchain in their formation evidence gathering. It emphasizes need for artificial intelligence machine language web critical gap research host-based cryptocurrency forensics, especially mobile-based forensics. Most studies focus outdated operating systems or platforms, emphasizing more up-to-date versions. Cryptocurrency primarily analyzes publicly accessible blockchains using clustering heuristics learning-based analysis to identify anonymous entities provide investigation guidance. Security vulnerability assessment are crucial examining forensic methods cryptocurrencies, providing insights into potential exploits attacks useful investigations. While Blockchain-based is advancing organically alongside technological advancements, there a focused attention cryptocurrency.

title: Convergence-aware operator-wise mixed-precision training
abstract: Abstract With the support of more precision formats in emerging hardware architectures, mixed-precision has become a popular approach to accelerate deep learning (DL) training. Applying low-precision such as FP16 and BF16 neural operators can save GPU memory while improving bandwidth. However, DL frameworks use black white lists default selections cannot flexibly adapt variety networks. In addition, existing work on automatic adjustment does not consider model convergence, decision cost selection is high. To address above problems, this paper proposes CoMP , non-intrusive framework for Convergence-aware operator-wise Mixed-precision uses two-stage based epochs batches ensure convergence performance respectively. After that, performs subsequent training according searched optimal plan. The experimental results A100 show that achieves maximum speedup 1.15 $$\times$$ <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mml:mo>×</mml:mo> </mml:math> compared with PyTorch AMP implementation, also saving up 29.81% memory.

title: Detection of focal cortical dysplasia: Development and multicentric evaluation of artificial intelligence models
abstract: Abstract Objective Focal cortical dysplasia (FCD) is a common cause of drug‐resistant focal epilepsy but can be challenging to detect visually on magnetic resonance imaging. Three artificial intelligence models for automated FCD detection are publicly available (MAP18, deepFCD, MELD) have only been compared single‐center data. Our first objective compare them independent multicenter test Additionally, we train and three new make available. Methods We retrospectively collected cases from four centers. chose novel that take two‐dimensional (2D) slices (2D‐nnUNet), 2.5D (FastSurferCNN), large 3D patches (3D‐nnUNet) as inputs trained subset Bonn As core evaluation metrics, used voxel‐level Dice similarity coefficient (DSC), cluster‐level F 1 score, subject‐level rate, specificity. Results 329 subjects, 244 diagnosed with (27.7 ± 14.4 years old, 54% male) 85 healthy controls (7.1 2.4 51% female). 118 subjects model training kept the remaining an set. 3D‐nnUNet achieved highest score .58, DSC .36 (95% confidence interval [CI] = .30–.41), rate 55%, specificity 86%. deepFCD showed (82%) had lowest (0%) precision (.03, 95% CI .03–.04, .07). MELD least performance variation across centers, rates between 46% 54%. Significance This study shows variance in dataset. The two input data sensitivity. 2D performed worse than all other models, suggesting requires greatly improved may it sensible choice aid detection.

title: Bridging Artificial Intelligence and Railway Cybersecurity: A Comprehensive Anomaly Detection Review
abstract: Recently, the techniques of industrial control systems (ICS) have developed rapidly, which leads to new cyber threats in this field. The railway system, as a special ICS, is also facing more and challenges intrusion detection risk evaluation fields. However, compared with other defense methods for are lagging behind. This paper comprehensive review application artificial intelligence (AI) industry, particular focus on cybersecurity. We examine existing anomaly based AI their implementation ICS operations. found that machine learning deep algorithms effective processing large amounts network traffic data, modeling normal system behavior, detecting anomalies. Different AI-based each own strengths weaknesses, they hold significant potential enhancing cybersecurity systems. While field industry still its early stages, several case studies demonstrate technologies already shown considerable promise safeguarding networks. there numerous practical applications, such improving accuracy, generalizability, robustness. Addressing these will be critical realizing full ensuring safety efficiency operations future. Our work serves guide future explorations, aiming contribute broader discourse applications

title: LLM experimentation through knowledge graphs: Towards improved management, repeatability, and verification
abstract: Generative large language models (LLMs) have transformed AI by enabling rapid, human-like text generation, but they face challenges, including managing inaccurate information generation. Strategies such as prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and incorporating domain-specific Knowledge Graphs (KGs) aim to address their issues. However, challenges remain in achieving the desired levels of management, repeatability, verification experiments, especially for developers using closed-access LLMs via web APIs, complicating integration with external tools. To tackle this, we are exploring a software architecture enhance LLM workflows prioritizing flexibility traceability while promoting more accurate explainable outputs. We describe our approach provide nutrition case study demonstrating its ability integrate RAG KGs robust solutions.
detailed_text: Generative large language models (LLMs) have transformed AI by enabling rapid, human-like text generation, but they face challenges, including managing inaccurate information generation. Strategies such as prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and incorporating domain-specific Knowledge Graphs (KGs) aim to address their issues. However, challenges remain in achieving the desired levels of management, repeatability, verification experiments, especially for developers using closed-access LLMs via web APIs, complicating integration with external tools. To tackle this, we are exploring a software architecture enhance LLM workflows prioritizing flexibility traceability while promoting more accurate explainable outputs. We describe our approach provide nutrition case study demonstrating its ability integrate RAG KGs robust solutions. LLM experimentation through knowledge graphs: Towards improved management, repeatability, and verification

title: Landslide Dam Studies in Uttarakhand, India: Past, Present and Future
abstract: Abstract A landslide dam is a natural hazard that results from of any type whose runout and interaction with local topography relief deposits it to form barrier or can hold back river water in the upstream region. The held behind forms lake risks breaching at moment due unconsolidated material. When this dammed breached, increases risk flash floods called Landslide Lake Outburst Floods (LLOF) downstream region, posing significant infrastructure livelihood. LLOFs are prevalent hazards mountainous regions globally, including seismically active Himalayas. northwestern Indian Himalayas (Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand) particularly susceptible landslides dams weak, sheared bedrock confined valleys. This review critically evaluates current knowledge on Uttarakhand, India. While paleo LLOF assessments common, proactive monitoring mitigation strategies remain limited. Here, we comprehensively historical contemporary categorising existing research methodologies into past, present, future studies. Future utilisation geospatial technology, numerical modelling, machine learning algorithms determine formation stability dams. comprehensive historical, ongoing, Uttarakhand sheds light these dynamic threats. Exploring Mosquito Hazards in Bangladesh: Challenges and Sustainable Solutions
abstract: Mosquito-borne diseases remain a persistent public health challenge in Bangladesh, posing significant burdens on individuals, healthcare systems, and socio-economic development. This review explores the multifaceted dimensions of mosquito problem, encompassing epidemiology, vector ecology, environmental factors, socioeconomic determinants proliferation. To understand disease burden, we explore transmission dynamics impact prevalent mosquito-borne like dengue, malaria, chikungunya. Furthermore, scrutinize efficacy limitations existing control strategies, including their implications sustainability. The role urbanization, climate change, water management practices exacerbating mosquito-breeding habitats is critically examined. research aligns with Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) point 3 11. By analyzing successful programs implemented other countries, aim to inform development evidence-based, integrated strategies for Bangladesh. approach principles Happy emphasizing innovation, data-driven decision-making, sustainable Ultimately, this seeks provide actionable insights policymakers practitioners combat improve well-being Bangladeshi population. title: Generative Artificial Intelligence in Marketing: The Invisible Danger of AI Hallucinations
abstract: This study explores the transformative impact of Generative Artificial Intelligence (GAI) on marketing highlighting both its significant opportunities and inherent challenges. GAI enhances strategies through automated content creation, personalized customer experiences, advanced data analytics, thereby increasing efficiency engagement. However, phenomenon AI hallucinations—where models produce realistic yet incorrect or misleading information—poses substantial risks, including damage to brand reputation, erosion consumer trust, potential legal ramifications. To mitigate risks associated with hallucinations, proposes comprehensive risk management that include technical solutions detect correct erroneous outputs, human oversight ensure accuracy, adherence ethical regulatory frameworks. By balancing advantages robust measures address AI-generated inaccuracies, organizations can harness full while safeguarding their integrity maintaining trust customers.

title: Coherence fraction in Grover's search algorithm
abstract: The question of which resources drive the advantages in quantum algorithms has long been a fundamental challenge. While entanglement and coherence are critical to many algorithms, our results indicate that they do not fully explain advantage achieved by Grover search algorithm. By introducing generalized algorithm, we demonstrate success probability depends only on querying number oracles but also fraction, quantifies fidelity between an arbitrary initial state equal superposition state. Additionally, explore role fraction minimization offers framework for solving complex problems machine learning. These findings offer insights into origins open pathways development new algorithms. Published American Physical Society 2024

title: Recent Advancements in Ergonomic Risk Assessment: Integration of Artificial Intelligence, Wearable Technology, and Industry-Specific Approaches
abstract: Ergonomic risk assessment is crucial in preventing work-related musculoskeletal disorders (WMSDs) across various industries. Traditional methods, while effective, have limitations, such as reliance on manual observations and a lack of real-time monitoring. Recent technological advancements, including artificial intelligence (AI), wearable sensors, industry-specific solutions, are addressing these gaps. AI machine learning techniques enable data analysis, providing more accurate proactive ergonomic assessments. Wearable technology, inertial measurement units pressure offers continuous monitoring worker movements postures, helping to prevent injuries sectors like healthcare, construction, manufacturing. The evolution towards automated, precise, systems promises reduce WMSDs improve overall workplace safety.

title: AI in enhancing cultural sensitivity
abstract: This study investigates the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in promoting multicultural sensitivity and inclusivity education. Using PRISMA framework, 71 primary articles were analyzed from ERIC, ProQuest, Scopus, Web Science. Findings indicate that AI-based instructional media outperform conventional methods improving cultural representation reducing implicit biases. However, challenges such as algorithmic bias unequal access persist, underscoring need for ethical frameworks culturally responsive pedagogies. research highlights AI's potential to foster adaptive learning environments, enhance engagement, address educational inequalities. Recommendations emphasize importance AI implementation support equitable inclusive practices

title: Ai-Powered Phishing Detection And Prevention
abstract: Phishing attacks, which involve deceitful attempts to acquire sensitive information by impersonating a trustworthy entity, have become increasingly sophisticated and widespread. Traditional phishing detection methods typically rely on heuristic or signature-based techniques, may struggle adapt the evolving tactics employed attackers. This paper examines role of artificial intelligence (AI) in enhancing systems. AI-driven approaches utilise machine learning algorithms, natural language processing, pattern recognition identify mitigate threats with improved accuracy efficiency. By analysing large datasets, our systems uncover subtle patterns anomalies indicative that conventional might miss. We also discuss various AI methodologies detection, including supervised unsupervised ensemble methods, deep models. Furthermore, we evaluate effectiveness real-world scenarios their ability new strategies. Our concludes discussion current challenges future research directions this field, highlighting necessity for ongoing advancements tackle dynamic nature threats.

title: “A.I. is holding a mirror to our society”
abstract: Since the release of open-source AI model Stable Diffusion in August 2022, a panoply apps that create AI-generated portraits, or avatars, have exploded popularity. One most notable examples is AI-powered photo editing app Lensa, owned by Prisma Labs. Lensa launched 2018 but went viral late 2022 due to launch its Magic Avatar feature, which uses fantastical (and occasionally bizarre) portraits users. This paper analyzed global English-language press coverage and found it focused on app’s predatory data practices, biased content produced, user behaviors associated with it. I argue this provides evidence discursive closure around key issues visual generative supports maintenance status quo. suggest both articulates AI-related harms frames those as intractable insolvable, creates discourse inevitability has implications for how these are understood public, approaches taken address them. In doing so, not only offers distinct advantages who stand benefit from discourse, also forecloses more imaginative public discussions what could– should– be.
