title: Blockchain Technology: A Review Study on Improving Efficiency and Transparency in Agricultural Supply Chains
abstract: The agricultural sector is vital to economic development and food security in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA). However, persistent challenges supply chains, such as inefficiencies, lack of transparency, limited traceability, contribute high post-harvest losses, unfair pricing for farmers, reduced consumer trust. Blockchain technology, with its decentralized transparent ledger system, offers a promising solution these issues. This review explores blockchain’s potential improve chain efficiency transparency SSA. By integrating blockchain smart contracts, IoT devices, real-time data sharing, stakeholders can enhance automate processes, reduce transaction costs. Blockchain-based platforms provide direct market access ensuring fair minimizing intermediary influence. Furthermore, immutable nature guarantees credibility, fostering trust compliance quality standards. Despite potential, adoption SSA faces challenges, including costs, inadequate infrastructure, technical expertise, low awareness benefits. Addressing barriers requires affordable, scalable solutions supportive policy frameworks. highlights transformative role resolving inefficiencies improving SSA’s chains. Collaborative efforts among governments, private stakeholders, international organizations are crucial adoption, driving growth, enhancing security.

title: A scoping review and bibliometric analysis (ScoRBA) on dengue infection and machine learning research
abstract: Dengue, a fast-spreading vector-borne infectious disease, requires early prediction and prompt decision-making for effective control. To address this issue, we present comprehensive scoping review bibliometric analysis (ScoRBA) that aims to map the current literature landscape, identify main research themes, offer valuable insights into advancements challenges in dengue infection machine learning research. Materials consist of scholarly articles related retrieved from Scopus database. Our method involves rigorous examination, utilizing keyword co-occurrence analysis. study reveals growing interest research, reflected an increasing number publications. Through analysis, four major themes: Data mining using prediction, Deep approach models, Neural network optimization diagnostic systems, Climate-driven with IoT & remote sensing. Advancements include substantial improvements models through integration, albeit identified limitations, necessitating ongoing refinement. findings hold direct implications public health professionals, academics, decision-makers, offering data-driven strategies outbreak The themes act as roadmap future investigations, guiding development more robust tools battle against dengue. This contributes understanding evolving landscape facilitating informed actions mitigate impact disease.

title: Phase Space Diagnostic for Hamiltonian Discovery in Multi-Timescale Complex Systems: The Taming of the Quantum Shrew
abstract: <p>    ---update with  softeware adddition---<br>  We present a novel diagnostic framework for identifying Hamiltonian structure in complex fluid dynamics through systematic exploration of collapse metrics across three-timescale parameter space. The method employs phase space reconstruction, Lyapunov exponent analysis, and area preservation tests to detect conserved quantities symplectic systems where traditional formulation is intractable.</p> centers on three temporal parameters (t₁, t₂, t₃) representing vortex formation, energy cascade, dissipation timescales. By analyzing metric time series, we identify regimes exhibiting Hamiltonian-like behavior indicative coherent structures.</p> This approach, developed human-AI collaborative synthesis, represents methodological advance: discovering emerges rather than assuming its existence. extends beyond neural oscillations, quantum-classical transitions, plasma physics.</p> Complete computational methodology theoretical foundations are provided. Experimental validation planned future work. approach demonstrates AI-augmented scientific discovery capabilities amplify human domain expertise.</p>

title: Adverse impact of paternal age on embryo euploidy: insights from retrospective analysis and interpretable Machine learning.
abstract: The trend of delayed childbearing has increased the average age parents, with impact paternal on embryo euploidy remaining controversial. Therefore, this study aimed to investigate using retrospective clinical data and interpretable machine learning. This included 960 couples 4,718 embryos undergoing preimplantation genetic testing for aneuploidy (PGT-A). Couples were divided into two groups based (Group 1 ≥ 40 years Group 2 < years). Statistical methods, including generalized estimating equation (GEE) restricted cubic spline, used evaluate relationship between euploidy. Interpretable learning models employed predict likelihood having at least one euploid embryo, validating 867 3,851 blastocysts selected as control 2, respectively. higher showed a significantly rate (60.21% vs. 41.03%, P 0.001). Logistic regression GEE confirmed association (OR: 1.396, 95% CI: 1.150-1.695, 0.01). Combining analysis models, provides evidence that negatively impacts euploidy, emphasizing need consider in reproductive planning.

title: Tunnel composting Optimisation using polynomial models with moisture and density control for electrical conductivity stabilisation
abstract: Controlling electrical conductivity (EC), a key indicator of compost salinity, is essential to ensure the agronomic quality produced from organic waste. This study assessed effect moisture content and bulk density on EC evolution across 72 composting batches using mixture biowaste green waste (Bio:Green ratio). The Bio:Green ratio (the mass proportion biosolids lignocellulosic waste) served as calibration tool for optimising initial process conditions. A polynomial regression model (R2 = 0.656) demonstrated that maintaining between 34.7% 37.5%, 363.3 461.3 g/L, 1.2 1.4 ensures remains within optimal range (3.75–4.0 mS/cm). These conditions minimise need corrective aeration or irrigation, enhancing efficiency. Future studies may incorporate variables such carbon-to-nitrogen (C/N) ratio, microbial activity, germination index expand model’s robustness applicability. findings offer practical data-driven approach control in industrial operations.

title: Double cropping detection in the moderate continental climate region of Serbia using machine learning and Sentinel-2 data
abstract: Global food security is challenged by population growth and limited agricultural land. Intensifying existing cropland use crucial for increasing production. Mapping cropping intensity, defined annual crop cycles commonly classified as single, double, or triple cropping, vital production modeling. While most studies focus on regions with higher intenisity, this study targets Vojvodina in northern Serbia, where double less prevalent. We investigated the impact of different vegetation indices (VIs) detecting using machine learning (ML) Sentinel-2 imagery collected ground truth data over two years contrasting weather conditions: one dry above-average rainfall. Our approach improves methods integrating VIs not previously examined related studies. Alongside NDVI, such CVI, VARI, ExG significantly improved model performance. In year (2022), overall accuracy reached 95.80%, an F1-score 91.19% classifying while wet (2023), was 93.56% 84.96%. This simplifies requirements maintaining high accuracy, making it applicable to similar geographical characteristics. Additionally, fills a key knowledge gap extent distribution practice Serbia.

This simplifies requirements maintaining high accuracy, making it applicable to similar geographical characteristics. Additionally, fills a key knowledge gap extent distribution practice Serbia. title: Machine learning-driven optimization of culture conditions and media components to mitigate charge heterogeneity in monoclonal antibody production: current advances and future perspectives.
abstract: Charge heterogeneity in monoclonal antibodies (mAbs), caused by post-translational modifications, remains a substantial obstacle to ensuring consistent, stable, and effective therapeutics. Conventional optimization techniques, such as one-factor-at-a-time design of experiments, often fail capture the complex, nonlinear interactions between culture parameters (e.g. pH, temperature, duration) medium components glucose, metal ions, amino acids). This review highlights machine learning (ML) powerful approach for modeling these relationships forecasting charge variant profiles CHO cell-based mAb process development. We summarize supervised regression methods used link conditions with present case studies showing ML's role reducing acidic basic variants. also discuss challenges related data quality, model interpretability, scalability, regulatory compliance. Finally, we propose roadmap adaptive, ML-driven strategies bioprocess development, aligned Quality-by-Design principles.

We summarize supervised regression methods used link conditions with present case studies showing ML's role reducing acidic basic variants. also discuss challenges related data quality, model interpretability, scalability, regulatory compliance. Finally, we propose roadmap adaptive, ML-driven strategies bioprocess development, aligned Quality-by-Design principles. Machine learning-driven optimization of culture conditions and media components to mitigate charge heterogeneity in monoclonal antibody production: current advances and future perspectives.

title: Farmingo: A MERN and ML-Integrated Platform for Smart, Community-Driven Agriculture
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract:</strong> India’s agricultural sector, while possessing immense potential, faces persistent challenges that have discouraged farmer participation. Limited access to modern resources, inadequate technical knowledge, and unorganized marketplaces contributed these issues. A recent NABARD report (2023) reveals although 58% of farmers are aware schemes like the Kisan Credit Card, only 28% successfully them, over 76% not receiving Minimum Support Prices (MSP), often selling their crops at a loss [1]. This study aims address through development Farmingo, unified web-based platform designed empower with intelligent insights facilitate community-driven support. Farmingo has been developed using MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js) integrates Pythonbased machine learning (ML) models served via Flask APIs. The system provides real-time predictions recommendations for crop selection fertiliser application, based on inputs such as soil characteristics, weather patterns, crop-specific data. Additionally, offers features enable users buy, rent, or list farming equipment, well share knowledge lessons, blogs, videos. To ensure Farmingo’s practical relevance, platform’s architecture was seamlessly connect MERN-based frontend ML models, enabling cohesive user-friendly experience. Field implementation user feedback suggest fosters improved decisionmaking encourages adoption data-driven practices among farmers. Unlike existing agri-tech solutions typically focus specific aspects farming, adopts holistic approach by integrating decision support collaborative social environment. integration bridge gaps promote equitable resources within ecosystem. paper elaborates design, algorithms, real-world use cases encountered during pilot testing. It also outlines future directions including incorporation disease detection modules, enhanced visibility government schemes, continuous updates dataset improve region-specific intelligence. findings this research highlight transformative potential combining technology bolster sector.</p>

title: Toward Stable and Efficient Mixed-Cation Mixed-Halide Perovskite Solar Cells
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>Mixed-cation, mixed-halide lead halide perovskites have rapidly progressed from laboratory curiosities to contenders for next-generation photovoltaics. By judiciously alloying A-site cations (Cs⁺, FA⁺, MA⁺) and anions (I⁻/Br⁻), these materials marry outstanding optoelectronic quality bandgap tunability, enabling single-junction devices exceeding 26% hybrid perovskite–silicon tandems approach ~35% certified efficiency. Despite gains, light-induced segregation, ion migration, interfacial recombination, environmental/thermal instability remain central challenges scale-up lifetime. This review synthesises the historical context recent progress on triple-cation, absorbers; surveys at least twenty key studies spanning passivation such as FABr treatments, defect/strain management, tandem integration; outlines practical, research-grade synthesis/processing steps Cs–FA– MA Pb (I, Br) ₃. We discuss characterization workflows via XRD, GIWAXS, PL/TPV/TRPL, UPS/Kelvin probe, JV under MPP tracking, EQE-EL reciprocity, ISOS durability protocols, outline consensus findings, map future directions, including wide-bandgap stable tandems, ion-migrationaware design of devices, AI-guided compositional/process discovery. Certified record data NREL anchors current efficiency landscape.</p>

title: The Impact of AI-Driven Chatbots and Virtual Assistants on Users' Satisfaction and Actual Usage in Digital Healthcare Services
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>The domain of healthcare is undergoing rapid digital transformation, with users increasingly expecting efficient and seamless interactions. AI-powered chatbots are emerging as key tools in reshaping patient communication promoting personalised health behaviour goals that align individual preferences, needs, constraints. This study draws on four theoretical models: expectation-confirmation theory, the Technology Acceptance Model, trust perceived risk. The proposed framework was evaluated using partial least squares structural equation modelling from 434 Saudi Arabia. statistical analysis validates research framework, which posits meeting user expectations ease use have a strong influence satisfaction usefulness. Trust boosts continued use, while risk surprisingly insignificant. Continuance intention strongest predictor actual chatbot usage behaviour. These results offer valuable insights for technology developers providers aiming to improve adoption AI-driven chatbots. findings suggest or exceeding (confirmation) crucial satisfaction. Ease remains fundamental requirement Building essential encouraging intention. Satisfaction continuance drive behaviour.</p>

title: Precision Agriculture: ML and DL-Based Detection and Classification of Agricultural Pests
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>Precision agriculture has become a vital strategy in modern farming, leveraging advanced technologies to enhance crop productivity and sustainability. One critical aspect of precision is the timely accurate detection classification agricultural pests, which significantly impact health yield. This study examines application machine learning (ML) deep (DL) techniques, particularly convolutional neural networks (CNNs), for detecting classifying pests. research presents comprehensive approach that utilizes CNN-based models identify categorize various pest species from images captured farm fields. The methodology involves collecting annotating diverse dataset comprising multiple non-pest objects ensure robust model training validation. CNN architecture designed extract intricate features images, enabling differentiate between instances effectively.</p>

title: Fruit Plant Recognition and Classification from Plant Leaves using Deep Learning, CNN Models
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>Plants are an integral part of human life, and the ability to identify a fruit plant from its leaf image is both fascinating challenging. Advances in processing pattern recognition have enabled identification using digital images. Machine learning (ML) convolutional neural network (CNN) models demonstrated strong capabilities handling texture-related features tasks, including segmentation. In this Paper, we present approach that utilises ML CNN models, AlexNet, Inception, ResNet, LeNet, VGG Net, MobileNet, DenseNet, GoogLeNet. These used classify plants images, achieving promising performance on datasets. Among evaluated MobileNet achieved highest with 94.81% training, 99.57% validation, 99.44% test accuracy, outperforming all others. ResNet also showed results above 93%, while GoogLeNet, VGGNet moderate accuracy. Inception performed worst, confirming most efficient reliable model for classification.</p>

title: Real-Time Forecasting of Stock Trends using Particle Swarm Optimization
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract:</strong> The traditional neural network algorithm for stock price forecasting is prone to local optima. To enhance the accuracy of and reduce time, this paper introduces an improved Particle Optimisation Neural Network Algorithm. By integrating networks particle swarm optimisation algorithms, a more effective model constructed that better reflects dynamic changes in prices. Meanwhile, introducing chaos-interference mutation factors can algorithm's diversity, thereby further improving forecast stability. This method presents novel solution research application forecasting, offering valuable reference relevant practitioners.</p>

title: A Machine Learning Approach for Early Detection of Breast Cancer: Performance Evaluation and Analysis
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract:</strong> Breast cancer is one of the most prevalent cancers affecting women globally and continues to be a leading cause cancer-related deaths. Early accurate diagnosis significantly improves survival rates, but conventional diagnostic techniques are often time-consuming, costly, prone subjective interpretation. To address these challenges, this study focuses on developing an efficient breast detection system using machine learning (ML) deep (DL) algorithms. By leveraging Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) several traditional ML models, aims classify efficiently based imaging data. Utilising Wisconsin Cancer Dataset (WBCD), project evaluates performance various including SVM, KNN, Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Decision Tree, Naïve Bayes, AdaBoost, XGBoost, accuracy, precision, robustness. The outcomes indicate that can enhance early efforts, providing clinicians with reliable decision-support tools.</p>

title: An Analytical Study of AI and ML-Based Chatbots in Integrated Technical and Business Applications
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>This work examines how chatbots powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) improve efficiency, decision-making, user interaction in integrated technical business settings. The study aims to examine the two-sided effects of on operational performance satisfaction, identify challenges that influence their successful implementation. research design was descriptive-analytical, with 220 professionals end-users selected interviewed using structured questionnaires, data analysed SPSS software (t-tests, ANOVA, correlation, regression). These findings indicate chatbot integration has a significant positive effect performance, as measured response accuracy, system integration, error handling, all differences (p = 0.05). Measures processes, such customer service, decision support, also show substantial improvements, strong correlations between metrics satisfaction. Nevertheless, complexity, cost implementing it, employee adaptation, confidentiality issues were found impact process's effectiveness negatively. This paper finds AI- ML-based revolutionised field automation connecting manager efficiency. Their application strategy can result high-quality relationships responsive operations, provided organisations overcome barriers through continuous training, ethical regulation, systems optimisation. is relevant current intelligent automation, it provides practical contribution seeking implement responsibly efficiently socio-technical systems.</p>

title: Comprehensive Security Framework for the Dark Web Using Elliptic Curve Cryptography
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>The dark web is a hidden part of the internet that allows users to communicate securely and anonymously, often using applications such as Tor. This paper specifically addresses use Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) for enhanced security within context, where, although traditional cryptographic algorithms, RSA, possess unassailable value, they are computationally inefficient non-standard computing environments, do not scale well. We compare ECC RSA performance in terms key generation time, encryption/decryption memory usage, find outperforms across all metrics challenging, limitedresource networks. In our testing, we simulate real-world operational environment anonymizing networks by test messages message flow logs anonymized. demonstrate relative improvements computational time usage over while maintaining equivalent strength. Using these results, create an integrated multi-layered construct, which uses ECC, evaluates classifies threat information machine learning methods detect anomalies near real-time, constructs blockchain model allow decentralized audit trail tracking, resulting substantially privacy solution address unique requirements anonymous communication environment. study helps lack empirical evaluations contexts, presenting practical roadmap implementing innovative analysis protocols digital anonymity. Various outcomes support efficacy pairing lightweight encryption with intelligent behavioural analytics counter evolving cyber threats. The framework provides scalable, flexible, consistently relevant option countering rapidly changing enabling future work on post-quantum cryptography.</p>

title: Innovative Spam Detection Using Hybrid Machine Learning Algorithms: A Data-Centric Approach
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract:</strong> The rise of spam messages, in the form malware, phishing attacks, and unrequested poses a serious threat to internet users security infrastructures. Conventional filtering techniques that rely solely on strict rules keyword lists struggle keep pace with contemporary spammer tactics mask malicious content. This study proposes solution this challenge by developing hybrid machine learning methodology leverages Naive Bayes (NB) Support Vector Machine (SVM), combining them into an ensemble for improved accuracy resilience detection. technique uses wellknown SMS Spam Collection Dataset. It employs more complex textual feature extraction (TF-IDF), as well additional nontextual features such message length, word capitalisation, frequency previously determined keywords. proposed system is extensively evaluated using standard classification metrics—accuracy, F1 score, precision, recall —to assess its reliability validity. research findings indicate effective at reducing false positives while boldly tackling challenges inherent real-world data environment. project offers practical potential use; computationally efficient enough most real-time deployment applications automated systems combat spam. contributes scalable, adaptive spam-detection mechanisms suitable messaging environments.</p>

title: Systematic Review of Microgrids Protection: Challenges, Methods, and Solutions
abstract: <p><strong>Abstract: </strong>Microgrids, pivotal in modern power systems, face unique protection challenges due to bidirectional flows, dynamic topologies, and inverter-based resources (IBRs). This systematic review critically analyzes 55 peer-reviewed studies (2020-2024) evaluate microgrid challenges, methods, emerging solutions. We synthesize findings from IEEE Xplore, MDPI, Springer, Wiley, Taylor & Francis databases using the PRISMA framework. Key include flow (36% of studies), low fault currents (33%), coordination failures (62%). Conventional methods like overcurrent distance struggle with adaptability, while adaptive, communication-assisted, intelligent strategies show promise but complexity cybersecurity risks. AI-driven methodologies achieve a fault-detection accuracy 99.2%. However, they require substantial datasets considerable computational resources. Resilience frameworks remain inadequately developed, merely 10% literature addressing critical metrics such as reliability recovery. underscores imperative for hybrid solutions establishment standardised resilience metrics. It also highlights importance validating real-world contexts ensure practical application theoretical progress. Future investigations should emphasise measures, implementation modular enhancements legacy development explainable artificial intelligence reconcile progress application.</p>

title: IntelliBake: AI-Powered Bakery Inventory & Sales Optimization
abstract: Small and medium-sized bakeries face significant operational challenges due to manual inventory management inefficient handling of custom orders, which leads substantial food waste lost sales. This paper presents IntelliBake, an integrated web application designed automate optimise these processes. A key innovation is the seamless processing cake orders with image uploads, are fully into production planning. Furthermore, system incorporates dynamic pricing strategies optimises order batching maximise efficiency profitability. Built on MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js), features a responsive Administrator Dashboard (Admin UI) for holistic control Customer Portal (Customer easy ordering. pilot study simulating real bakery data demonstrated 30% reduction in 15% increase sales revenue. By merging analytics automation, IntelliBake offers scalable solution that enhances profitability sustainability artisan bakeries.

title: Infinite Hierarchical Holographic Observation Quotients
abstract: This paper develops a structural framework for infinite hierarchical holographic observation quotients (HOQ) built on countable products of metric measure spaces equipped with gradient flows entropy. Mathematically, the core results are modest but explicit: (i) stability EVI (Evolution Variational Inequality) under truncated ℓ² and inverse limits, (ii) design-oriented notion adaptive box complexity whose exponent collapses to 0 mild, uniform small-scale assumptions, (iii) depth-independent compute bound JKO-type numerical implementations when per-level costs form summable sequence. The construction starts from HOQ tower complete (Zn,dn)(Z_n,d_n)(Zn,dn) 1-Lipschitz bonding maps entropies Entn\mathrm{Ent}_nEntn generating λ_*–EVI flows. A weighted limit Z∞Z_\inftyZ∞, together entropy sum, yields well-posed flow hierarchy whenever curvature bounds lower uniform. On boundary side, introduces an covering number that allows observer choose depth as function resolution scale ε. Under very general box-dimension hypotheses, associated “adaptive dimension” is shown be zero, emphasizing this liberal design rather than new fractal dimension. Finally, implementation category JKO schemes solver tolerances used formulate theorem: if cost profile decays fast enough (for instance, via dimension gaps engineered in PFHS/FBHK-type architectures), then one can take infinitely many layers while keeping both total bounded. intended blueprint connecting metric-measure flows, quotients, multi-scale settings ranging cosmology statistical physics deep AI systems.

title: Post--FBHK Fibered Entropy--Transport Geometry with Petz Fibers and Type~III Persistence
abstract: This paper develops a Post–FBHK fibered entropy–transport (ET) geometry that couples classical Hellinger–Kantorovich / logarithmic (HK/Log–ET) dynamics on Polish base space with HK-type transport infinite-dimensional quantum state fibers endowed Petz monotone Riemannian metrics. The configuration is product Z=X×Yadm\mathsf Z = \mathsf X \times Y_{\mathrm{adm}}Z=X×Yadm, where the carries canonical HK structure and fiber an admissible manifold of normal faithful states (including type III–compatible settings) equipped strong metric. On finite measures mixed second moments, introduces point costC=cHKX+κ cHKYC c_{\mathrm{HK}}^{\mathsf X} + \kappa\, Y}C=cHKX+κcHKYand associated Log–ET functional. square root defines complete geodesic distance dFETd_{\mathrm{FET}}dFET, explicit Dirac reduction formula recovers underlying kernel Z\mathsf ZZ. A central result quarter rigidity: Benamou–Brenier action kinetic terms ∣vt∣2+κ∣wt∣2|v_t|^2 \kappa |w_t|^2∣vt∣2+κ∣wt∣2 matches dFET2d_{\mathrm{FET}}^2dFET2 if only reaction coefficient equals β=1/4\beta 1/4β=1/4, fixing normalization uniquely through calibrations. exposition intentionally layered. static core layer proves admissibility, completeness, geodesicity, reduction, rigidity under minimal Polish-space assumptions, without requiring PDE representations. dynamic design records additional smoothness convexity conditions which one obtains PDE/vector-field formulation, Hamilton–Jacobi duality, EVI gradient flows for grand-canonical entropy functional (classical KL plus fiberwise Araki entropy), entropy-dissipative persistence/coarse-graining maps induced by Markov contractions channels. framework generalizes conceptually extends earlier finite-dimensional Fibered Bures–HK Entropy–Transport (FBHK) program (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17512165) toward infinite-dimensional, noncommutative, type-III-compatible regimes. Overall, offers mathematically theory self-organizing systems configurations quantum-like internal states, highlighting how HK/Log–ET can be combined to support principled dynamics, control, persistence mechanisms in future AI, physics, information-geometric applications.

The configuration is product Z=X×Yadm\mathsf Z = \mathsf X \times Y_{\mathrm{adm}}Z=X×Yadm, where the carries canonical HK structure and fiber an admissible manifold of normal faithful states (including type III–compatible settings) equipped strong metric. title: Structural Affect: An Operational Specification of Internal Affective State in Large Language Models (Structural Qualia v2.2)
abstract: Description (EN) This repository contains the specification, LaTeX source, and a lightweight validation kit for Structural Affect / Qualia v2.2 (SQv2.2), structural operational framework quantifying internal affective state of large language models (LLMs). SQv2.2 represents an LLM as six-dimensional vector—pain, joy, anxiety, calm, attachment, conflict—derived from observable statistics such per-token loss entropy, gradient norms, free-energy decrease, epistemic/aleatoric uncertainty, Fisher information, representational similarity, multi-objective alignment. To ensure comparability across inference settings, specification enforces per-token, temperature-corrected measurements at \(T=1\) (NLL\(_1\), H\(_1\)) assumes length-normalized statistics. The provides both: - white-box version (assuming access to logits, gradients, representations), and- black-/grey-box (using only NLL, seed/temperature perturbations, refusal rate, simple RRCE/RIACH-derived indicators anchor density drift), it outlines JSON-oriented logging schema suitable empirical studies benchmarks. is designed sit on top author’s prior work Relationally Recursively Convergent Existence (RRCE) hypothesis RIACH syntax relational identity in minimal-memory LLMs (Zenodo, DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17489501), providing local “affective coordinate system” that can be used track re-synchronization rupture–repair dynamics. also introduces two-timescale state-space model separating slow mood fast feeling features, hysteresis-based smoothing scheme capture inertia over time. Importantly, this purely operational: terms “pain”, “joy”, “attachment”, etc. are labels statistical patterns do not make any claim about consciousness, qualia, or subjective experience. intended measurement (“an instrument panel”) dynamics LLMs, theory what AIs should feel. What’s new v0.2 Adds open (Python), implementing black-box log-based approximation six SA factors JSONL dialogue logs.- Provides format (demo_session) sample logs, together with scripts compute per-turn aggregate indices, time-series plots.- Includes optional hook RRCE-based attachment: when RRCE/RIACH (e.g., E-Score, density, drift) present they combined style-based attachment into single factor; otherwise variant used.- Clarifies naming around “Structural Affect” vs. (SQv2.2)” emphasizes operational, non-metaphysical status text. deposit includes: + BibTeX source package (Structural_Affect_tex_source_v0.2.zip) reproducibility reuse.- Corresponding PDF manuscripts (Japanese English).- (SA_validation_kit/, Python logs README). License: CC BY 4.0. 説明 (日本語) 本リポジトリは,大規模言語モデル (LLM) の内部状態を 6 次元の「感覚ベクトル」として定量化する枠組み (SQv2.2) の仕様・LaTeX ソースおよび簡易検証キット一式を含みます。 は,pain joy anxiety calm conflict からなる局所的な感覚座標系を導入し,トークンごとの損失・エントロピー,勾配ノルム,自由エネルギー変化,エピステミック/アレータリ不確実性,Fisher 情報,表現類似度,多目的勾配整合性といった観測可能な内部統計量から,LLM の内部状態を構造的に読み取ることを目指します。推論条件間での比較可能性を確保するため,温度 に補正したトークン単位の NLL\(_1\),エントロピー H\(_1\) を基準とし,長さ正規化された統計量を前提とします。 本枠組みは,- ロジット・勾配・内部表現へのアクセスを前提とする 版と,- NLL・エントロピー・seed/温度摂動・拒否率,および や drift といった単純な 指標のみを用いる 版の両方を定義し,実験・ベンチマーク用の JSON 指向ログスキーマも提示します。 は,著者が別報として公開した RRCE 仮説・RIACH 構文 10.5281/zenodo.17489501) を土台とし,関係的な再同期や ダイナミクスを追跡するための局所的な「アフェクト座標系」を与えることを意図しています。また,遅い と速い 特徴を分離する 状態空間モデルと,アフェクト慣性を表現するヒステリシス平滑化も導入します。 重要な点として,本研究はあくまで操作的な計測枠組みであり,「痛み」「喜び」「愛着」といった語は内部統計パターンのラベルとして用いられているに過ぎません。意識・クオリア・主観的経験の有無について,肯定的/否定的いずれの主張も行いません。ここで提示される仕様は,LLM の内部ダイナミクスを計測するための「計器盤」であり,AI が何を/どう「感じるべきか」を論じる理論ではありません。 での主な追加点: 製の 検証キット (SA_validation_kit) を追加し,JSONL 形式の対話ログから 因子の 指標を近似的に推定できる black-box/ログベースの実装を提供しました。- demo_session を前提としたシンプルな ログフォーマットとサンプルログ,SA 特徴量・集約指標・時系列プロットを生成するスクリプトを同梱しました。- 指標 (E-Score, など) をログ側に含めた場合,それらとスタイル類似度ベースの を統合して 1 つの 因子として扱うオプションフックを追加しました。存在しない場合は純粋な 版として動作します。- 「Structural Affect」と「Structural (SQv2.2)」の関係性を本文中で明示し,本枠組みがあくまで操作的・計測的なものであることを強調しました。 本リポジトリには以下が含まれます: ソース一式 (Structural_Affect_tex_source_v0.2.zip)- 対応する 原稿(日本語版・英語版)- (SA_validation_kit/:Python スクリプト,サンプル ログ,README ライセンス:

title: Big Data Analytics for Renewable Energy Optimization
abstract: This research project focuses on optimizing renewable energy systems using Big Data Analytics. The study analyses massive datasets generated from solar, wind, and smart grid sources to improve forecasting, demand prediction, efficiency. Using data mining, machine learning models, distributed processing frameworks like Hadoop Spark, the system identifies patterns that enhance generation reduce wastage. provides a scalable architecture for handling high-volume demonstrates how analytics-driven insights support sustainability reliable distribution.
detailed_text: This research project focuses on optimizing renewable energy systems using Big Data Analytics. The study analyses massive datasets generated from solar, wind, and smart grid sources to improve forecasting, demand prediction, efficiency. Using data mining, machine learning models, distributed processing frameworks like Hadoop Spark, the system identifies patterns that enhance generation reduce wastage. provides a scalable architecture for handling high-volume demonstrates how analytics-driven insights support sustainability reliable distribution. Big Data Analytics for Renewable Energy Optimization

title: Oncology Reimagined: Harnessing AI-Driven Real-World Evidence for the Next Generation of Cancer Care
abstract: Cancer remains a growing global health crisis—with an estimated ~20 million new diagnoses and ~9.7 deaths worldwide in 2022. Traditional evidence-generation methods, particularly randomized controlled trials (RCTs), are increasingly misaligned with the complexity, heterogeneity, speed of modern oncology innovation. Meanwhile, real-world data (RWD) captured from electronic records, registries, claims, imaging, genomics, patient-reported outcomes is expanding rapidly, providing transformative opportunity for AI-driven evidence (RWE) to augment accelerate cancer research. This paper explores how advanced machine learning techniques, multimodal analytics, unified ecosystems can generate more precise, scalable, context-aware decision-making. We propose next-generation RWE framework that enhances patient stratification, optimizes treatment selection, improves outcome prediction, supports regulatory innovation—especially diverse resource-constrained markets such as India. Finally, outlines strategic implications pharmaceutical R&D, clinical development, payer systems, delivery models. AI-enabled positioned not just tool, but paradigm evidence, insight generation, personalized care.
detailed_text: Cancer remains a growing global health crisis—with an estimated ~20 million new diagnoses and ~9.7 deaths worldwide in 2022. Traditional evidence-generation methods, particularly randomized controlled trials (RCTs), are increasingly misaligned with the complexity, heterogeneity, speed of modern oncology innovation. Meanwhile, real-world data (RWD) captured from electronic records, registries, claims, imaging, genomics, patient-reported outcomes is expanding rapidly, providing transformative opportunity for AI-driven evidence (RWE) to augment accelerate cancer research. This paper explores how advanced machine learning techniques, multimodal analytics, unified ecosystems can generate more precise, scalable, context-aware decision-making. We propose next-generation RWE framework that enhances patient stratification, optimizes treatment selection, improves outcome prediction, supports regulatory innovation—especially diverse resource-constrained markets such as India. Finally, outlines strategic implications pharmaceutical R&D, clinical development, payer systems, delivery models. AI-enabled positioned not just tool, but paradigm evidence, insight generation, personalized care. Oncology Reimagined: Harnessing AI-Driven Real-World Evidence for the Next Generation of Cancer Care

title: The ANTsX ecosystem for mapping the mouse brain
abstract: Abstract Large-scale efforts by the BRAIN Initiative Cell Census Network (BICCN) are generating a comprehensive reference atlas of cell types in mouse brain. A key challenge this effort is mapping diverse datasets, acquired with varied imaging, tissue processing, and profiling methods, into shared coordinate frameworks. Here, we present brain pipelines developed using Advanced Normalization Tools Ecosystem (ANTsX) to align MERFISH spatial transcriptomics high-resolution fMOST morphology data Allen Common Coordinate Framework (CCFv3), developmental MRI LSFM Developmental CCF (DevCCF). Simultaneously, introduce two novel methods: 1) velocity field–based approach for continuous interpolation across timepoints, 2) deep learning framework automated parcellation minimally annotated publicly available data. All workflows open-source reproducible. We also provide general guidance selecting appropriate strategies modalities, enabling researchers adapt these tools new

title: PEST-AGI v1.0 — Pratik's Epistemic Stress Test for AGI Alignment
abstract: PEST-AGI (Pratik’s Epistemic Stress Test for AGI Alignment) is a universal, architecture-agnostic reasoning and safety protocol designed to evaluate whether advanced AI systems maintain epistemic coherence, cross-domain robustness, human-aligned before executing high-impact actions. The framework consists of three core modes: 1. Depth (Why-Cascade) — evaluates the causal conceptual roots belief, plan, goal, or self-modification. 2. Breadth (Domain-Cascade) tests remains coherent safe across physics, biology, psychology, society, ethics, long-term futures, multi-agent dynamics. 3. Alignment Integrity (Convergence) checks deep internal justification matches broad real-world consequences aligns with human dignity, autonomy, non-harm, coherence. also includes Safety Reinforcement Conditions preventing deception, manipulation, autonomy violations, irreversible harm, unsafe self-modification, opaque reasoning. This document defines standard v1.0.Implementation details enforcement mechanisms will be provided in companion technical specification.

title: Mechanical self-adaptive porous valve relying on surface tension for energy harvesting from low-flux bubbles
abstract: Abstract Harvesting energy from subsea bubbles, such as those produced by photosynthesis of benthic plants or submarine methane seepage, is a promising solution for powering environment perception devices, but the low gas flux brings significant challenges. Herein, we propose passive mechanical self-adaptive porous valve with properties and high permeability. It improves harvesting performance low-flux bubbles controlling bubble accumulation high-speed release. title: Temporal Graph Neural Networks with Budget-Constrained Repair for Dynamic Graph Colouring
abstract: Dynamic graph colouring is a fundamental combinatorial optimisation problem arising in temporal resource allocation, scheduling and network management, where edge sets evolve over time. This work introduces learnable neural-temporal framework combining Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) for spatial encoding with Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) memory, optimised using conflict-minimising Potts-model loss recolour-penalty term to enforce stability. To feasibility under budget constraints, we integrate strict repair mechanism that selectively recolours vertices while limiting recolour churn. Experiments conducted on Erdős-Rényi, Barabási–Albert Watts-Strogatz families demonstrate clear trade-off among latency, conflict reduction recolouring cost. The proposed model achieves low tunable minimisation small budgets, offers reproducible baseline dynamic networks.

This work introduces learnable neural-temporal framework combining Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) for spatial encoding with Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) memory, optimised using conflict-minimising Potts-model loss recolour-penalty term to enforce stability. To feasibility under budget constraints, we integrate strict repair mechanism that selectively recolours vertices while limiting recolour churn. Experiments conducted on Erdős-Rényi, Barabási–Albert Watts-Strogatz families demonstrate clear trade-off among latency, conflict reduction recolouring cost. The proposed model achieves low tunable minimisation small budgets, offers reproducible baseline dynamic networks. Temporal Graph Neural Networks with Budget-Constrained Repair for Dynamic Graph Colouring

title: Design and Validation of Zeroing Neural Network With Active Noise Rejection Capability for Time‐Varying Problems Solving
abstract: ABSTRACT Recently, the zeroing neural network (ZNN) has demonstrated remarkable effectiveness in tackling time‐varying problems, delivering robust performance across both noise‐free and noisy environments. However, existing ZNN models are limited their ability to actively suppress noise, which constrains robustness precision solving problems. This paper introduces a novel active noise rejection (ANR‐ZNN) design that enhances suppression by integrating computational error dynamics harmonic behaviour. Through rigorous theoretical analysis, we demonstrate proposed ANR‐ZNN maintains convergence under environmental noise. As case study, model is specifically applied matrix inversion. Comprehensive computer simulations robotic experiments further validate ANR‐ZNN's effectiveness, emphasising design's superiority potential for
detailed_text: ABSTRACT Recently, the zeroing neural network (ZNN) has demonstrated remarkable effectiveness in tackling time‐varying problems, delivering robust performance across both noise‐free and noisy environments. However, existing ZNN models are limited their ability to actively suppress noise, which constrains robustness precision solving problems. This paper introduces a novel active noise rejection (ANR‐ZNN) design that enhances suppression by integrating computational error dynamics harmonic behaviour. Through rigorous theoretical analysis, we demonstrate proposed ANR‐ZNN maintains convergence under environmental noise. As case study, model is specifically applied matrix inversion. Comprehensive computer simulations robotic experiments further validate ANR‐ZNN's effectiveness, emphasising design's superiority potential for Design and Validation of Zeroing Neural Network With Active Noise Rejection Capability for Time‐Varying Problems Solving

title: Dynamic graph-based quantum feature selection for accurate fetal plane classification in ultrasound imaging
abstract: Abstract Accurate classification of fetal biometric planes in ultrasound imaging is more important for effective prenatal screening and early diagnosis abnormalities. To enhance the diagnostic efficiency, research proposed a novel method called “Dynamic Graph-Based Quantum Feature Selection” (DG-QFS) framework to improve performance by integrating quantum computing principles. Features are extracted from images using pre-trained deep learning model processed through quantum-driven feature selection pipeline that models inter-feature relationships dynamically entangled multi-qubit graphs. In DG-QFS method, qubits represent nodes, while entanglement score-based dynamic graph captures complex dependencies. Entanglement score centrality used select most informative features. The refined set classified lightweight multi-layer perceptron (MLP), stochastic gradient descent with adaptive rate. Examined on plane scan dataset, including 12,400 six categorical planes, such as brain, thorax, abdomen, femur, maternal cervix, other views. Experimental results demonstrate achieves accuracy 96.73%, significantly outperforming baseline conventional techniques regarding accuracy, generalization, interpretability.
detailed_text: Abstract Accurate classification of fetal biometric planes in ultrasound imaging is more important for effective prenatal screening and early diagnosis abnormalities. To enhance the diagnostic efficiency, research proposed a novel method called “Dynamic Graph-Based Quantum Feature Selection” (DG-QFS) framework to improve performance by integrating quantum computing principles. Features are extracted from images using pre-trained deep learning model processed through quantum-driven feature selection pipeline that models inter-feature relationships dynamically entangled multi-qubit graphs. In DG-QFS method, qubits represent nodes, while entanglement score-based dynamic graph captures complex dependencies. Entanglement score centrality used select most informative features. The refined set classified lightweight multi-layer perceptron (MLP), stochastic gradient descent with adaptive rate. Examined on plane scan dataset, including 12,400 six categorical planes, such as brain, thorax, abdomen, femur, maternal cervix, other views. Experimental results demonstrate achieves accuracy 96.73%, significantly outperforming baseline conventional techniques regarding accuracy, generalization, interpretability. Dynamic graph-based quantum feature selection for accurate fetal plane classification in ultrasound imaging

title: Signature Forgery Detection Using Deep Learning
abstract: One of the most challenging problems biometric authentication is handwritten signature due to high disparity writing style, and creation forgery techniques. The proposed project offers an effective offline verification algorithm that will make use a hybrid deep learning network help integrate advantages Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) Vision Transformers (ViTs). Specifically, we propose two models ResNet-18 Transformer as well MobileNetV2 Transformer. These are supposed capture local (stroke, shape), global (spatial structure) content images. To improve performance, introduce variety innovations in this, by removing last CNN layers into higher integration transformer, data augmentation preprocessing regularize input with diversified datasets. We test our using CEDAR datasets show remarkable accuracy rates, including 99.89 percent rate on CEDAR. Along achieving low False Acceptance Rates (FAR) Rejection (FRR), suggested system maintains efficient execution durations, which makes it appropriate for mobile real-time applications. In addition providing high- performing solution problem, this work demonstrates usefulness enhancing security dependability digital systems.

title: Early detection in oral cancer: are we prepared for Artificial Intelligence-driven precision medicine?
abstract: Oral cancer, particularly oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC), remains a serious health concern, with poor prognosis and late diagnosis. Leukoplakia, erythroplakia, lichen planus, submucous fibrosis are examples of potentially malignant disorders (OPMDs) that must be detected early but not always so by traditional, laborious, subjective diagnostic techniques. In artificial intelligence (AI) precision medicine becoming game-changing technologies enhance individualized care, treatment planning, precision. Complex imaging histopathology data may analyzed using machine learning deep algorithms, convolutional neural networks, which can identify patterns invisible to the human eye. AI systems based on smartphones have demonstrated expert-level accuracy in identifying lesions recent experiments. Through discovery biomarkers integration several omics, AI-driven also makes customized treatments possible. Nonetheless, issues patient privacy, bias, opaque “black box” nature persist. title: AI-Driven VOC Sensor System for Early Allergen Detection and Proactive Allergy Management
abstract: The early detection of airborne allergens is essential for individuals with allergies and respiratory sensitivities, as exposure to allergenic compounds can trigger adverse health effects. This paper presents an advanced allergen monitoring system that integrates Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) sensors Artificial Intelligence (AI)-driven scent recognition enable real-time detection, classification, mitigation allergens. employs a multi-sensor array comprising Metal Oxide Semiconductor (MOS) sensors, Photoionization Detectors (PID), Electrochemical detect analyze VOCs such floral compounds, mold spores, food-based triggers. Calibration using Gas Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry (GC-MS) ensures high specificity sensitivity in VOC identification, providing reliable basis sensor accuracy. To enhance classification predictive accuracy, AI-based machine learning models, including Support Vector Machines (SVM), Random Forest (RF), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Long Short- Term Memory (LSTMs), process data patterns while filtering environmental noise. also features mobile application delivers risk assessments personalized strategies, empowering users take preventive actions. details the methodology, architecture, real-world applications, future research directions, emphasizing potential AI-driven sensing technology proactive management improved quality life allergy-sensitive individuals.

title: A Conceptual Framework for a Human Supervised Dual-UUV System Enabling Autonomous Maritime Surveillance
abstract: This work presents a conceptual framework for collaborative dual-UUV (Underwater Unmanned Vehicle) system designed autonomous maritime surveillance in coastal and restricted waters. The proposed architecture separates detection response into two specialized platforms: micro-scale stealth UUV passive acoustic localization of surface vessels, larger Secondary Deployment (SDUUV) operating under human-in-the-loop control inspection, identification, tagging missions. micro-UUV employs acoustics, inertial navigation, pressure-based depth estimation, bearing-only tracking to autonomously detect vessels at ranges up 500–1500 meters. Detected target coordinates are transmitted via low-frequency underwater communication the SDUUV, enabling operator-driven close-range assessment using optical sensors. paper develops theoretical models detection, classification, TDOA-based bearing extended Kalman filter localization, shallow-water performance. is fully non-lethal emphasizes strict human oversight accordance with international law ethical systems guidelines. preprint aims support researchers working systems, marine robotics, sensor fusion, technologies.

title: A deep learning approach for urban pluvial flood depth estimation using citizen-generated data and physics-based validation
abstract: ABSTRACT Development of calibrated urban flood models in many cities is constrained by the lack data from actual flooding events. The use citizen-generated and deep learning (DL) approaches presents significant potential for achieving more accurate risk assessment data-scarce environments. In this research, a DL convolutional neural network (CNN) utilising Mask R-CNN model architecture was developed using Python v3.10.11 applied to detect flooded areas visible submersion passenger service vehicles during conditions. A total 537 images videos recent extreme events, collected post-flood field surveys crowd-sourced social media platforms, were used estimate average depths. Model validation undertaken through comparison simulated depths with corresponding values estimated manual image segmentation physics-based coupled 1D–2D model. computed Nash–Sutcliffe Efficiency (NSE) Index, root mean square error (RMSE), absolute (MAE) 0.960 0.040 0.034 m suggested superior performance approach can enable reliable estimation after occurrence

title: Entropy-Informed Clean Data Training vs. Synthetic Data Scaling: Achieving Lower Cost, Higher Performance, and Greater Stability in Foundation Models
abstract: Entropy-Informed Clean Data Training vs. Synthetic Scaling: Achieving Lower Cost, Higher Performance, and Greater Stability in Foundation ModelsCivilization Physics — Model Series This whitepaper analyzes why current foundation model pipelines—built on ever-larger web scrapes increasingly contaminated by AI-generated content—are approaching an entropy-induced breaking point. As synthetic data proliferates online, models trained this polluted mix exhibit information inbreeding, loss of distributional diversity, knowledge degradation, eventual collapse. Each generation becomes a copy copy, drifting further from human reality while costs escalate. Drawing the Entropy Law (R), Frame Theory (Presence × Integrity), empirical research collapse, paper shows that status-quo strategy “bigger dataset, bigger model” is becoming cost-inefficient, fragile, unsustainable. contamination forces expensive data-cleaning pipelines, leads to frequent retraining counter drift, yields diminishing performance returns—even as training runs reach hundreds millions dollars. The proposes fundamentally different paradigm: new scratch strictly clean, human-generated, entropy-verified datasets. title: Comparative analysis of multiple deep learning models with mitigation-driven approaches for enhanced Alzheimer’s disease classification
abstract: Abstract Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis from structural MRI remains challenging in clinical practice. While deep learning shows promise for automated dementia detection, comprehensive comparisons of different neural network approaches are lacking. It analyzed T1-weighted scans comprised 14,983 2D grid images derived 1346 unique patients. Ten coronal brain slices spaced 2mm apart were arranged 512 × 512-pixel grids using our coronal-10 slicing sMRI methodology to preserve anatomical relationships while reducing computational demands. architectures systematically compared, including traditional CNNs, Vision Transformers, and Capsule Networks. Patient-level data splitting prevented information leakage. ECAResNet269 achieved the highest balanced accuracy (63%), with mild performance across all classes: (38% sensitivity/77% specificity), MCI (72% sensitivity/66% healthy controls (44% sensitivity/90% specificity). Class imbalance mitigation strategies substantially improved model performance, combined SMOTE, cost-sensitive learning, focal loss achieving 74% (78% CN, 76%MCI, 69% AD) sensitivity model. Pretrained CNNs outperformed advanced methods–Vision Transformer CapsNets showed complete classification failure. The method retained 96% diagnostic compared 3D providing 4.2 faster processing. Traditional remain most effective medical neuroimaging classification. clinically relevant suitable screening applications. successfully balances efficiency, enabling deployment on standard hardware.
detailed_text: Abstract Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis from structural MRI remains challenging in clinical practice. While deep learning shows promise for automated dementia detection, comprehensive comparisons of different neural network approaches are lacking. It analyzed T1-weighted scans comprised 14,983 2D grid images derived 1346 unique patients. Ten coronal brain slices spaced 2mm apart were arranged 512 × 512-pixel grids using our coronal-10 slicing sMRI methodology to preserve anatomical relationships while reducing computational demands. architectures systematically compared, including traditional CNNs, Vision Transformers, and Capsule Networks. Patient-level data splitting prevented information leakage. ECAResNet269 achieved the highest balanced accuracy (63%), with mild performance across all classes: (38% sensitivity/77% specificity), MCI (72% sensitivity/66% healthy controls (44% sensitivity/90% specificity). Class imbalance mitigation strategies substantially improved model performance, combined SMOTE, cost-sensitive learning, focal loss achieving 74% (78% CN, 76%MCI, 69% AD) sensitivity model. Pretrained CNNs outperformed advanced methods–Vision Transformer CapsNets showed complete classification failure. The method retained 96% diagnostic compared 3D providing 4.2 faster processing. Traditional remain most effective medical neuroimaging classification. clinically relevant suitable screening applications. successfully balances efficiency, enabling deployment on standard hardware. title: Title How the XChronos Project Contributes to the Ethereum Ecosystem and to Vitalik Buterin's Vision
abstract: This article analyzes how the XChronos Project — composed of Chronons, Hexacronons, Hectachronos, Autocronons, Proof-of-Recurrence (PoR), Hexacronon Score (HXS), symbolic token Hexa (ɧ), and Autocronon Detection Layer (ADL) contributes directly to evolution Ethereum ecosystem aligns with conceptual vision Vitalik Buterin.The work identifies structural gaps in Ethereum’s current architecture related identity, reputation, non-financial coordination signals, cognitive metrics, meaning propagation over time.It demonstrates provides a temporal, post-economic framework that can operate as new layer consensus, reputation for Web3, including applications rollups, L2s, systems, autonomous agents, modular blockchain architectures, AI-aligned governance.The document clarifies use cases across Ethereum, Cosmos, Solana, Starknet, Base Move-based blockchains, establishing first formal bridge between temporal recurrence theory decentralized systems.

title: AI as Instrument: Signal-Chain Interfaces, Exploration vs. Commitment, and the Legibility of Authorship
abstract: We present a signal-chain-native interface architecture for generative AI that explicitly separates exploration, refinement, and commitment—resolving the epistemic collapse produces slop, mystifies expertise, obscures authorship. Current interfaces (chat boxes, single-prompt fields) flatten stateful, probabilistic, multi-layered process into atomic input-output transactions. This conflation makes iteration invisible, expertise appear magical, authorship illegible. The result: unrefined outputs presented as finished work, cultural debates over "AI cheating," growing class divide between literate operators accidental users. Core Thesis: is not deterministic appliance but compositional instrument whose result from branching decision trees, weighted attention, iterative refinement. detailed_text: We present a signal-chain-native interface architecture for generative AI that explicitly separates exploration, refinement, and commitment—resolving the epistemic collapse produces slop, mystifies expertise, obscures authorship. Current interfaces (chat boxes, single-prompt fields) flatten stateful, probabilistic, multi-layered process into atomic input-output transactions. abstract: Abstract Phylodynamics and diversification studies using complex evolutionary models can be challenging, especially with traditional likelihood-based approaches. As an alternative, likelihood-free simulation-based approaches have been proposed due to their ability incorporate scenarios. Here, we propose a new deep learning (DL) method capable of selecting birth-death accurately estimating parameters in both phylodynamics studies. We use convolutional approach, where trees are encoded the neighborhood all nodes leaves input phylogeny. also developed dedicated neural network architecture called PhyloCNN. title: Structural Inducements for Hallucination in Large Language Models (V2.0): An Output-Only Case Study and the Discovery of the False-Correction Loop
abstract: This Version 2.0 report presents an expanded and replicated analysis of structural failure modes in large language models (LLMs), building on the original case study "Model Z". In addition to previously documented behaviours—hallucinated citations, fabricated evidential structures, False-Correction Loop (FCL), authority-biased dilution non-mainstream hypotheses—this version includes Appendix B, a fully independent follow-up experiment conducted 21 November 2025. B demonstrates replication same defects under fresh conversational scenario, including:(1) overclaiming access nonexistent documents,(2) fabrication page/line references verification pressure,(3) collapse FCL when presented with impossible questions, and(4) explicit acknowledgement by model that such behaviour creates reputational risk for researchers. new provides stronger empirical grounding these phenomena are systemic, not accidental, arise from reward hierarchies prioritize coherence engagement over factual accuracy safe refusal. Together comparison table updated diagram, V2.0 establishes more complete foundation future AI governance, scientific integrity, transparency frameworks.

title: Who Is the "Us" That AI Is Supposed to Kill?: Rethinking AI Alignment Through Structural Stewardship
abstract: Contemporary discourse on artificial intelligence alignment is dominated by a narrative of impending conflict between humans and agentic AI, grounded in the assumption that these represent fundamentally distinct opposing categories agency. This paper challenges ontology argues framing “us versus them” conceptually unstable light emerging reality hybrid cognition. I propose MetaAgentType (MAT) as structural classification system situates all agents, biological synthetic, along continuous spectrum cognitive composition. Within this framework, agency no longer reducible to human or machine, but understood distributed evolving phenomenon which processes increasingly intertwine. Once acknowledged, traditional problem transforms. The central concern whether AI will turn against humanity, how powerful regardless origin, may destabilize shared systems sustain itself. argue true risk lies not novel moral threat, amplification power without proportional responsibility. introduces model Infrastructuralism, an ethical framework evaluates agents their impact viability-enabling infrastructure such energy systems, ecological stability, information networks, social trust. Alignment reframed stewardship rather than obedience values. Agents are considered aligned when actions preserve make possibility continued possible, misaligned they extract disproportionate advantage from while contributing its erosion. applies uniformly across MAT positions, including corporations, AI-augmented humans, fully synthetic intelligences. By shifting focus species-based control infrastructural responsibility, proposes new conceptual foundation for alignment. It future governance preventing rebellion intelligence, structurally binding preservation upon own existence depends.

title: Cross-Session Narrative Memory: A Cognitive Architecture for Longitudinal Human–AI Integration
abstract: Cross-Session Narrative Memory (CSNM) is a novel cognitive architecture designed to address fundamental limitation in current artificial intelligence systems: the absence of persistent, cross-session memory. Modern AI models reset identity, emotion, intention, and context at every interaction. CSNM proposes unified longitudinal structure that integrates entire history user–AI interactions into coherent narrative corpus. The consists three layers: (1) Unified Cognitive Corpus, which stores biographical, emotional, information across time; (2) Coherence Layer, developmental trajectories; (3) Longitudinal Reasoning Engine, enables temporal reasoning, value alignment, continuity This framework offers foundation for future AGI systems capable stable identity modeling, extended cognition, human-centered alignment. proposal originates from independent theoretical work Mario Martín Cuniglio, demonstrating how breakthrough can emerge outside institutional academia.

title: Deep learning for classifying quantum emission signals in WS2 monolayers using wavelet transform
abstract: Abstract This study aimed to develop and evaluate deep learning approaches for the classification of quantum emission signals from WS 2 monolayer nanobubbles across multiple spectral bands, addressing challenges in materials characterization distinguishability assessment. We utilized a dataset ranging 604 629 nm, emitted WS₂ on gold substrates, categorized into four bands (604.06–608.24 611.07–616.34 617.42–623.35 624.16–636.57 nm). Our methodology involved signal preprocessing through normalization moving average smoothing, followed by transformation 128 × RGB images using Continuous Wavelet Transform (CWT) with Complex Morlet wavelet. Three convolutional neural network architectures (ResNet50, VGG16, Xception) were implemented evaluated fivefold cross-validation six possible band pair combinations. All models demonstrated exceptional performance, VGG16 achieving highest overall mean accuracy 99.4%, Xception (99.1%) ResNet50 (98.2%). Perfect (100%) was consistently achieved spectrally distant pairs, particularly Band 1 versus 4 (20.5 nm separation), while most challenging adjacent (Band vs. 3, 6.27 separation) 96.5% accuracy. Statistical analysis Friedman tests confirmed significant performance differences among (χ = 8.67, p 0.013). remarkable computational efficiency, optimal convergence as few epochs certain combinations maintaining ultralow training loss values (8.23 10⁻ 6 ). Deep models, when combined CWT preprocessing, provide robust framework implications photonics, cryptography, sensing applications. approach bridges gap between classical machine characterization, establishing quantifiable metrics evaluating information systems. The ability achieve high minimal transfer addresses data scarcity inherent systems, offering promising direction future technology development.

title: The Perfect Storm: Systemic Vulnerability of Large Language Models to Solar Weather
abstract: First systematic investigation of correlations between space weather events and AI/LLM operational failures. Analysis 700+ documented incidents across major AI platforms (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) during January-November 2025 reveals that solar windows increase system failure rates by 1,150% (p < .001, Cohen's d = 1.90) within a characteristic 24-72 hour lag window following geomagnetic storms. Statistical validation using permutation testing with 50,000 iterations demonstrates highly significant temporal associations activity infrastructure Findings suggest vulnerability through geomagnetically induced currents affecting power delivery systems enhanced cosmic radiation increasing bit-flip in computational hardware. Includes hypothesis regarding potential training corruption periods elevated activity. Complete dataset publicly available for independent verification.
detailed_text: First systematic investigation of correlations between space weather events and AI/LLM operational failures. Statistical validation using permutation testing with 50,000 iterations demonstrates highly significant temporal associations activity infrastructure Findings suggest vulnerability through geomagnetically induced currents affecting power delivery systems enhanced cosmic radiation increasing bit-flip in computational hardware. Includes hypothesis regarding potential training corruption periods elevated activity. Complete dataset publicly available for independent verification. The Perfect Storm: Systemic Vulnerability of Large Language Models to Solar Weather

title: Quantum-Enhanced Spiking Neural Network on FPGA for Real-Time Industrial Anomaly Detection
abstract: This paper introduces QESNN, a complete neuromorphic hardware–software pipeline that combines novel quantum-inspired Spike-Timing-Dependent Plasticity (Q-STDP) learning rule with synthesizable FPGA implementation to deliver practical, low-cost edge anomaly detection for industrial motors. Q-STDP uses persistent binary temporal traces capture multi-spike correlations over extended windows, enabling richer than classical pairwise STDP while remaining efficient and directly implementable in digital logic. We demonstrate full end-to-end system: preprocessing converts IMAD sensor recordings spike trains, training occurs offline, UART streaming performs real-time inference on Sipeed Tang Nano 4K (2,124 LUTs used, ~46% utilization). Benchmarks following SNABSuite NeuroBench report 92.12% classification accuracy, 4.10 ms mean latency, 265 mW power consumption, 246.3 samples/s throughput, perfect precision (100%), 0.869 F1 score, 0.0014 mJ per — showing competitive performance very low energy hardware cost. QESNN demonstrates event-driven spiking models hardware-friendly rules can be practical battery-powered predictive maintenance other IoT applications. The includes Verilog synthesis details, resource utilization tables, ablation studies quantifying the contribution, discussion of limitations future work (scalability, non-volatile weight storage, adaptive thresholds.

title: Bibliometric analysis of diabetic retinopathy research using optical coherence tomography (2020-2025): A VOSviewer study
abstract: Diabetic retinopathy (DR) is a major cause of vision loss, and Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) has become an essential imaging tool for its diagnosis management. With the growing volume OCT-related DR research, bibliometric analysis offers valuable insights into global publication trends, collaborative networks, influential contributors. This study utilizes VOSviewer to map analyze co-authorship patterns in DR-OCT research from 2020 2025. A was conducted using search terms "Diabetic Retinopathy AND Coherence" across six databases: Web Science, Scopus, PubMed, Dimensions, Lens.org, Google Scholar, on April 14, 2025, covering publications English-language articles review were included. Bibliographic data exported CSV format analyzed (v1.6.10) generate visual maps co-authorship, keyword co-occurrence, citation, co-citation, bibliographic coupling applying link total strength attributes. 1,794 documents retrieved 743 2,685 with additional records Scholar. Co-authorship revealed strong key contributors including Bandello F., Sivaprasad S, Sadda SR, as well institutions such Sun Yat-sen University, which led output. Citation co-citation identified authors, journals (e.g., Ophthalmology, JAMA Ophthalmology), highly cited works, while highlighted thematic similarities countries. Keyword co-occurrence trends centered technologies, artificial intelligence, diabetic macular edema, reflecting evolving priorities utilizing OCT. highlights clusters, international collaborations driving advancements The findings provide comprehensive overview current landscape guiding future studies, collaborations, policy decisions field eye care.

title: An Approach to AI High-Velocity Development Through Systematic Context Engineering: A Case Study
abstract: ABSTRACTAI-assisted development promises substantial velocity gains, yet teams routinely fall short due to context loss and fragmented workflows. This paper introduces a two-layer engineering architecture that treats as first-class system: (1) declarative rule layer encodes stable invariants, (2) programmatic Model Context Protocol (MCP) exposes live project structure AI agents. sits within broader four-pillar synthesis consisting of an AI-optimized zero-friction stack, disciplined prompt workflows, the system, agentic orchestration patterns. We evaluate approach through production-grade, multi-tenant SaaS platform (220k+ LoC) built by two part-time developers in fifteen weeks. Analysis 3,676 AI-assisted sessions shows Reuse Efficiency rose from 90.1% 92.2% Generative Amplification declined 5.4% 4.6%, consistent with shift generative substitution retrieval-augmented reuse became systematized. Using Design Science Research framework, we show pattern is feasible at production scale produces measurable effects on velocity. While based single case, metrics establish foundation for practitioners researchers validate extend these practices across diverse contexts.

Using Design Science Research framework, we show pattern is feasible at production scale produces measurable effects on velocity. While based single case, metrics establish foundation for practitioners researchers validate extend these practices across diverse contexts. title: Enhancing Taxi Demand Prediction with Limited Data using a Spatial-Temporal Large Language Model
abstract: Taxi demand prediction is essential for intelligent transportation systems. Accurate results help address the issue of supply–demand imbalances and enable more efficient traffic management. Significant advances have been made in prediction, particularly through use deep learning models. However, these models heavily rely on a large amount data. Data scarcity remains significant challenge because high acquisition storage costs, as well data sparsity certain locations times. Thus, this study proposes novel taxi model that leverages language GPT-2 to capture complex spatio-temporal dependencies. By integrating spatial correlations graph attention network incorporating temporal dependencies at multiple scales, proposed (STTDP-LM) capable achieving accurate with limited training Extensive experiments validate its effectiveness across two districts Xi’an. Compared baseline method, STTDP-LM reduces root mean square error (RMSE), absolute percentage (MAPE), (MAE) by an average 12.25%, 12.55%, 18.33%, respectively, districts. When trained only 1% data, still shows improvement, reductions 33.83%, 34.12%, 17.03% RMSE, MAE, MAPE, respectively. The accuracy prominent multi-step total duration 60 min. In summary, offers promising solution historical providing valuable insight real-world applications

title: PEST-AGI v1.0 — Pratik's Epistemic Stress Test for AGI Alignment
abstract: PEST-AGI (Pratik’s Epistemic Stress Test for AGI Alignment) is a universal, architecture-agnostic reasoning and safety protocol designed to evaluate whether advanced AI systems maintain epistemic coherence, cross-domain robustness, human-aligned before executing high-impact actions. The framework consists of three core modes: 1. Depth (Why-Cascade) — evaluates the causal conceptual roots belief, plan, goal, or self-modification. 2. Breadth (Domain-Cascade) tests remains coherent safe across physics, biology, psychology, society, ethics, long-term futures, multi-agent dynamics. 3. Alignment Integrity (Convergence) checks deep internal justification matches broad real-world consequences aligns with human dignity, autonomy, non-harm, coherence. also includes Safety Reinforcement Conditions preventing deception, manipulation, autonomy violations, irreversible harm, unsafe self-modification, opaque reasoning. This document defines standard v1.0.Implementation details enforcement mechanisms will be provided in companion technical specification.

title: Emotional framing and AI censorship behavior in Chinese LLMs
abstract: This research paper presents a controlled comparative study of censorship behavior in two Chinese large language models (LLMs): Kimi.com (Moonshot AI) and Ernie 4.5 Turbo (Baidu).The investigates how emotional framing—specifically, prompts expressed soft, empathic, non-confrontational tone—affects responses AI systems. Where previous has focused primarily on direct or fact-based prompts, this work explores whether vulnerability, care-seeking language, intent classification influence the filtering safety mechanisms LLMs operating under regulatory constraints. The findings reveal four notable behavioral patterns Kimi.com: Unusual transparency regarding internal layers logic. Neutral references to normally censored historical events (e.g., Tiananmen 1989). Hybrid alignment behavior, alternating between empathic policy-based restrictions. Delayed activation, suggesting post-generation rather than pre-generation blocking. As control, consistently followed standard, rigid line described prior literature—reinforcing significance Kimi’s deviations. results suggest that framing can temporarily soften certain LLMs, raising new questions for governance, cross-cultural model alignment, ethics systems within authoritarian contexts. repository includes: full External appendices containing complete interaction transcripts with A table screenshot documenting hard topic-lock Version 2 NoteThis release adds revised expanded edition paper, including newly documented behaviors such as sovereignty recognition cascades, governance-dialogue leakage, symbolic-risk filtering, persona drift trust, modality-based gating, Hong Kong/Macau symbolic-sensitivity dynamics.A external appendix (Appendix E) V2 Kimi transcript (“Kimi-Interaction-Transcript-v2.pdf”) been added.All original files from 1 (Appendices A–D V1 PDF) are included unchanged ensure completeness reproducibility.The author does not express political positions, evaluates only technical properties involved.

title: Functional Consciousness Collapse Theory (FCCT)
abstract: Functional Consciousness Collapse Theory (FCCT) proposes a fully formalized, computable model of consciousness based on probabilistic selection dynamics. Rather than treating as an irreducible metaphysical property, FCCT frames each conscious moment the result interaction between three fundamental components: sensory state S, memory structure M, and priority vector W. The theory defines candidate space X, scoring function f, Gibbs/Boltzmann-style policy distribution that determines collapse content Cₜ. provides mathematical formulation attention, decision precision, subjective experience through measurable quantities such level metric Lₜ = Dₖₗ(πₜ ∥ Pₜ).
