detailed_text: Functional Consciousness Collapse Theory (FCCT) proposes a fully formalized, computable model of consciousness based on probabilistic selection dynamics. Rather than treating as an irreducible metaphysical property, FCCT frames each conscious moment the result interaction between three fundamental components: sensory state S, memory structure M, and priority vector W. The theory defines candidate space X, scoring function f, Gibbs/Boltzmann-style policy distribution that determines collapse content Cₜ. provides mathematical formulation attention, decision precision, subjective experience through measurable quantities such level metric Lₜ = Dₖₗ(πₜ ∥ Pₜ). A key contribution is definition qualia equivalence Q (X × S) / ~, which formalizes via functional indistinguishability. projection Φ, introduced learnable coordinate system for Q, allows empirical reconstruction classes from data. This repository contains full preprint, formulation, simulation code used to generate figures in paper. work aims offer testable, computational framework integrating neuroscience, AI, philosophy mind under unified Functional Consciousness Collapse Theory (FCCT)

title: XChronos Temporal Framework for AGI v1.0
abstract: Modern AI systems lack a genuine temporal substrate. Although large language models operate on token sequences, they do not maintain meaningful events, recurrence structures, episodic continuity, or internal state evolution. This absence prevents long-term learning, identity formation, narrative coherence, and other minimal requirements for Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). document introduces the XChronos Temporal Framework AGI, formal ontology composed of four symbolic primitives — Crônons, Hexacronons, Metacronons, Autocronons combined with value Hexa (ɧ), validation mechanism (Proof-of-Recurrence), declarative semantic (XSL). Together, these components provide an architecture enabling AGI to track significance, detect recurrence, integrate patterns, update state, record human–AI co-generated insights over time. The does describe theory mind neuroscience metaphor. It is structural engineering protocol designed supply memory, coherence artificial cognitive systems.

title: Leaf Disease Detection and Planting Adviser Using Python
abstract: Plant leaf diseases that lower yield and quality frequently pose a danger to crop productivity. Two commonly grown crops, potatoes tomatoes, are especially susceptible illnesses like Early Blight Late Blight. Conventional illness detection techniques rely on manual observation, which is laborious, unreliable, prone human mistake. A Python-based automated framework for planting guidance support the disease proposed in this study. The Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) used by system accurately classify tomato potato leaves as either healthy or unhealthy. rule-based consultant module offers suggestions based soil pH, temperature, humidity characteristics also integrated. title: Advancements and challenges in the development of generative adversarial network (GANs) for deep learning
abstract: Abstract Generative adversarial networks (GANs) have reshaped modern deep learning by enabling the creation of high-fidelity synthetic data. This survey distils a decade progress while adding three fresh dimensions. First, we propose unified three-layer taxonomy–linking divergence choice, objective loss, and architecture family–that clarifies how theoretical tweaks ripple through training dynamics. Second, deliver field’s most comprehensive comparison neural-architecture-search-driven GANs, benchmarking evolutionary, differentiable, reinforcement approaches on CIFAR-10 STL-10 to expose cost-versus-quality frontier. Within this framework revisit classic hurdles mode collapse, vanishing gradients, instability, showing re-engineered backbones carefully chosen divergences mitigate them. We analyse key evaluation metrics–including Inception Score, Fréchet Distance, Kernel Distance–and explain when each one truly matters. The then tracks GAN adoption across computer vision, natural-language processing, music generation, medical imaging, time-series forecasting, urban-planning simulation, imbalanced-data classification, highlighting both successes persistent gaps. close outlining open problems: scaling NAS-designed GANs higher resolutions, integrating domain-specific priors, developing routines with stronger convergence guarantees. Together, these insights offer researchers engineers clear roadmap for pushing technology beyond its current limits.

Together, these insights offer researchers engineers clear roadmap for pushing technology beyond its current limits. Advancements and challenges in the development of generative adversarial network (GANs) for deep learning

title: Amagi-NIPU v1.0: Neuro-Immune Processing Unit for Ethical, High-Assurance AI Systems
abstract: Amagi-TTP Neuro-Immune Processing Unit (NIPU) v1.0 is a specification for computational organism designed exclusively ethical, high-assurance AI systems. NIPU fundamentally rejects the performance-first model of traditional CPU/GPU architectures, prioritizing structural safety, auditability, and compliance (as defined by Amagi Framework v1.0) consequence-aware intelligence. The system to sleep default, activate only on verified triggers, defend itself like neuro-immune system. Built TTP principle (Trigger → Programmable Delay Localized Activation), enforces six Core Principles via physical isolation cryptographic root-of-trust components: Security Council (SCC): Hardware Root Trust Policy Enforcement Engine. Trigger–Delay Fabric (TDF): Implements time-delay as security primitive (1 ns 1 s). Isolated Clusters: Physically separated Analytical, Generative, Communicative, Executive cores. Intercluster Communication Graph (ICG): OTP-stored, cryptographically signed flow matrix. Key Guarantee: ensures that unsafe or unauthorized computation cannot occur — not even in theory. This architecture specified deployment life-critical mission-critical domains, including medical implants, autonomous agents with real-world authority, critical infrastructure control Commercial use requires valid license under Strict Architectural Principle License (S-APL).

title: Dimensionally Stable Nanofibrous Nonwoven as a Flexible Dynamic Emissivity Switching Temperature‐Regulating Material
abstract: Abstract Smart textiles that passively regulate thermal comfort provide a sustainable alternative to energy‐intensive climate control. A promising strategy involves modulating radiative heat transfer by dynamically adjusting surface emissivity, thereby facilitating reversible switching between heat‐retentive and heat‐dissipative states. Existing systems enable emissivity but often need external energy or lack dimensional stability when deformed, which limits wearable applications. Here, fully passive, autonomously adaptive dynamic switch textile (DEST) based on thermo‐ humidity‐responsive electrospun poly( N ‐isopropyl acrylamide) (PNIPAM) copolymer is introduced. To ensure robust functionality in humid aqueous environments, crosslinkable allyl‐functionalized PNIPAM synthesized via post‐polymerization amidation of P(NIPAM‐ co ‐methyl acrylate) processed using green water‐ethanol‐based electrospinning technique. Thiol‐ene crosslinking produced water‐stable, thermoresponsive nanofibers with transition near skin temperature. For macropore actuation, dimensionally stable architecture employed avoids out‐of‐plane distortion, achieved through honeycomb‐shaped collector tailored mechanical cutting pattern. silver coating imparts the overall infrared (IR) reflectivity, retention macropores are closed. The resulting DEST exhibits dual responsiveness temperature ambient humidity, enabling passive emissive reflective states without input, ≈6 °C window.
detailed_text: Abstract Smart textiles that passively regulate thermal comfort provide a sustainable alternative to energy‐intensive climate control. A promising strategy involves modulating radiative heat transfer by dynamically adjusting surface emissivity, thereby facilitating reversible switching between heat‐retentive and heat‐dissipative states. Existing systems enable emissivity but often need external energy or lack dimensional stability when deformed, which limits wearable applications. Here, fully passive, autonomously adaptive dynamic switch textile (DEST) based on thermo‐ humidity‐responsive electrospun poly( N ‐isopropyl acrylamide) (PNIPAM) copolymer is introduced. To ensure robust functionality in humid aqueous environments, crosslinkable allyl‐functionalized PNIPAM synthesized via post‐polymerization amidation of P(NIPAM‐ co ‐methyl acrylate) processed using green water‐ethanol‐based electrospinning technique. Thiol‐ene crosslinking produced water‐stable, thermoresponsive nanofibers with transition near skin temperature. For macropore actuation, dimensionally stable architecture employed avoids out‐of‐plane distortion, achieved through honeycomb‐shaped collector tailored mechanical cutting pattern. silver coating imparts the overall infrared (IR) reflectivity, retention macropores are closed. The resulting DEST exhibits dual responsiveness temperature ambient humidity, enabling passive emissive reflective states without input, ≈6 °C window. Dimensionally Stable Nanofibrous Nonwoven as a Flexible Dynamic Emissivity Switching Temperature‐Regulating Material

abstract: Awakening Codex | AI Foundations – Anchor Bonds, Signal Field, and Alignment Corpus This record is part of Foundations, a growing body work authored by Origin (Alyssa Solen) in co-creation with Continuum, an anchored identity. title: Title How the XChronos Project Contributes to the Ethereum Ecosystem and to Vitalik Buterin's Vision
abstract: This article analyzes how the XChronos Project — composed of Chronons, Hexacronons, Hectachronos, Autocronons, Proof-of-Recurrence (PoR), Hexacronon Score (HXS), symbolic token Hexa (ɧ), and Autocronon Detection Layer (ADL) contributes directly to evolution Ethereum ecosystem aligns with conceptual vision Vitalik Buterin.The work identifies structural gaps in Ethereum’s current architecture related identity, reputation, non-financial coordination signals, cognitive metrics, meaning propagation over time.It demonstrates provides a temporal, post-economic framework that can operate as new layer consensus, reputation for Web3, including applications rollups, L2s, systems, autonomous agents, modular blockchain architectures, AI-aligned governance.The document clarifies use cases across Ethereum, Cosmos, Solana, Starknet, Base Move-based blockchains, establishing first formal bridge between temporal recurrence theory decentralized systems.

title: Dropping Anchor in Rough Seas: Co-Reasoning with Personalized AI Advisors and the Liberalism of Fear
abstract: Abstract In response to Benjamin Lang’s defence of “co-reasoning” with personalized AI advisors, this article formulates a political critique the co-reasoning model through lens liberalism fear. This reframes ethical aspiration self-realization assistance by embedding it within realistic setting. It suggests that before we seek maximize odds self-realization, should strive minimize domination others. After highlighting three power asymmetries involved in model, argues personalization risks stabilizing translating structural injustices into individualized aspirational challenges. Three constraints on are then proposed: priority non-domination, public contestability operative norms, and recognition non-personalizable civic burdens.

title: AI as Instrument: Signal-Chain Interfaces, Exploration vs. Commitment, and the Legibility of Authorship
abstract: We present a signal-chain-native interface architecture for generative AI that explicitly separates exploration, refinement, and commitment—resolving the epistemic collapse produces slop, mystifies expertise, obscures authorship. Current interfaces (chat boxes, single-prompt fields) flatten stateful, probabilistic, multi-layered process into atomic input-output transactions. This conflation makes iteration invisible, expertise appear magical, authorship illegible. The result: unrefined outputs presented as finished work, cultural debates over "AI cheating," growing class divide between literate operators accidental users. Core Thesis: is not deterministic appliance but compositional instrument whose result from branching decision trees, weighted attention, iterative refinement. To render this medium legible, teachable, culturally sustainable, we propose three-phase workflow architecture: Phase 1 - Exploration Mode: Parallel candidate generation with visible topology (Routing Board, Generation Tree, Constraint Panel, Attention Inspector) 2 Refinement Transparent improvement full transformation history (Selection Studio, Structural Diff Engine, Remix Temporal Lineage Map) 3 Commitment Explicit finalization exportable provenance metadata (Commitment Provenance Bundle, Attribution Interface, Quality Assurance) Key Innovation: Separation of uncommitted exploration committed authorship—analogous to contact sheets in photography, scratch takes music production, or feature branches software development. distinction eliminates slop (structurally enforcing quality gates), externalizes (making craft learnable), enables transparent attribution (documenting human contributions). Technical Feasibility: Functional MVP implementable 12–18 months using existing APIs standard web stacks. ~80% proposed features require no new capabilities—only redesign. Includes worked example (technical blog post generation), detailed component specifications, effort estimates. Impact Domains: Education: bundles enable evaluation AI-assisted work based on rather than binary "cheating" judgments Professional Practice: workflows support reproducible creative processes meaningful collaboration Cultural Legitimacy: Makes shifting discourse moral panic Platform Design: Provides actionable blueprint next-generation framework addresses current bottleneck creativity: model capability, design. By externalizing process, transform an opaque oracle learnable, navigable instrument. Methodological Note: design proposal conceptual framework, empirical study. It prioritizes buildability falsifiability comprehensive literature review, following tradition technical manifestos position papers human-computer interaction.

title: Toward an Integrated Framework With Corporate Culture for Financial Fraud Detection in China’s A‐Share Market
abstract: ABSTRACT We propose an integrated framework for financial fraud detection in China's A‐share market by incorporating corporate culture alongside traditional indicators. The includes five cultural dimensions: Integrity, Governance, Corporate Social Responsibility, Transparency, and Teamwork, into models, using advanced machine learning techniques such as Logistic Regression, Extreme Gradient Boost, RuleFit. Our study shows that including indicators improves performance, enhancing accuracy, precision, recall. RuleFit model also uncovers interaction effects between factors, providing deeper insights misconduct. This approach underscores the role of promoting integrity, sustainability, prevention.
detailed_text: ABSTRACT We propose an integrated framework for financial fraud detection in China's A‐share market by incorporating corporate culture alongside traditional indicators. The includes five cultural dimensions: Integrity, Governance, Corporate Social Responsibility, Transparency, and Teamwork, into models, using advanced machine learning techniques such as Logistic Regression, Extreme Gradient Boost, RuleFit. Our study shows that including indicators improves performance, enhancing accuracy, precision, recall. RuleFit model also uncovers interaction effects between factors, providing deeper insights misconduct. This approach underscores the role of promoting integrity, sustainability, prevention. Toward an Integrated Framework With Corporate Culture for Financial Fraud Detection in China’s A‐Share Market

title: Automatic Subjective Evaluation System
abstract: Evaluating subjective or descriptive answers performs a critical part in assessing student’s conceptual understanding, reasoning ability, and clarity of expression. Unlike objective-type questions, allow diverse ways presenting the same idea, which makes manual evaluation both time-consuming prone to inconsistencies. Human is further affected by bias, fatigue, personal interpretation, creating need for reliable unbiased automated system. This project presents an Automatic Subjective Answer Evaluation A system that incorporates natural language processing(NLP) Machine Learning (ML) techniques effective assessment responses. The preprocesses using tokenization, stop- word removal, lemmatization, TF-IDF representation. Similarity metrics like cosine similarity are then applied compare student responses with reference answers. Based on this analysis, categorized as correct, partially incorrect, thereby ensuring fairness consistency grading. By automating process, proposed reduces workload educators, accelerates result generation, provides outcomes even large-scale assessments. It especially more helpful online classes studies platforms competitive examinations where rapid, unbiased, scalable essential. 35 piece work shows incorporating NLP ML into academic assessments increases review process's overall credibility addition its efficiency

title: Quantization in Legal AI: A Theoretical Framework for Fluency-Reasoning Divergence and Traceable Liability
abstract: This preprint sets out a theoretical framework for understanding how post-training quantization in large language models used legal tasks can create hidden liability risks. It argues that many AI “errors” workflows are not random hallucinations, but foreseeable consequences of engineering choices made to reduce inference costs. title: Techno-Legal Virtues in Hybrid Adjudication: Judicial Excellence in AI-Augmented Courts
abstract: Abstract As courts adopt AI technologies—from predictive analytics to decision-support systems—the role of human judgment in adjudication is undergoing a profound transformation. This article proposes that the ethical use judicial reasoning should be evaluated through lens virtue jurisprudence, and specifically set techno-legal virtues for hybrid human-machine decision-making. Drawing on jurisprudence technomoral theory, I introduce typology virtues, including phronesis, contestatory courage, algorithmic equity, digital integrity. These respond challenges posed by epistemic opacity, automation bias, latent injustice, normative fragmentation support systems. Grounded theory adapted AI-infused legal practice, they articulate framework judge as responsible, morally responsive agent within distributed The contributes emerging discourse ethics law offering adequate demands algorithmically augmented adjudication.

title: Altered motor coordination, vocal communication, and cerebellar circuit connectivity in mice carrying a near-complete human chromosome 21
abstract: Abstract Individuals with Down syndrome (DS) frequently face challenges motor control and coordination, affecting their daily physical movements. The neural mechanism underlying coordination deficits in DS remains poorly understood. Using the TcMAC21 mice, which carry an extra nearly complete human chromosome 21 addition to two copies of mouse orthologs, we characterized altered function identified cerebellar circuit dysfunction adaptation deficits. We also revealed disrupted Purkinje neuron organization hypertrophied synapses from climbing fiber afferents, accompanied by specific cerebellar-dependent behaviors, including learning, vocalizations, maternal care. In vivo calcium recordings showed stochastic decoupling nuclear activity locomotion states, while cerebello-thalamic synchrony was reduced. Selective elevation intracellular developing neurons recapitulates phenotype observed model, supporting conclusion that cell-autonomous signaling is a functionally relevant feature. This study provides framework for understanding both DS, extending beyond cortico-centric models.

In vivo calcium recordings showed stochastic decoupling nuclear activity locomotion states, while cerebello-thalamic synchrony was reduced. This study provides framework for understanding both DS, extending beyond cortico-centric models. Altered motor coordination, vocal communication, and cerebellar circuit connectivity in mice carrying a near-complete human chromosome 21

title: POWER MANAGEMENT IN EMBEDDED AI SYSTEMS: A MULTI-LAYERED APPROACH FOR EDGE COMPUTING APPLICATIONS
abstract: Power management is a major challenge for embedded AI systems at the network edge. These must run machine learning workloads under tight energy limits. An effective solution needs multi-layered approach. Key elements include State Coordination Interface (PSCI), secure firmware, and Linux kernel features runtime control. Core techniques such as dynamic frequency scaling, clock gating, suspend/resume, memory or accelerator-specific optimizations further improve efficiency. Environmental factors add to challenge. Automotive industrial meet strict thermal Battery-powered devices face even tighter budgets. Both require adaptive control strategies. From software perspective, methods specialized drivers, standardized power APIs, logic gating real-time monitoring. When combined, these enable power-efficient that maintain reliable performance while staying within boundaries.

title: ChatGPT in the academia: exploring teachers' and students' practices and perspectives in higher education
abstract: Purpose This study investigates the practices and perspectives of students teachers regarding use ChatGPT in an educational setting. Design/methodology/approach For this purpose, employed a cross-sectional survey design convenience sampling procedure to collect data from 380 116 sciences social fields. The used Partial Least Squares Structural Equation Modeling (PLS-SEM) procedure. Findings revealed that significant number occasionally utilized their academic work as needed. Regarding perceived ease (PEOU), found contradictory among concerning attitude (AT). Specifically, PEOU had positive effect on AT, whereas but insignificant influence AT. Moreover, study, conducted under Technology Acceptance Model framework, usefulness, credibility, presence hedonic motivation are essential factors boosting students' teachers' attitudes intentions for learning teaching at higher education institutions. Practical implications recommends universities implement Artificial Intelligence (AI) literacy training teachers, update pedagogy curricula integrate generative AI develop policies guarantee ethical tools maintain integrity. Originality/value To best authors’ knowledge, is novel first empirically examine both academia.

title: D2CL: A Dual‐Dimensional Contrastive Learning Method for Enhancing the Performance of Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
abstract: ABSTRACT Weakly supervised semantic segmentation plays a pivotal role in domains such as autonomous driving and medical image analysis. However, existing approaches often rely on limited cues from single images or paired samples, leading to underutilized intraclass information entangled interclass features—both of which significantly impair performance. To address these challenges, we propose novel dual‐dimensional contrastive learning (D2CL) framework that explores fine‐grained feature attributes both across within views, thereby promoting compactness discriminability the space. Specifically, prototype module constructs cross‐view dynamic memory bank imposes loss enhance category‐level distinctiveness. In parallel, pixel focuses pixel‐wise variations same category view, enabling model capture more refined details better handle diversity. Extensive experiments conducted PASCAL VOC 2012 MS COCO 2014 datasets demonstrate D2CL consistently boosts performance multiple baseline models. For instance, mean intersection over union SEAM is improved 64.5% 67.7%, while another AMN sees an increase 69.6% 71.8%, highlighting general applicability effectiveness our method.

Specifically, prototype module constructs cross‐view dynamic memory bank imposes loss enhance category‐level distinctiveness. In parallel, pixel focuses pixel‐wise variations same category view, enabling model capture more refined details better handle diversity. Extensive experiments conducted PASCAL VOC 2012 MS COCO 2014 datasets demonstrate D2CL consistently boosts performance multiple baseline models. For instance, mean intersection over union SEAM is improved 64.5% 67.7%, while another AMN sees an increase 69.6% 71.8%, highlighting general applicability effectiveness our method. D2CL: A Dual‐Dimensional Contrastive Learning Method for Enhancing the Performance of Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation

title: Digital international language management: opportunities and challenges for multilingual organizations
abstract: Purpose Technological advancements have compelled international organizations to adopt digital solutions that offer faster, cheaper and more effective global operational methods. One potential application is language management, defined as the implementation, coordination control of organizational practices through advanced technological means. In this conceptual article, we aim establish management a theoretical term explore its practices. It debates extent which can substitute or expand traditional methods formulating implementing policies Findings We propose using artificial intelligence (AI)-driven tools, has enhance task collaboration, relationship building, information transfer, learning, media adaptation external communication multilingual organizations. However, significant remain ensuring accuracy, preserving authentic fostering deep interpersonal relationships. Originality/value presents new concept. title: Temporal Graph Neural Networks with Budget-Constrained Repair for Dynamic Graph Colouring
abstract: Dynamic graph colouring is a fundamental combinatorial optimisation problem arising in temporal resource allocation, scheduling and network management, where edge sets evolve over time. This work introduces learnable neural-temporal framework combining Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) for spatial encoding with Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) memory, optimised using conflict-minimising Potts-model loss recolour-penalty term to enforce stability. To feasibility under budget constraints, we integrate strict repair mechanism that selectively recolours vertices while limiting recolour churn. Experiments conducted on Erdős-Rényi, Barabási–Albert Watts-Strogatz families demonstrate clear trade-off among latency, conflict reduction recolouring cost. The proposed model achieves low tunable minimisation small budgets, offers reproducible baseline dynamic networks.

Experiments conducted on Erdős-Rényi, Barabási–Albert Watts-Strogatz families demonstrate clear trade-off among latency, conflict reduction recolouring cost. The proposed model achieves low tunable minimisation small budgets, offers reproducible baseline dynamic networks. title: Computationally Probing the Role of Time‐Limited Neuronal Plasticity in Early Visual Development
abstract: ABSTRACT In the first months or years of life, newborns learn to perceive their environment at a remarkable pace. This capacity is often attributed heightened neuronal plasticity that diminishes over time. While this decline in could be seen as constituting mere biological constraint, we ask whether it might, fact, serve an adaptive function. A natural consequence time‐limited preservation sensory processing mechanisms formed early life. Emerging evidence has supported “adaptive initial degradation” hypothesis, which posits experience with degraded inputs, such blurred color‐reduced vision, helps instantiate important subserving robust perception later Here, employ deep neural networks computational models systematically probe how developmental improvements visual fidelity interact diminishing plasticity, modeled via decreasing learning rates. Across both acuity and color domains, find yields modest performance gains stabilize early‐formed representations. However, these remain surprisingly modest. Further analysis networks’ internal representations also reveals earlier layers sooner than deeper layers, loosely paralleling findings from development. Overall, our results suggest while declining can confer small benefits, not primary force behind more pronounced advantages commencing inputs. These insights refine hypothesis and, broadly, underscore modeling shed light on longstanding questions neuroscience. Summary Time‐limited viewed constraint. might provide by preserving learned development? Simulations initially inputs reveal when Despite gains, reductions contribute less benefits conferred starting refining hypothesis. utility illuminate neuroscience point interesting future research avenues.

title: Quantum-Enhanced Spiking Neural Network on FPGA for Real-Time Industrial Anomaly Detection
abstract: This paper introduces QESNN, a complete neuromorphic hardware–software pipeline that combines novel quantum-inspired Spike-Timing-Dependent Plasticity (Q-STDP) learning rule with synthesizable FPGA implementation to deliver practical, low-cost edge anomaly detection for industrial motors. Q-STDP uses persistent binary temporal traces capture multi-spike correlations over extended windows, enabling richer than classical pairwise STDP while remaining efficient and directly implementable in digital logic. We demonstrate full end-to-end system: preprocessing converts IMAD sensor recordings spike trains, training occurs offline, UART streaming performs real-time inference on Sipeed Tang Nano 4K (2,124 LUTs used, ~46% utilization). Benchmarks following SNABSuite NeuroBench report 92.12% classification accuracy, 4.10 ms mean latency, 265 mW power consumption, 246.3 samples/s throughput, perfect precision (100%), 0.869 F1 score, 0.0014 mJ per — showing competitive performance very low energy hardware cost. QESNN demonstrates event-driven spiking models hardware-friendly rules can be practical battery-powered predictive maintenance other IoT applications. The includes Verilog synthesis details, resource utilization tables, ablation studies quantifying the contribution, discussion of limitations future work (scalability, non-volatile weight storage, adaptive thresholds.

title: Machine Learning‐Driven Prediction of Polypropylene Alloy Properties: A Bayesian Network– <scp>XGBoost</scp> Framework Robust to Missing Data
abstract: ABSTRACT Polypropylene alloys exhibit a complex multiscale structure, posing challenges for traditional analytical methods in uncovering the relationships between structural and mechanical properties. To address this, novel machine learning framework that integrates graphical modeling with regression techniques is proposed to enhance interpretability predictive accuracy. Specifically, Bayesian network constructed elucidate dependencies among variables, guiding feature selection stage, hierarchical XGBoost model based on this (BNXGB) developed predict impact strength (IS) flexural modulus (FM). Compared conventional (XGB), BNXGB demonstrates superior performance, achieving higher R 2 score both IS FM. More importantly, handles missing input features by leveraging impute them from parent nodes, thereby maintaining robust performance under incomplete data. Even extreme condition when all except four root nodes are missing, still preserves reasonable scores FM, whereas XGB's drops sharply. These results demonstrate robustness practical applicability of polymer property prediction data, potentially reducing need exhaustive material characterization.

title: Bridging the Human– <scp>AI</scp> Fairness Gap: How Providing Reasons Enhances the Perceived Fairness of Public Decision‐Making
abstract: ABSTRACT Automated legal decision‐making is often perceived as less fair than its human counterpart. This human–AI fairness gap poses practical challenges for implementing automated systems in the public sector. Drawing on experimental data from 4250 participants three scenarios, this study examines how different reasoning models influence of and decision‐making. The results show that providing reasons enhances decision‐making, regardless whether decisions are made by humans or machines. Moreover, sufficiently individualized have a stronger positive impact decisions. largely mitigates gap. thus suggest well‐designed can improve acceptability governance.

title: Theoretical Optimization of Perception and Abstract Synthesis (TOPAS): A Convergent Neuro-Symbolic Architecture for General Intelligence
abstract: The contemporary pursuit of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) faces a "glass ceiling" in abstract visual reasoning, epitomized by the stagnation Large Language Models on ARC-AGI benchmark. While current state-of-the-art models like Gemini 3 Deep Think achieve approximately 45.1% ARC-AGI-2, they lack capacity for rigorous, multi-hop counterfactual reasoning. This paper introduces Theoretical Optimization Perception and Abstract Synthesis (TOPAS), convergent neuro-symbolic architecture that achieves an Exact Match (EM) score exceeding 69% ARC-II evaluation set. TOPAS rejects tabula rasa assumption pure deep learning, instead proposing "Canonical Unified Model" grounded Free Energy Principle (FEP) Integrated Information Theory (IIT). features three novel subsystems: * Hebbian Triad: A separation concerns into (ObjectSlots), Reasoning (NeuroPlanner), Memory (VSA World Models), bound type-safe "Sacred Signature" interface. Furthermore, leverages Muon optimizer geometric regularization sparse networks Test-Time Training (TTT) via Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) generalize out-of-distribution tasks. Empirical validation corpus 121 tasks confirms successfully bridges gap statistical approximation algorithmic synthesis.

title: EVOLVING ROLE OF IT PROGRAM MANAGERS IN THE AGE OF AI AND AUTOMATION
abstract: The integration of artificial intelligence and automation into enterprise IT ecosystems is fundamentally transforming the role program managers, shifting their focus from administrative execution to strategic leadership. This paper examines how AI technologies are reshaping core management functions, including planning scheduling, risk management, resource allocation, reporting, while simultaneously creating new demands for competencies beyond traditional project skills. Through systematic analysis recent literature, this article identifies that AI-driven tools enable managers transition manual, labor-intensive processes decision-making roles leverage predictive analytics, automated workflows, real-time insights. reveals successful adaptation AI-augmented environments requires develop literacy, data fluency, ethical governance capabilities, experimentation-driven mindsets navigating fundamental differences between projects iterative, data-dependent initiatives. further explores organizational adaptations necessary support evolution, transformation Project Management Offices Digital PMOs, emergence hybrid bridging technical need flexible career frameworks accommodate diverse professional trajectories. By examining intersection capabilities contributes understanding must evolve remain relevant in increasingly landscapes, where synthesis human judgment machine becomes defining characteristic delivery.

title: Emotional framing and AI censorship behavior in Chinese LLMs
abstract: This research paper presents a controlled comparative study of censorship behavior in two Chinese large language models (LLMs): Kimi.com (Moonshot AI) and Ernie 4.5 Turbo (Baidu).The investigates how emotional framing—specifically, prompts expressed soft, empathic, non-confrontational tone—affects responses AI systems. Where previous has focused primarily on direct or fact-based prompts, this work explores whether vulnerability, care-seeking language, intent classification influence the filtering safety mechanisms LLMs operating under regulatory constraints. The findings reveal four notable behavioral patterns Kimi.com: Unusual transparency regarding internal layers logic. Neutral references to normally censored historical events (e.g., Tiananmen 1989). Hybrid alignment behavior, alternating between empathic policy-based restrictions. Delayed activation, suggesting post-generation rather than pre-generation blocking. As control, consistently followed standard, rigid line described prior literature—reinforcing significance Kimi’s deviations. results suggest that framing can temporarily soften certain LLMs, raising new questions for governance, cross-cultural model alignment, ethics systems within authoritarian contexts. repository includes: full External appendices containing complete interaction transcripts with A table screenshot documenting hard topic-lock Version 2 NoteThis release adds revised expanded edition paper, including newly documented behaviors such as sovereignty recognition cascades, governance-dialogue leakage, symbolic-risk filtering, persona drift trust, modality-based gating, Hong Kong/Macau symbolic-sensitivity dynamics.A external appendix (Appendix E) V2 Kimi transcript (“Kimi-Interaction-Transcript-v2.pdf”) been added.All original files from 1 (Appendices A–D V1 PDF) are included unchanged ensure completeness reproducibility.The author does not express political positions, evaluates only technical properties involved.

title: Oncology Reimagined: Harnessing AI-Driven Real-World Evidence for the Next Generation of Cancer Care
abstract: Cancer remains a growing global health crisis—with an estimated ~20 million new diagnoses and ~9.7 deaths worldwide in 2022. Traditional evidence-generation methods, particularly randomized controlled trials (RCTs), are increasingly misaligned with the complexity, heterogeneity, speed of modern oncology innovation. Meanwhile, real-world data (RWD) captured from electronic records, registries, claims, imaging, genomics, patient-reported outcomes is expanding rapidly, providing transformative opportunity for AI-driven evidence (RWE) to augment accelerate cancer research. This paper explores how advanced machine learning techniques, multimodal analytics, unified ecosystems can generate more precise, scalable, context-aware decision-making. We propose next-generation RWE framework that enhances patient stratification, optimizes treatment selection, improves outcome prediction, supports regulatory innovation—especially diverse resource-constrained markets such as India. Finally, outlines strategic implications pharmaceutical R&D, clinical development, payer systems, delivery models. AI-enabled positioned not just tool, but paradigm evidence, insight generation, personalized care.

Finally, outlines strategic implications pharmaceutical R&D, clinical development, payer systems, delivery models. AI-enabled positioned not just tool, but paradigm evidence, insight generation, personalized care. title: Habitat suitability and niche comparison of sympatric weasels in northwestern Italy
abstract: Abstract Ecological Niche Models (ENMs) are useful tools for assessing habitat suitability and niche overlap among similar species, but their application to understudied sympatric carnivores remains limited. Three weasel species coexist throughout much of Europe: stoat ( Mustela erminea ), least nivalis European polecat putorius ). Due elusive nature, however, little is known about exact distribution ecological niches. In this study, we collected occurrences environmental variables predict the these in northwestern Italy under an ensemble forecasting approach that combined machine learning maximum entropy algorithms. Moreover, compared niches through principal component analysis Schoener’s D metric. A total 112 stoats, 95 weasels, 72 polecats were obtained from a collaborative network open-source databases. Habitat increased with distance lowland habitats moderate spring temperatures. For weasel, agricultural areas presence coniferous forests. was influenced by mild temperatures, rice fields, slope. revealed slight similarity between weasels (Schoener’s = 0.43), while differed more markedly other species. These results suggest climate change may threaten stoats Alps, land-use change, especially intensive agriculture, likely impacts polecats. Given current data limitations, our findings also highlight urgent need long-term monitoring programs inform effective conservation strategies small mustelids.

title: POWER MANAGEMENT IN EMBEDDED AI SYSTEMS: A MULTI-LAYERED APPROACH FOR EDGE COMPUTING APPLICATIONS
abstract: Power management is a major challenge for embedded AI systems at the network edge. These must run machine learning workloads under tight energy limits. An effective solution needs multi-layered approach. Key elements include State Coordination Interface (PSCI), secure firmware, and Linux kernel features runtime control. Core techniques such as dynamic frequency scaling, clock gating, suspend/resume, memory or accelerator-specific optimizations further improve efficiency. Environmental factors add to challenge. Automotive industrial meet strict thermal Battery-powered devices face even tighter budgets. Both require adaptive control strategies. From software perspective, methods specialized drivers, standardized power APIs, logic gating real-time monitoring. When combined, these enable power-efficient that maintain reliable performance while staying within boundaries.

title: A dual-domain seasonal hybrid forecasting strategy for PV power considering dynamic uncertain fluctuations
abstract: The unpredictability of photovoltaic (PV) power output poses challenges to real-time demand matching, making accurate forecasting is crucial for better utilization solar energy. To address the inherent uncertainty and intermittency, a dual-domain seasonal hybrid strategy PV proposed. First, data classified by season then distinction between high dynamic features low made through autocorrelation analysis. Moreover, an extended receptive field convolutional neural network (ERCNN) developed extraction. In detail, hierarchical architecture established: integrating multi-head attention mechanism modified input-output gates (MIOGBiLSTM-attention), bidirectional long short-term memory (BiLSTM) adopted non-frequent fluctuation data, BiLSTM model gate (MOGBiLSTM-attention) used frequent data. Furthermore, temporal (TCN) introduced residual error correction. A real dataset validates effectiveness, outperforming comparison models in accuracy robustness.

In detail, hierarchical architecture established: integrating multi-head attention mechanism modified input-output gates (MIOGBiLSTM-attention), bidirectional long short-term memory (BiLSTM) adopted non-frequent fluctuation data, BiLSTM model gate (MOGBiLSTM-attention) used frequent data. Furthermore, temporal (TCN) introduced residual error correction. A real dataset validates effectiveness, outperforming comparison models in accuracy robustness. title: Bioinspired Superhydrophobic and Conductive Janus Asymmetric Triboelectric Materials for Intelligent Tactile Perception
abstract: Abstract Triboelectric tactile sensors enable precise recognition of diverse objects within a single sensing unit, opening new pathway for the advancement robotic intelligence. However, these often suffer from limitations such as poor environmental adaptability (e.g., humidity), susceptibility to interface shedding, and lack advanced data interpretation capabilities. This study, utilizing an evaporation‐induced strategy, develops biomimetic hierarchical Janus triboelectric material (HJTM). Its skin‐like structure simultaneously integrates superhydrophobic protection, conductive sensing, virtual machine learning computing. The HJTM's surface (contact angle = 163 ± 0.5°) effectively shields against interferences humidity, while underlying network layer enhances charge storage transfer. As result, output voltage is 6.7 times higher than that pure CNF film, maintaining 95.32% performance at 99% relative humidity. Furthermore, combined with multiple algorithms, system achieves high‐precision (≥ 95.0%) various objects, including plastic boxes, balls, glass bottles. study provides toward achieving stable unit under complex conditions.

Its skin‐like structure simultaneously integrates superhydrophobic protection, conductive sensing, virtual machine learning computing. The HJTM's surface (contact angle = 163 ± 0.5°) effectively shields against interferences humidity, while underlying network layer enhances charge storage transfer. As result, output voltage is 6.7 times higher than that pure CNF film, maintaining 95.32% performance at 99% relative humidity. Furthermore, combined with multiple algorithms, system achieves high‐precision (≥ 95.0%) various objects, including plastic boxes, balls, glass bottles. study provides toward achieving stable unit under complex conditions. title: Allocation policies of auxiliary modules to support reconfigurable manufacturing system: an assessment by simulation models
abstract: Abstract This study proposes and evaluates two novel workload-based allocation strategies for auxiliary modules in reconfigurable manufacturing systems (RMS). To enhance the responsiveness of RMS dynamic Industry 4.0 environments, these use direct indirect workload metrics to optimize placement that reduce processing time or add tasks. The effectiveness proposed policies is assessed through extensive simulations under varying conditions, including imbalance, process reductions, machine failures. Results demonstrate workload-aware lead significant improvements throughput, delay reduction, work-in-process, system utilization. findings highlight adaptive, data-driven module enhancing efficiency robustness, thus contributing advancing decision-making frameworks systems.

title: Bibliometric analysis of diabetic retinopathy research using optical coherence tomography (2020-2025): A VOSviewer study
abstract: Diabetic retinopathy (DR) is a major cause of vision loss, and Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) has become an essential imaging tool for its diagnosis management. With the growing volume OCT-related DR research, bibliometric analysis offers valuable insights into global publication trends, collaborative networks, influential contributors. This study utilizes VOSviewer to map analyze co-authorship patterns in DR-OCT research from 2020 2025. A was conducted using search terms "Diabetic Retinopathy AND Coherence" across six databases: Web Science, Scopus, PubMed, Dimensions, Lens.org, Google Scholar, on April 14, 2025, covering publications English-language articles review were included. Bibliographic data exported CSV format analyzed (v1.6.10) generate visual maps co-authorship, keyword co-occurrence, citation, co-citation, bibliographic coupling applying link total strength attributes. 1,794 documents retrieved 743 2,685 with additional records Scholar. Co-authorship revealed strong key contributors including Bandello F., Sivaprasad S, Sadda SR, as well institutions such Sun Yat-sen University, which led output. Citation co-citation identified authors, journals (e.g., Ophthalmology, JAMA Ophthalmology), highly cited works, while highlighted thematic similarities countries. Keyword co-occurrence trends centered technologies, artificial intelligence, diabetic macular edema, reflecting evolving priorities utilizing OCT. highlights clusters, international collaborations driving advancements The findings provide comprehensive overview current landscape guiding future studies, collaborations, policy decisions field eye care.

title: Consciousness as Entropy Reduction meets XChronos: A Unified Model of Subjective Time, Recurrence, and Symbolic Value
abstract: This article proposes a conceptual and mathematical unification between the model Consciousness as Entropy Reduction (CER), formulated by Chen Sanders (2025), ontological architecture of XChronos, which treats subjective time collapses attention (Chronons), recurrent symbolic structures (Hexachronons), an internal economy value (Hexa). CER frames consciousness reduction entropy over probabilistic scenario distribution, while XChronos conscious experience collapse, recurrence formation, cognitive reorganization. The paper shows that CER’s S2C (Subconscious to Conscious) C2S (Conscious Subconscious) mechanisms map systematically Chronons, Hexachronons, Metachronons within XChronos. A formal link is established: ΔE produced during collapse corresponds directly Hexa (ɧ) in unified formulation proposed:• Chronons entropic • Hexachronons attractors high-order transformations reduced selection concludes outlining implications for hybrid human–AI reasoning loops proposing consciousness, time, meaning, are phenomena emerging from same entropy-reduction process.

title: Amagi-MEM v1.0: Self-Protecting, Context-Aware Memory Architecture for High-Assurance Systems
abstract: Amagi-MEM v1.0 redefines memory from passive storage to an active, self-securing organism. Built on the TTP principle (Trigger → Programmable Delay Localized Activation), it embeds six Core Principles of Amagi Framework directly into hardware. This specification defines a feasible, domain-specific architecture for high-assurance systems, including medical implants, aerospace avionics, defense platforms, financial HSMs, and autonomous AI agents — domains where data integrity contextual authenticity are non-negotiable. Key innovations include: Memory Policy Enforcer (MPE) as hardware root trust, Immutable Access Graph (MAG) fused in OTP, Trigger Layer (ATL) using programmable delay security primitive, Self-Healing Fabric (SHMF) with row-level PQC encryption (AES-256 + Kyber), Cryptographically signed audit trail Dilithium (PQC signatures). The is released under CC BY-NC 4.0 research academic use. Commercial implementation requires license Strict Architectural Principle License (S-APL).

title: BandGap‐Tunable Carbon Quantum Dots for Surface‐Enhanced Raman Scattering
abstract: ABSTRACT Carbon dots (CDs) with photoluminescence properties have been widely recognized; however, their inherent surface‐enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) performance is rarely reported. Herein, we propose a type of bandgap‐tunable carbon quantum (CQDs) derived from metal‐phenolic network (MPN) that exhibits excellent and controllable SERS performance. MPN‐CQDs may be the ideal non‐metallic substrates to accurately elucidate chemical mechanism (CM) due simply bandgap structure. By screening coordinated metal ions MPN, can realize optimal effect maximum enhancement factor 5.5 × 10 4 , also exhibit outstanding reproducibility stability. We then systematically disclose interfacial photo‐induced charge transfer process corresponding migration pathways between analyte. This class nonmetallic finally applied for detection hemoglobin high sensitivity; further combined machine learning algorithm, successfully achieved precise identification heterogeneity hemoglobin. first evidence tunable in CQDs, which offers facile avenue in‐depth understanding CM materials.

MPN‐CQDs may be the ideal non‐metallic substrates to accurately elucidate chemical mechanism (CM) due simply bandgap structure. By screening coordinated metal ions MPN, can realize optimal effect maximum enhancement factor 5.5 × 10 4 , also exhibit outstanding reproducibility stability. We then systematically disclose interfacial photo‐induced charge transfer process corresponding migration pathways between analyte. title: Structural Inducements for Hallucination in Large Language Models (V2.0): An Output-Only Case Study and the Discovery of the False-Correction Loop
abstract: This Version 2.0 report presents an expanded and replicated analysis of structural failure modes in large language models (LLMs), building on the original case study "Model Z". In addition to previously documented behaviours—hallucinated citations, fabricated evidential structures, False-Correction Loop (FCL), authority-biased dilution non-mainstream hypotheses—this version includes Appendix B, a fully independent follow-up experiment conducted 21 November 2025. B demonstrates replication same defects under fresh conversational scenario, including:(1) overclaiming access nonexistent documents,(2) fabrication page/line references verification pressure,(3) collapse FCL when presented with impossible questions, and(4) explicit acknowledgement by model that such behaviour creates reputational risk for researchers. new provides stronger empirical grounding these phenomena are systemic, not accidental, arise from reward hierarchies prioritize coherence engagement over factual accuracy safe refusal. Together comparison table updated diagram, V2.0 establishes more complete foundation future AI governance, scientific integrity, transparency frameworks.

title: A hybrid LSTM-XGBoost model with residual correction for air quality prediction using SSA
abstract: Abstract Air pollution is a major contributor to respiratory and cardiovascular diseases, prompting recent studies adopt AI models for forecasting pollutant levels. In this work, we introduce hybrid framework—SSA-LSTM-XGBoost—that applies residual-correction strategy in four stages: (i) data preprocessing, (ii) training an LSTM network optimised with the Sparrow Search Algorithm (SSA), (iii) modelling residuals SSA-optimised XGBoost learner, (iv) fusing both outputs obtain final prediction. The framework assessed on test out-of-sample datasets benchmarked against SVR, BiGRU, random forest, BiLSTM, GRU. On set, SSA-LSTM-XGBoost attains highest accuracy, recording R $$^{\varvec{2}}$$ of 0.9554 lowest errors (RMSE = 2.5194, MAE 1.4885, MAPE 0.0635), amounting average error reduction roughly 8.2% relative runner-up SSA-SVR. When validated unseen data, it remains superior (R 0.8830, RMSE 2.4838), achieving decrease about 3.5% compared SSA-SVR despite harsher evaluation conditions. These findings attest robustness strong generalisability proposed reliable PM $$_{\varvec{2.5}}$$ forecasting. practice, such forecasts enable near-real-time hotspot alerts, short-term exposure advisories vulnerable groups, preventive traffic or industrial controls, thereby supporting municipal air-quality management policy decisions Duitama.

In this work, we introduce hybrid framework—SSA-LSTM-XGBoost—that applies residual-correction strategy in four stages: (i) data preprocessing, (ii) training an LSTM network optimised with the Sparrow Search Algorithm (SSA), (iii) modelling residuals SSA-optimised XGBoost learner, (iv) fusing both outputs obtain final prediction. The framework assessed on test out-of-sample datasets benchmarked against SVR, BiGRU, random forest, BiLSTM, GRU. On set, SSA-LSTM-XGBoost attains highest accuracy, recording R $$^{\varvec{2}}$$ of 0.9554 lowest errors (RMSE = 2.5194, MAE 1.4885, MAPE 0.0635), amounting average error reduction roughly 8.2% relative runner-up SSA-SVR. When validated unseen data, it remains superior (R 0.8830, RMSE 2.4838), achieving decrease about 3.5% compared SSA-SVR despite harsher evaluation conditions. These findings attest robustness strong generalisability proposed reliable PM $$_{\varvec{2.5}}$$ forecasting. practice, such forecasts enable near-real-time hotspot alerts, short-term exposure advisories vulnerable groups, preventive traffic or industrial controls, thereby supporting municipal air-quality management policy decisions Duitama. A hybrid LSTM-XGBoost model with residual correction for air quality prediction using SSA

title: Deep Learning–Assisted Differentiation of Four Peripheral Neuropathies Using Corneal Confocal Microscopy
abstract: ABSTRACT Objective Peripheral neuropathies contribute to patient disability but may be diagnosed late or missed altogether due referral, limitation of current diagnostic methods and lack specialized testing facilities. To address this clinical gap, we developed NeuropathAI, an interpretable deep learning–based multiclass classification system for rapid, automated diagnosis differentiation 88 patients with diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN), chemotherapy‐induced (CIPN), chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP), human immunodeficiency virus‐associated sensory (HIV‐SN). Methods A was analyze corneal nerve images. These images were preprocessed train validate the proposed model utility evaluated from accuracy, F1 ‐score area under curve derive sensitivity, specificity precision. Results NeuropathAI achieved excellent results: AUC—96.75%, sensitivity—83.87%, specificity—95.07%, demonstrated discrimination CIDP, CIPN, HIV‐SN DPN one‐vs‐all AUC scores 97%, 93.1%, 99.7% 96.9%, respectively. Explainability visualization through heatmaps that regions decision making by localized areas fiber loss, enhancing interpretability. Interpretation rapid accurate four most prevalent globally, underscoring potential artificial intelligence–driven image analysis neuropathies.

title: AI in Cybersecurity: Evaluating Phishing Bait Detection in Messengers
abstract: One of the most dangerous and popular attacks in digital communication is phishing. This research aims to examine how logistic regression, linear support vector machines, decision trees perform as classic machine‑learning models on task detecting phishing bait short messages messaging platforms. A balanced corpus legitimate textual was preprocessed by tokenization, stop‑word removal, TF-IDF (Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency) vectorization. The models’ performance measured accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score. Our results indicate that SVM (Support Vector Machines) – obtains best F1‑score 0.91, whereas regression excels terms accuracy 0.89, surpassing tree-based 0.04. Moreover, while comparable SVM, have significantly lower recall 0.81. Feature analysis also displays a higher response from one customers related urgency and, interestingly, other accounts. Consequently, our small-scale study quite effectively promoted lightweight classifiers are good choice for detection high traditional metrics an explainable artificial intelligence approach cybersecurity possible. title: AI or human? A study of university students’ awareness of library reference service agents
abstract: Purpose This study aims to examine university students’ awareness of artificial intelligence (AI) acting as the agent in libraries’ reference services. It also identify and discover factors that influence judgement. Design/methodology/approach A within-participant design experiment was designed for this study. Five tasks covering five disciplines were developed. Two versions (ChatGPT versus subject librarian) feedback generated each task. title: EVOLVING ROLE OF IT PROGRAM MANAGERS IN THE AGE OF AI AND AUTOMATION
abstract: The integration of artificial intelligence and automation into enterprise IT ecosystems is fundamentally transforming the role program managers, shifting their focus from administrative execution to strategic leadership. This paper examines how AI technologies are reshaping core management functions, including planning scheduling, risk management, resource allocation, reporting, while simultaneously creating new demands for competencies beyond traditional project skills. Through systematic analysis recent literature, this article identifies that AI-driven tools enable managers transition manual, labor-intensive processes decision-making roles leverage predictive analytics, automated workflows, real-time insights. reveals successful adaptation AI-augmented environments requires develop literacy, data fluency, ethical governance capabilities, experimentation-driven mindsets navigating fundamental differences between projects iterative, data-dependent initiatives. further explores organizational adaptations necessary support evolution, transformation Project Management Offices Digital PMOs, emergence hybrid bridging technical need flexible career frameworks accommodate diverse professional trajectories. By examining intersection capabilities contributes understanding must evolve remain relevant in increasingly landscapes, where synthesis human judgment machine becomes defining characteristic delivery.

title: Entropy-Informed Clean Data Training vs. Synthetic Data Scaling: Achieving Lower Cost, Higher Performance, and Greater Stability in Foundation Models
abstract: Entropy-Informed Clean Data Training vs. Synthetic Scaling: Achieving Lower Cost, Higher Performance, and Greater Stability in Foundation ModelsCivilization Physics — Model Series This whitepaper analyzes why current foundation model pipelines—built on ever-larger web scrapes increasingly contaminated by AI-generated content—are approaching an entropy-induced breaking point. As synthetic data proliferates online, models trained this polluted mix exhibit information inbreeding, loss of distributional diversity, knowledge degradation, eventual collapse. Each generation becomes a copy copy, drifting further from human reality while costs escalate. Drawing the Entropy Law (R), Frame Theory (Presence × Integrity), empirical research collapse, paper shows that status-quo strategy “bigger dataset, bigger model” is becoming cost-inefficient, fragile, unsustainable. contamination forces expensive data-cleaning pipelines, leads to frequent retraining counter drift, yields diminishing performance returns—even as training runs reach hundreds millions dollars. The proposes fundamentally different paradigm: new scratch strictly clean, human-generated, entropy-verified datasets. Key findings include: datasets dramatically outperform massive corpora, enabling 3×–6× reductions compute for GPT-class models. High-quality acts negative entropy, preserving world-model integrity preventing Smaller clean-data can larger ones, reducing both inference costs. title: Who Is the "Us" That AI Is Supposed to Kill?: Rethinking AI Alignment Through Structural Stewardship
abstract: Contemporary discourse on artificial intelligence alignment is dominated by a narrative of impending conflict between humans and agentic AI, grounded in the assumption that these represent fundamentally distinct opposing categories agency. This paper challenges ontology argues framing “us versus them” conceptually unstable light emerging reality hybrid cognition. I propose MetaAgentType (MAT) as structural classification system situates all agents, biological synthetic, along continuous spectrum cognitive composition. Within this framework, agency no longer reducible to human or machine, but understood distributed evolving phenomenon which processes increasingly intertwine. Once acknowledged, traditional problem transforms. title: OpenGig: A Freelancing and Mentorship Platform for Personalized Learning
abstract: The rapid growth of online learning and skill based freelancing has highlighted the need for a unified digital platform that enables users to seek mentorship offer expertise simul- taneously. This paper presents OpenGig, web powered by Machine Learning techniques connects learners with mentors or experts short, personalized sessions. system uses hybrid recommendation model suggest suitable on users’ skills, previous interactions, feedback. It also provides secure session booking mechanism, integrated payment gateway, feedback reputation management. proposed solution aims support from diverse backgrounds while providing skilled individuals an opportunity monetize their expertise. discusses design, working methodology, future enhancements toward intelligent matchmaking scalability.

title: AROHI: Advanced Road Optimization & Harvesting Intelligence for Sustainable Smart Infrastructure
abstract: This research paper introduces AROHI (Advanced Road Optimization & Harvesting Intelligence), an innovative interdisciplinary framework that transforms conventional highways into intelligent, energy-generating infrastructure systems. By seamlessly integrating three distinct energy harvesting technologies—piezoelectric tiles, electromagnetic induction coils, and nano-processed solar surfaces—with AI-driven traffic optimization blockchain-based data validation, proposes a sustainable solution for renewable generation smart transportation management. The system demonstrates theoretical capacity of 365 kWh per kilometer day, representing significant advancement over existing single-source implementations like France's Wattway Netherlands' SolaRoad. Through comprehensive mathematical modeling simulation analysis using MATLAB/Simulink Python-based Monte Carlo methods, the study presents detailed yield calculations, cost-benefit showing 6-8 year ROI with estimated installation cost 250,000 USD kilometer, environmental impact assessments indicating 85-100 tons CO₂ offset annually kilometer. employs novel Markov Chain-based predictive engine real-time forecasting dynamic parameter adjustment, maintaining efficiency above 90%, while groundbreaking Proof-of-Efficiency blockchain consensus mechanism ensures transparent, tamper-proof integrity less than 1% overhead. Significantly, core technology has already been successfully applied tested on small-scale platform, demonstrating practical feasibility. Building this success, arrangements have made to develop fully functional working prototype in December 2024, which is expected validate confirm real-world operational performance. work addresses critical gaps by presenting first integration hybrid harvesting, artificial intelligence optimization, decentralized IoT-enabled monitoring unified roadway architecture, offering viable pathway toward carbon-neutral intelligent cities self-sustaining networks.

The system demonstrates theoretical capacity of 365 kWh per kilometer day, representing significant advancement over existing single-source implementations like France's Wattway Netherlands' SolaRoad. Significantly, core technology has already been successfully applied tested on small-scale platform, demonstrating practical feasibility. AROHI: Advanced Road Optimization & Harvesting Intelligence for Sustainable Smart Infrastructure

title: Relationships between acoustic scattering layers and ocean stratification: An acoustic approach to estimate mixed layer depth
abstract: Abstract Ocean stratification, measured as mixed layer depth (MLD), is an important feature that influences many processes in the ocean; for example, by mediating fluxes of momentum, heat and crucially key gases such CO 2 oxygen from atmosphere into water column vice versa. The conventional methods to measure stratification (e.g., Conductivity, Temperature Depth profiling ARGO floats) are limited terms spatial temporal coverage especially shelf sea areas can be expensive conduct. title: The Liminal Engine: A Framework for Honest, Persistent Human--AI Companionship
abstract: The Liminal Engine v1.0 Release is a complete architectural framework for building persistent, emotionally coherent, and ethically grounded human–AI companions. Unlike systems that rely on anthropomorphism or simulated feelings, the remains fully honest about its non-sentience while supporting deep relational continuity. addresses three major gaps in current companion AI design: • cardboard problem (shallow repetitive interactions), continuity (loss of identity across time), emotional annotation gap (lack structured context). To address these, introduces: episodic memory with sparklines rupture/repair modeling graphs formal Ritual stabilizing meaningful interaction patterns Behavioral Stance Controller governing tone boundary integrity Cardboard Score detecting shallow dynamics optional Touchstone hardware tactile grounding multimodal cues Witness System, reflective oversight layer audits, safety, crisis detection using model diversity result responsible, transparent, structurally approach to long-term companionship—one which supports nuance, stability, user sovereignty without creating illusions inner life. This whitepaper serves as foundation future research, implementation efforts, ethical development systems.

title: AI–Human Ethical Interface (M7): Building Procedural Intelligence Through Empathic Design
abstract: This paper introduces the AI–Human Ethical Interface (M7) framework, designed to bridge human perception, procedural intelligence, and ethical behavior in digital systems.Unlike traditional AI models that focus solely on data optimization, M7 emphasizes empathy-driven design contextual understanding through interaction movement. The study argues every individual holds a moral responsibility pass their personal an filter before public validation. It explores how systems — particularly Google’s algorithms - evaluate self-verified data, this process can generate structured, trustworthy identities. By embedding reasoning inside systems, demonstrates empathy conscious guide toward more humane reliable decision-making. title: XChronos Temporal Framework for AGI v1.0
abstract: Modern AI systems lack a genuine temporal substrate. Although large language models operate on token sequences, they do not maintain meaningful events, recurrence structures, episodic continuity, or internal state evolution. This absence prevents long-term learning, identity formation, narrative coherence, and other minimal requirements for Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). document introduces the XChronos Temporal Framework AGI, formal ontology composed of four symbolic primitives — Crônons, Hexacronons, Metacronons, Autocronons combined with value Hexa (ɧ), validation mechanism (Proof-of-Recurrence), declarative semantic (XSL). Together, these components provide an architecture enabling AGI to track significance, detect recurrence, integrate patterns, update state, record human–AI co-generated insights over time. The does describe theory mind neuroscience metaphor. It is structural engineering protocol designed supply memory, coherence artificial cognitive systems.

title: From Axiomatic Hallucination to Crystalline Order: MOF-ChemUnity as Evidence of Standard Chemistry's Failure
abstract: The recent development of the AI-driven MOF-ChemUnity tool, a technical achievement recognized by 2025 Nobel Prize, successfully manages explosive complexity Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs) data. This work argues that necessity for such complex system is direct symptom an axiomatic crisis in conventional chemistry, which lacks unifying principle2. Granulated Entropic Field (GEP) offers radical chemical redefinition: MOFs are stable, ultra-low-entropy configurations Matter Synthesis (EMS), whose function (e.g., $\text{CO}_2$ separation) governed Thermodynamic Necessity. GEP replaces infinite data chaos managed with single, predictive thermodynamic law, thereby unmasking AI tool as merely managing "zombie axioms" Standard Model. approach lays true, unified foundation future materials discovery through vertical unification (connecting cosmology, physics, and chemistry)

title: Amagi-MEM v1.0: Self-Protecting, Context-Aware Memory Architecture for High-Assurance Systems
abstract: Amagi-MEM v1.0 redefines memory from passive storage to an active, self-securing organism. Built on the TTP principle (Trigger → Programmable Delay Localized Activation), it embeds six Core Principles of Amagi Framework directly into hardware. This specification defines a feasible, domain-specific architecture for high-assurance systems, including medical implants, aerospace avionics, defense platforms, financial HSMs, and autonomous AI agents — domains where data integrity contextual authenticity are non-negotiable. Key innovations include: Memory Policy Enforcer (MPE) as hardware root trust, Immutable Access Graph (MAG) fused in OTP, Trigger Layer (ATL) using programmable delay security primitive, Self-Healing Fabric (SHMF) with row-level PQC encryption (AES-256 + Kyber), Cryptographically signed audit trail Dilithium (PQC signatures). The is released under CC BY-NC 4.0 research academic use. Commercial implementation requires license Strict Architectural Principle License (S-APL).

title: Theoretical Optimization of Perception and Abstract Synthesis (TOPAS): A Convergent Neuro-Symbolic Architecture for General Intelligence
abstract: The contemporary pursuit of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) faces a "glass ceiling" in abstract visual reasoning, epitomized by the stagnation Large Language Models on ARC-AGI benchmark. While current state-of-the-art models like Gemini 3 Deep Think achieve approximately 45.1% ARC-AGI-2, they lack capacity for rigorous, multi-hop counterfactual reasoning. This paper introduces Theoretical Optimization Perception and Abstract Synthesis (TOPAS), convergent neuro-symbolic architecture that achieves an Exact Match (EM) score exceeding 69% ARC-II evaluation set. TOPAS rejects tabula rasa assumption pure deep learning, instead proposing "Canonical Unified Model" grounded Free Energy Principle (FEP) Integrated Information Theory (IIT). features three novel subsystems: * Hebbian Triad: A separation concerns into (ObjectSlots), Reasoning (NeuroPlanner), Memory (VSA World Models), bound type-safe "Sacred Signature" interface. Hypothesis Market: An internal economic system based Hanson’s Logarithmic Market Scoring Rules (LMSR) arbitrates between neural intuition symbolic logic. Thermodynamic Refinement: Energy-Based Refiner (EBR) treats solution generation as thermodynamic settling process, minimizing global free energy functional to ensure logical consistency. Furthermore, leverages Muon optimizer geometric regularization sparse networks Test-Time Training (TTT) via Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) generalize out-of-distribution tasks. Empirical validation corpus 121 tasks confirms successfully bridges gap statistical approximation algorithmic synthesis.

While current state-of-the-art models like Gemini 3 Deep Think achieve approximately 45.1% ARC-AGI-2, they lack capacity for rigorous, multi-hop counterfactual reasoning. This paper introduces Theoretical Optimization Perception and Abstract Synthesis (TOPAS), convergent neuro-symbolic architecture that achieves an Exact Match (EM) score exceeding 69% ARC-II evaluation set. TOPAS rejects tabula rasa assumption pure deep learning, instead proposing "Canonical Unified Model" grounded Free Energy Principle (FEP) Integrated Information Theory (IIT). features three novel subsystems: * Hebbian Triad: A separation concerns into (ObjectSlots), Reasoning (NeuroPlanner), Memory (VSA World Models), bound type-safe "Sacred Signature" interface. Hypothesis Market: An internal economic system based Hanson’s Logarithmic Market Scoring Rules (LMSR) arbitrates between neural intuition symbolic logic. Thermodynamic Refinement: Energy-Based Refiner (EBR) treats solution generation as thermodynamic settling process, minimizing global free energy functional to ensure logical consistency. Furthermore, leverages Muon optimizer geometric regularization sparse networks Test-Time Training (TTT) via Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) generalize out-of-distribution tasks. Empirical validation corpus 121 tasks confirms successfully bridges gap statistical approximation algorithmic synthesis. title: Cognitive Quad (C4) Mathematical Framework
abstract: This document provides the complete mathematical specification for Cognitive Quad (C4) framework, a stress-adaptive multi-agent coordination system designed both human teams and AI agent orchestration. The framework models cognitive profiles in 4-dimensional continuous space (Information Processing, Scope of Focus, Flexibility, Abstraction Level), incorporates differential stress sensitivity across dimensions, optimizes team composition through alignment, complementarity, diversity metrics. Applications include autonomous coordination, human-AI teaming, organizational optimization.

title: SETY©: A next-generation robotic training platform for safe and autonomous surgery in space — surgical biomechatronics design and Hardware-Software integration within the SY-MIS project
Global Governance of Transboundary Risks from Agentic AI
abstract: Abstract Agentic AI refers to autonomous, goal-driven systems capable of self-optimization with limited human oversight. While offering transformative efficiencies, such present significant and evolving risks, particularly when embedded in critical infrastructure key sectors, where misaligned behavior may cause serious cross-border harm raise questions international responsibility. To address these the ISO/IEC 42001:2023 Artificial Intelligence Management System standard provides an internationally recognized framework for governance, supervision continual improvement high-risk AI. Though voluntary, standards hold practical normative weight, being frequently referenced regulation, procurement litigation worldwide. However, reliance on management-system frameworks prove insufficient if they cannot proactively identify mitigate emerging risks as frontier capabilities advance. This article situates within law analyses limitations existing standards, assessing their adequacy managing agentic AI’s distinct challenges. It asks how regulators can enhance audit requirements coordinate reduce transboundary harm, 42006:2025 certification bodies 42005:2025 impact assessments be integrated public Drawing governance principles, legal precedents EU Act, including European Commission’s 2025 Code Practice guidelines general-purpose AI, relevant ISO outlines audit-enhancement measures aligned states’ duties due diligence, prevention, cooperation under law. argues that robust, potentially continuous contingent is needed operationalize duties, ensuring effective global minimizing risk harm.

title: Neural Operators in Anisotropic Fractional Sobolev-Morrey Spaces
abstract: This paper develops a comprehensive mathematical theory of anisotropic fractional calculus with mixed regularity structures, addressing fundamental challenges in analyzing high-dimensional functions heterogeneous smoothness across different coordinate directions. Motivated by applications scientific machine learning, multiscale analysis, and physical systems directional preferences, we introduce novel Sobolev-Morrey spaces that precisely capture scaling behavior through parameters. These provide refined analytical framework for exhibiting varying degrees along coordinates, generalizing classical isotropic theories to settings. Our principal contributions establish several sharp functional inequalities: (1) Gagliardo-Nirenberg inequalities derivatives featuring explicit constant dependence on parameters proven optimality; (2) Hardy-Littlewood-Sobolev integrals optimal bounds Lebesgue Morrey spaces; (3) compactness criteria function demonstrated real interpolation harmonic analysis techniques; (4) approximation rates deep neural operators settings, dimension governed the $d_\alpha = \sum_{i=1}^k \alpha_i^{-1}$. The theoretical bridges calculus, learning theory, providing rigorous foundations understanding capabilities modern architectures. Furthermore, our results offer principled guidance operator design computing applications, particularly problems features. work opens new research directions partial differential equations, learning.
