title: Hybrid Learning Enables Reproducible >24% Efficiency in Autonomously Fabricated Perovskites Solar Cells
abstract: ABSTRACT Achieving high‐performance perovskite solar cells (PSCs) with satisfactory reproducibility remains a major challenge due to their intrinsic susceptibility processing variations and environmental fluctuations. To address this challenge, study introduces an autonomous optimization framework that integrates hybrid machine learning high‐throughput experimentation modified gradient ascent methods optimize fabrication processes minimize experimental variances. The successfully maps the complex, non‐linear interdependencies between parameters reveals critical decoupling of photovoltaic metrics. Optimization across seven rounds 144 parameter sets results in pronounced power conversion efficiency (PCE) enhancement on platform. optimized procedure delivers champion devices achieving PCEs exceeding 24%, surpassing experience manual operator performance (20.6% PCE, CV >25%) reducing coefficient variation (CV) below 4.7%, improvements consistently validated independent trials. This work offers practical strategy for improving PSC reproducibility, while laying foundation scalable manufacturing accelerated materials development.

This work offers practical strategy for improving PSC reproducibility, while laying foundation scalable manufacturing accelerated materials development. title: Amagi-NIPU v1.0: Neuro-Immune Processing Unit for Ethical, High-Assurance AI Systems
abstract: Amagi-TTP Neuro-Immune Processing Unit (NIPU) v1.0 is a specification for computational organism designed exclusively ethical, high-assurance AI systems. NIPU fundamentally rejects the performance-first model of traditional CPU/GPU architectures, prioritizing structural safety, auditability, and compliance (as defined by Amagi Framework v1.0) consequence-aware intelligence. The system to sleep default, activate only on verified triggers, defend itself like neuro-immune system. Built TTP principle (Trigger → Programmable Delay Localized Activation), enforces six Core Principles via physical isolation cryptographic root-of-trust components: Security Council (SCC): Hardware Root Trust Policy Enforcement Engine. Trigger–Delay Fabric (TDF): Implements time-delay as security primitive (1 ns 1 s). Isolated Clusters: Physically separated Analytical, Generative, Communicative, Executive cores. Intercluster Communication Graph (ICG): OTP-stored, cryptographically signed flow matrix. Key Guarantee: ensures that unsafe or unauthorized computation cannot occur — not even in theory. This architecture specified deployment life-critical mission-critical domains, including medical implants, autonomous agents with real-world authority, critical infrastructure control Commercial use requires valid license under Strict Architectural Principle License (S-APL).

title: AI-Powered Travel Itinerary Planner Using Next.js, TypeScript, Convex, and LLM Integration
abstract: The rapid expansion of digital tourism platforms has increased the demand for intelligent systems capable generating personalized and structured travel itineraries. Traditional planning requires users to manually compile information from dispersed sources, which often results in inefficiencies, inconsistencies, cognitive overload. To reduce human effort enhance personalization, this research introduces an AI- powered itinerary planner that integrates Large Language Models (LLMs) with a modern full-stack architecture combining Next.js, TypeScript, Convex, cloud-based authentication. proposed platform allows specify destination preferences, duration stay, budget constraints, individual interests. system then produces detailed coherent includes day- wise activity distribution, descriptions attractions, approximate time, geolocation coordinates, recommended routes. Through dynamic server-side rendering, real- time backend synchronization, interactive map visualization, delivers seamless efficient experience. Experimental evaluation through user studies revealed significant improvement efficiency satisfaction. findings demonstrate potential AI-generated content scalable web technologies reinvent future automated planning.

title: Exploring Speech Language Pathologist’s Awareness and Attitude Towards Artificial Intelligence in Dysphagia
abstract: Objectives Over the past decade, speech language pathologists (SLPs) have become key figures in evaluation, diagnosis, and management of dysphagia. Their evaluations may involve bedside assessments, inpatient outpatient evaluations, as well interventions. Artificial intelligence (AI) applications revolutionised healthcare, making patient monitoring through virtual care advanced wearable technology a standard practice. Numerous AI-based applications, such SWALLO, Gokuri, Swallowscope, are available for assessment However, it has been observed that SLPs often continue to rely on traditional methods swallowing To date, no study specifically examined awareness attitudes towards using dysphagia intervention India. The objective this is assess overall perceptions integrating AI into their daily Material Methods A cross-sectional was conducted convenience sampling. unfolded two phases. In first phase, questionnaire developed, content validation done by three professional with expertise second phase involved gathering responses Google Forms sent online 97 working diverse settings, clinics, hospitals, institutes aimed knowledge, awareness, regarding use Results Out survey SLPs, majority (64.9%) held BASLP degree, 27.8% (n=27) had an MSc SLP, 6.2% (n=6) completed MASLP, 1% (n=1) PhD, most specialised both adult paediatric populations (74%). only 14.3% taken course terms 20.6% participants were aware dysphagia, mere 16.5% frequently used them. Despite limited use, more than half (53.6%) viewed tools positively, recognising time-saving benefits, ability enhance diagnosis intervention, potential remote accessibility. finding general optimism among 44.32% respondents about AI’s future role, though 34.02% unsure or lacked experience, emphasising need education training. Conclusion This highlights necessity formal training SLPs. While there enthusiasm improve care, uncertainty remains major barrier its adoption management. address this, increasing providing hands-on could facilitate integration Although therapy still emerging India, targeted programs bridge knowledge gaps lead improved outcomes.

title: Review of AI Chatbot for College Website
abstract: The digital interface of an educational institution, primarily its website, serves as the first point contact and a continuous resource for students, parents, staff. It is tasked with disseminating vast array critical information, including admission procedures, academic calendars, examination schedules, faculty details, campus announcements. Traditionally, this information presented through static web pages, requiring users to navigate complex menus sift extensive text find specific details. This often becomes time-consuming frustrating process, particularly during peak periods such admissions or examinations, leading delays user dissatisfaction

title: Ability of AI detection tools and humans to accurately identify different forms of AI-generated written content
abstract: Abstract Background The increasing use of artificial intelligence (AI) by scholars presents a pressing challenge to healthcare publishing. While legitimate can potentially accelerate scholarship, unethical approaches also exist, leading factually inaccurate and biased text that may degrade scholarship. Numerous online AI detection tools exist provide percentage score use. These assist authors editors in navigating this landscape. In study, we compared the scores from three (ZeroGPT, PhraslyAI, Grammarly Detector) across five plausible conditions evaluated them against human assessments. Methods Thirty open access articles published journals Advances Simulation Healthcare prior 2022 were selected, article introductions extracted. Five experimental examined, including: (1) 100% written; (2) written, light editing; (3) heavy (4) written content; (5) title. resulting materials assessed open-access blinded raters. Results summarized descriptively using repeated measures analysis variance (ANOVA), intraclass correlation coefficients (ICC), Bland–Altman plots. able differentiate between test ( p < 0.001 for all), but varied significantly absolute score, with ICC ranging 0.57 0.95, raising concerns regarding overall reliability these tools. Human scoring was far less consistent, an accuracy 19%, indistinguishable chance. Conclusion existing meaningfully distinguish conditions, is variable. uniformly low. Use journal determining they should not be relied upon alone at time.

title: On adversarial attack detection in intrusion detection system with graph neural network
abstract: Abstract To date, machine learning models have been widely applied to intrusion detection system (IDS) for improving accuracy, where most IDS suffer from adversarial evasion attacks that may lead data loss and user privacy leakage. Although there numerous solutions proposed against attacks, they often neglect the relationships between different traffic heavily relied on labels. Therefore, this paper proposes AEDGNN, a new approach detecting using graph neural network (GNN) model. On one hand, AEDGNN employs E-GraphSAGE capture topology in building relationship inputs. other utilizes deep infomax (DGI) train GNN self-supervised manner maximizing mutual information local global representations. In addition, clarify practical performance of defending traditional we implement classic based CIC-IDS2018 benchmark dataset. The experimental results show achieves significant improvements both normal samples compared solutions. accuracy is 0.02%–1.53% higher than samples, 26.04%–59.04% samples.

title: The Perfect Storm: Systemic Vulnerability of Large Language Models to Solar Weather
abstract: First systematic investigation of correlations between space weather events and AI/LLM operational failures. Analysis 700+ documented incidents across major AI platforms (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) during January-November 2025 reveals that solar windows increase system failure rates by 1,150% (p < .001, Cohen's d = 1.90) within a characteristic 24-72 hour lag window following geomagnetic storms. Statistical validation using permutation testing with 50,000 iterations demonstrates highly significant temporal associations activity infrastructure Findings suggest vulnerability through geomagnetically induced currents affecting power delivery systems enhanced cosmic radiation increasing bit-flip in computational hardware. Includes hypothesis regarding potential training corruption periods elevated activity. Complete dataset publicly available for independent verification.

Statistical validation using permutation testing with 50,000 iterations demonstrates highly significant temporal associations activity infrastructure Findings suggest vulnerability through geomagnetically induced currents affecting power delivery systems enhanced cosmic radiation increasing bit-flip in computational hardware. Includes hypothesis regarding potential training corruption periods elevated activity. Complete dataset publicly available for independent verification. The Perfect Storm: Systemic Vulnerability of Large Language Models to Solar Weather

title: Unveiling spatio-temporal shifts in the eco-hydrological state of an alpine lake using integrated GIS, geo-statistics, and machine learning approaches: insights into wetland sustainability
abstract: ABSTRACT Mountain wetlands in the Himalayas are under increasing anthropogenic and climatic stress. In this study, a combined approach using GIS, geostatistical, machine learning was adopted to analyse water quality spatio-temporal changes eco-hydrological state of Khecheopalri Lake, RAMSAR wetland situated Sikkim, India. Observed parameters calculated indices (pH: 5.3; nutrient index: 4.73; Organic Pollution Index: 1.49) indicated Class II level contamination. The results suggested that lake eutrophic, with organic pollution spreading throughout system, prompting immediate intervention protect lake's resources communities depend on them. surface area decreased by approximately 3.8% (from 0.079 km2 2013 0.076 2023), forecasting suggests potential ∼4% additional decline 2033 same conditions. These findings revealed distinct transformations highlighted areas within vulnerable external influences. study provides valuable insights into interplay human interventions natural processes shaping quality. Moreover, it contributes sustainable management freshwater alignment SDG6, aiming mitigate threats ensure long-term viability as vital ecological economic resource.

title: Large-scale silicon photonics switches for AI/ML interconnections based on a 300-mm CMOS pilot line
abstract: Abstract Silicon photonics switches are emerging as a key technology for realizing energy-efficient networks, spanning from intra data center to wafer-scale interconnections. title: Privacy Enhancing Technologies for Intelligent Healthcare: Research Challenges and Opportunities
abstract: The efficient and secure processing of confidential health data always remained an important challenge for healthcare professionals policymakers as this information needs to be shared among several parties both analytics improved treatments. In regard, Privacy Enhancing Technologies (PETs) have already shown great potential in deploying intelligent systems prognosis diagnosis. title: An Approach to AI High-Velocity Development Through Systematic Context Engineering: A Case Study
abstract: ABSTRACTAI-assisted development promises substantial velocity gains, yet teams routinely fall short due to context loss and fragmented workflows. This paper introduces a two-layer engineering architecture that treats as first-class system: (1) declarative rule layer encodes stable invariants, (2) programmatic Model Context Protocol (MCP) exposes live project structure AI agents. sits within broader four-pillar synthesis consisting of an AI-optimized zero-friction stack, disciplined prompt workflows, the system, agentic orchestration patterns. We evaluate approach through production-grade, multi-tenant SaaS platform (220k+ LoC) built by two part-time developers in fifteen weeks. Analysis 3,676 AI-assisted sessions shows Reuse Efficiency rose from 90.1% 92.2% Generative Amplification declined 5.4% 4.6%, consistent with shift generative substitution retrieval-augmented reuse became systematized. Using Design Science Research framework, we show pattern is feasible at production scale produces measurable effects on velocity. While based single case, metrics establish foundation for practitioners researchers validate extend these practices across diverse contexts.

title: Campus Resonance AI: A Recursive Communication Architecture for Modern Universities
abstract: CampusPulse AI: A Recursive Communication Architecture for Modern Universities presents a next-generation framework transforming academic communication, student engagement, and institutional intelligence. Built on YFRL’s recursive epistemic foundations, this whitepaper introduces AI as dynamic communication nervous system that continuously learns, adapts, evolves with behaviour priorities. The paper outlines the collapse of traditional linear models in higher education proposes recursive, non-halting intelligence architecture solution. integrates intent recognition, graph modelling, tensors, adaptive nudging, well-being sensing, research discovery broadcasting, real-time engagement analytics into unified system. It demonstrates how loops enhance strengthen placement readiness, increase participation, reduce dropout rates, transform university branding. further extends toward multi-campus resonance networks, industry-aligned ecosystems, long-term vision global brain. This serves blueprint universities, researchers, policy-makers, technologists seeking to build future intelligent, student-centric education—powered by AI, aligned through recursion, guided ethical framework.

title: A Conceptual Framework for a Human Supervised Dual-UUV System Enabling Autonomous Maritime Surveillance
abstract: This work presents a conceptual framework for collaborative dual-UUV (Underwater Unmanned Vehicle) system designed autonomous maritime surveillance in coastal and restricted waters. The proposed architecture separates detection response into two specialized platforms: micro-scale stealth UUV passive acoustic localization of surface vessels, larger Secondary Deployment (SDUUV) operating under human-in-the-loop control inspection, identification, tagging missions. micro-UUV employs acoustics, inertial navigation, pressure-based depth estimation, bearing-only tracking to autonomously detect vessels at ranges up 500–1500 meters. Detected target coordinates are transmitted via low-frequency underwater communication the SDUUV, enabling operator-driven close-range assessment using optical sensors. paper develops theoretical models detection, classification, TDOA-based bearing extended Kalman filter localization, shallow-water performance. is fully non-lethal emphasizes strict human oversight accordance with international law ethical systems guidelines. preprint aims support researchers working systems, marine robotics, sensor fusion, technologies.
